author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: The incoming information on inflation shows that the disinflation process is well on track.
Rationale: The speech discusses a recent rate cut and acknowledges that while inflation is moderating, domestic inflation pressures remain. The somewhat dovish stance is indicated by the focus on downside growth risks and maintaining a restrictive policy stance without pre-commitment to further rate cuts. The acknowledgement of disinflation suggests a preference to hold rates while monitoring developments.
description: Statement by Christine Lagarde, President of the ECB, at the fiftieth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: We are determined to ensure that inflation returns to our 2% medium-term target in a timely manner.
Rationale: The speech indicates a dovish tone with a recent rate cut, acknowledging disinflation trends and a commitment to ensuring inflation returns to the 2% target in a timely manner. However, the mention of a data-dependent approach and maintaining sufficiently restrictive rates for as long as necessary suggests a cautious stance against further cuts imminently.
description: Speech by Christine Lagarde, President of the ECB, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Setbacks and strides forward: structural shifts and monetary policy in the twenties
Key quote: Our determined policy actions have successfully kept inflation expectations anchored, and inflation is projected to return to 2% over the second half of next year.
Rationale: Lagarde presents a balanced view of challenges and adaptations, emphasizing the need for flexibility while maintaining stability, which suggests a neutral stance. The speech acknowledges structural changes and suggests that the ECB is adjusting its framework, indicating a potential 'Hold' on rates as they assess these impacts.
description: Speech by Christine Lagarde, President of the ECB, at the 2024 Michel Camdessus Central Banking Lecture organised by the IMF

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council today decided to keep the three key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The ECB is keeping interest rates unchanged and is adopting a data-dependent approach, highlighting a commitment to keeping policy rates restrictive while monitoring inflation. The current stance is balanced and suggests caution rather than aggressive tightening or loosening.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 18 July 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Monetary policy in an unusual cycle - the risks, the path and the costs
Key quote: Our policy decisions have successfully kept inflation expectations anchored, and inflation is projected to return to 2% in the latter part of next year.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the need for vigilance and data dependency in decision-making, indicating a cautious stance towards inflation. The speech suggests a commitment to holding current rates to gather more data rather than immediate tightening or loosening.
description: Introductory speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the opening reception of the European Central Bank Forum on Central Banking "Monetary policy in an era of transformation", Sintra, 1 July 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Policymaking in a new risk environment
Key quote: This framework served us well in calibrating when to stop raising rates, how long to hold them constant and, most recently, when to start cutting them.
Rationale: The speech outlines a balanced view of current risks to the economy and emphasizes the need to maintain a careful approach to monetary policy given uncertainties. Lagarde discusses using a flexible policy framework to adapt to emerging situations, suggesting the ECB is currently in a holding pattern with interest rates until more data is available.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the 30th Dubrovnik Economic Conference, Dubrovnik, 14 June 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC statement
Key quote: The Governing Council's future decisions will ensure that its policy rates will stay sufficiently restrictive for as long as necessary.
Rationale: The speech suggests a balanced view with the ECB prepared to either tighten or relax policy depending on how data evolves. While acknowledging risks, it projects a stabilized outlook both in growth and inflation, implying the current policy rate is likely to remain unchanged in the near future.
description: Statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-ninth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, IMF Spring Meetings, Washington DC, 19 April 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council today decided to keep the three key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes maintaining the current interest rate level while expressing determination to ensure that inflation reaches the target. The commitment to a data-dependent approach further suggests a neutral stance, as there is no precommitment to rate changes. The decision to hold is a strong indicator of neutrality.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 11 April 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council today decided to keep the three key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: Despite keeping rates unchanged, the ECB shows a commitment to using monetary policy to ensure inflation returns to their target, suggesting a somewhat hawkish stance. Hence, the prediction is to hold current rates with a likelihood of leaning towards tightening if necessary.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 7 March 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: European Parliament plenary debate on the European Central Bank Annual Report
Key quote: We therefore decided to keep our key policy interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes the current monetary policy stance, which is focused on maintaining interest rates at current levels until inflation sustainably reaches the 2% target. Her speech shows a moderate view on inflation control, which supports holding rates.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the plenary session of the European Parliament, Strasbourg, 26 February 2024.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Monetary policy in the euro area - attentive and focused
Key quote: That is why, at our last meeting, we held interest rates at their present levels.
Rationale: The speech indicates a balanced view, acknowledging a large and fast policy adjustment to address inflation, but emphasizing the need to be attentive and focused on various economic factors without rushing to conclusions. This suggests a likelihood of maintaining current rates to monitor further developments.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the high-level public discussion "Inflation kills democracy" on the occasion of the 100th anniversary of the currency reform in Germany in 1923, organised by the German Ministry of Finance, Berlin, 21 November 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council today decided to keep the three key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The speech maintains a balanced view, emphasizing both the risks of high inflation and the moderating effects of previous rate increases. It affirms a data-dependent approach and considers current rates to be at sufficient restrictive levels, suggesting a 'hold' stance.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Athens, 25 October 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC statement
Key quote: The ECB is determined to ensure that inflation returns to its 2% medium-term target in a timely manner.
Rationale: The speech indicates determination to maintain current restrictive monetary policy levels to combat inflation, but also acknowledges the fragility of economic recovery and potential downside risks, suggesting a likely 'hold' position in the next meeting.
description: Statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-eight meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee (IMFC), IMF Annual Meetings, Marrakech, 14 October 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on economic and monetary affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Based on our current assessment, we consider that our rates have reached levels that, maintained for a sufficiently long duration, will make a substantial contribution to the timely return of inflation to our target.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasized the ECB's commitment to ensuring inflation returns to the 2% target, highlighting a recent rate hike and suggesting current rates should be maintained to achieve inflation goals. However, future decisions remain data-dependent, indicating a cautious approach rather than immediate further hikes.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 25 September 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: In order to reinforce progress towards our target, the Governing Council today decided to raise the three key ECB interest rates by 25 basis points.
Rationale: The ECB raised interest rates by 25 basis points and emphasized the need to maintain restrictive rates to combat inflation. However, the speech acknowledges the risks to economic growth and suggests a data-dependent approach, indicating a balanced between controlling inflation and economic stability.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 14 September 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Policymaking in an age of shifts and breaks
Key quote: In the current environment, this means - for the ECB - setting interest rates at sufficiently restrictive levels for as long as necessary to achieve a timely return of inflation to our 2% medium-term target.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the need for maintaining 'sufficiently restrictive' interest rates to bring inflation back to the 2% medium-term target. This indicates a somewhat hawkish stance, suggesting a preference for raising rates to curb inflation amid ongoing structural shifts and economic uncertainties.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at "Structural Shifts in the Global Economy", an economic policy symposium sponsored by the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City, Jackson Hole, Wyoming, 25 August 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Inflation continues to decline but is still expected to remain too high for too long. The Governing Council therefore today decided to raise the three key ECB interest rates by 25 basis points.
Rationale: The speech highlights a strong focus on addressing persistent inflation by raising interest rates. The commitment to maintaining restrictive monetary policy until inflation aligns with the target, combined with the recent rate hike, indicates a hawkish stance.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 27 July 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Breaking the persistence of inflation
Key quote: Barring a material change to the outlook, we will continue to increase rates in July.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the need to bring rates to 'sufficiently restrictive' levels and maintain them, reflecting a strong commitment to further rate hikes to combat persistent inflation.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the European Central Banks' Forum on Central Banking 2023 Macroeconomic stabilisation in a volatile inflation environment, Sintra, 27 June 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Remarks at G30 dinner
Key quote: Barring a material change to our baseline, it is very likely that we will continue to increase rates at our next policy meeting in July.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde indicated a strong likelihood of further interest rate hikes, highlighting ongoing inflation concerns driven by domestic factors and committed to ensuring inflation returns to the target. This suggests a clear hawkish stance aimed at additional tightening.
description: Remarks by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the G30 dinner, Amsterdam, 16 June 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Unless there was a material change to our baseline, we will continue to hike at our next meeting.
Rationale: The speech emphasized the determination to bring inflation back to the target, indicating strong confidence in further rate hikes unless there is a significant change in the outlook. Projections of inflation remain high, and there is a suggestion of continued monetary tightening.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 15 June 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Our future decisions will ensure that the policy rates will be brought to levels sufficiently restrictive to achieve a timely return of inflation to our 2% medium-term target and will be kept at those levels for as long as necessary.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes a commitment to reducing inflation to the 2% target and suggests further restrictive measures may be needed, indicating a somewhat hawkish stance. Lagarde indicates a readiness to raise rates further, with significant emphasis on controlling inflation, suggesting a higher likelihood of a rate increase.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 5 June 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: The fight against inflation
Key quote: Today, inflation is too high and it is set to remain so for too long. We are determined to bring it back down to our 2% medium-term target in a timely manner.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the need for continued rate hikes until inflation is confidently on track to return to target, indicating a bias towards further tightening of monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at "Deutscher Sparkassentag 2023", Hanover, 1 June 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Twenty-five years of the European Central Bank
Key quote: For the ECB, our immediate and overriding priority is to bring inflation back down to our 2% medium-term target in a timely manner. And we will do so.
Rationale: While the speech reflects on the historical role of the euro and ECB, it touches upon the ECB's current priority to bring inflation down, indicating a commitment to maintaining stable prices. However, the speech does not exhibit a strong hawkish or dovish tone, making it neutral overall.
description: Opening remarks by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the celebration to mark the 25th anniversary of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 24 May 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The inflation outlook continues to be too high for too long. In light of the ongoing high inflation pressures, the Governing Council today decided to raise the three key ECB interest rates by 25 basis points.
Rationale: The speech is strongly hawkish as it acknowledges the persistently high inflation pressures and the decision to raise interest rates, with an emphasis on further data-dependent tightening to ensure inflation returns to target. This indicates a strong stance towards raising rates further if necessary.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 4 May 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Central banks in a fragmenting world
Key quote: Central banks must provide for stability in an age that is anything but stable.
Rationale: Lagarde's speech discusses geopolitical fragmentation and its implications for central banks, highlighting the importance of collaboration between fiscal and monetary policies. However, it does not suggest any immediate changes to interest rates. The speech is forward-looking rather than addressing current monetary policy actions, thus a neutral stance with a 'Hold' prediction is most appropriate.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Council on Foreign Relations' C Peter McColough Series on International Economics, New York City, 17 April 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC statement
Key quote: As inflation is projected to remain too high for too long, the Governing Council of the ECB decided in March to raise the key ECB interest rates by 50 basis points, bringing the total increase since July 2022 to 350 basis points.
Rationale: The emphasis on inflation remaining too high and the recent decision to raise rates indicate a hawkish stance, but the data-dependant approach to future decisions suggests caution, thus 'somewhat hawkish' is appropriate.
description: Statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-seventh meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, IMF Spring Meetings, Washington DC, 14 April 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: The path ahead
Key quote: We will deliver price stability, and bringing inflation back to 2% over the medium term is non-negotiable.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech emphasizes the ECB's commitment to fighting inflation by keeping a robust strategy that allows for future rate hikes if necessary. The acknowledgement that inflation is still high, coupled with the recent 50 basis point hike, suggests a somewhat hawkish stance. However, the emphasis on data dependency and the readiness to act hints that decisions will depend on incoming data, thus not fully committing to an aggressive hawkish path.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at "The ECB and Its Watchers XXIII" conference, Frankfurt am Main, 22 March 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: As inflation is projected to remain too high for too long, the Governing Council last week decided to increase the three key ECB interest rates by 50 basis points, in line with our determination to ensure the timely return of inflation to our 2% medium-term target.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes the high inflation which is expected to remain, signaling that recent interest rate hikes are aimed at achieving the medium-term inflation target. This suggests a somewhat hawkish stance, favoring further tightening of monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 20 March 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Inflation is projected to remain too high for too long. Therefore, the Governing Council today decided to increase the three key ECB interest rates by 50 basis points.
Rationale: The decision to increase rates by 50 basis points and the emphasis on inflation remaining too high indicate a strong hawkish stance with a focus on ensuring inflation returns to target. The commitment to a data-dependent approach and readiness to adjust instruments also tilt towards interest rate hikes in future meetings.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 16 March 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: European Parliament plenary debate on the ECB Annual Report
Key quote: At its February meeting, the Governing Council emphasised its determination to stay the course in raising interest rates significantly at a steady pace and in keeping them at levels that are sufficiently restrictive to ensure a timely return of inflation to our 2% medium-term target.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes commitment to raising interest rates further due to persistent inflation pressures, indicating a somewhat hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the plenary session of the European Parliament, Strasbourg, 15 February 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council will stay the course in raising interest rates significantly at a steady pace and in keeping them at levels that are sufficiently restrictive to ensure a timely return of inflation to our two per cent medium-term target.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech emphasizes raising interest rates significantly due to underlying inflation pressures, indicating a strong commitment to curbing inflation. The expectation of another 50 basis points rate hike in March further underlines a hawkish stance.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 2 February 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: New challenges in a changing world
Key quote: And we have made it clear that ECB interest rates will still have to rise significantly at a steady pace to reach levels that are sufficiently restrictive, and stay at those levels for as long as necessary.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to continue raising interest rates significantly to combat high inflation, which indicates a hawkish stance. The clear intention to maintain restrictive monetary policy fortifies the likelihood of raising rates in the next meeting.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Deutsche Börse Annual Reception, Eschborn, 23 January 2023.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We judge that interest rates will still have to rise significantly at a steady pace to reach levels that are sufficiently restrictive to ensure a timely return of inflation to our two per cent medium-term target.
Rationale: The speech highlights a strong commitment to continue raising rates significantly due to an upward revision in inflation projections, indicating a focus on tightening monetary policy to rein in inflation.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 15 December 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: We expect to raise rates further to the levels needed to ensure that inflation returns to our 2% medium-term target in a timely manner.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech emphasizes the ECB's commitment to raising interest rates to combat high inflation, indicating a strong hawkish stance. The determination to raise rates further underscores the intention to tighten monetary policy.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 28 November 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Monetary policy in a new environment
Key quote: We expect to raise rates further - and withdrawing accommodation may not be enough.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes the need to control inflation and mentions that the ECB has been aggressive in raising rates. She indicates that further rate hikes are expected, signaling a strong hawkish stance towards monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the European Banking Congress, Frankfurt am Main, 18 November 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Monetary policy in a high inflation environment - commitment and clarity
Key quote: We will therefore have to raise rates to levels that will deliver our 2% medium-term inflation target. The ultimate goal of our interest rate path is clear, and we are not there yet.
Rationale: The speech focuses significantly on the need to raise rates to combat high inflation, demonstrating a commitment to meet the ECB's inflation target despite current difficulties. The emphasis on not allowing inflation to become entrenched aligns with a strong hawkish stance.
description: Lecture by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, organised by the Bank of Estonia (Eesti Pank) and dedicated to Professor Ragnar Nurkse, Tallinn, 4 November 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We have decided to raise the three key ECB interest rates by 75 basis points.
Rationale: The mention of expected future rate increases indicates a tendency towards tightening monetary policy to combat inflation, which suggests a somewhat hawkish stance.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 27 October 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: The ECB's Governing Council expects to raise interest rates further over the next several meetings, based on a data-dependent and meeting-by-meeting approach.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to address high inflation and indicates that further interest rate hikes are anticipated to ensure inflation returns to target. This suggests a somewhat hawkish stance, leaning towards tightening monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-sixth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee (IMFC), IMF Annual Meetings, Washington DC, 14 October 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Inflation remains far too high and is likely to stay above our target for an extended period.
Rationale: The speech indicates a strong commitment to raising interest rates to control inflation, which is a hallmark of a hawkish stance. The mention of persistent upward shifts in inflation expectations and the expectation to continue raising rates lean heavily towards a hawkish approach.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 26 September 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: We have taken major steps along the path of normalising our monetary policy, frontloading our rate increases. This signals that we are determined to bring inflation back to our medium-term target of 2% in a timely manner and ensure that inflation expectations remain well anchored.
Rationale: The speech is clearly focused on addressing the high and persistent inflation with strong and decisive monetary policy actions, including raising rates further over the coming meetings. The commitment to preventing inflation from becoming entrenched and ensuring that inflation expectations remain anchored indicates a hawkish stance.
description: Karl Otto Pöhl Lecture by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, organised by the Frankfurter Gesellschaft für Handel, Industrie und Wissenschaft, Frankfurt am Main, 20 September 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council today decided to raise the three key ECB interest rates by 75 basis points.
Rationale: The speech clearly indicates a strong stance on combating high inflation by implementing a significant interest rate hike and signaling further rate increases. The emphasis on controlling inflation suggests a hawkish approach to monetary policy.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 8 September 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Price stability and policy transmission in the euro area
Key quote: In July we intend to raise our policy rates for the first time in 11 years. And we have provided some guidance for our September policy meeting and the rate path we envisage taking thereafter.
Rationale: The speech indicates a clear intent to raise interest rates in response to the high and persistent inflation, while also emphasizing a continued path of policy normalization. This indicates a somewhat hawkish stance as the ECB is focused on adjusting interest rates upwards to manage inflation.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Forum on Central Banking 2022 on "Challenges for monetary policy in a rapidly changing world", Sintra, 28 June 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: We intend to raise the key ECB interest rates by 25 basis points at our July monetary policy meeting.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech is quite aggressive in terms of indicating future rate hikes. With the current inflation rates described as 'undesirably elevated' and plans already announced to raise interest rates in the coming months, this reflects a hawkish stance towards normalizing monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 20 June 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Challenges along Europe's road
Key quote: With inflation likely to remain high for some time, actions that demonstrate our commitment to price stability will be critical to anchor inflation expectations and contain second-round effects.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasized the phase of higher inflation and the importance of normalizing policy settings, suggesting a readiness to raise rates soon to maintain price stability, though with a gradual approach.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the international conference to mark the 30th anniversary of Banka Slovenije, Ljubljana, 11 May 2022

author: Christine Lagarde
title: International Monetary and Financial Committee statement
Key quote: We will take whatever action is needed to fulfil the ECB's mandate to pursue price stability and to contribute to safeguarding financial stability.
Rationale: The speech highlights the current economic uncertainties and the need for flexibility and careful calibration in monetary policy. While acknowledging the inflationary pressures, there is no clear commitment to change the policy rate imminently, suggesting a neutral stance likely leading to a hold decision.
description: Statement (virtual) by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-fifth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, 21 April 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Finding resilience in times of uncertainty
Key quote: For our part, the ECB has made it clear that, in the context of the ongoing conflict, we will take whatever action is needed to pursue price stability and safeguard financial stability.
Rationale: While acknowledging significant economic challenges, Lagarde emphasizes a willingness to act against inflationary pressures and is preparing to conclude net asset purchases, suggesting a somewhat hawkish stance. However, gradualism implies that immediate rate hikes are unlikely, hence a prediction to hold rates.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at an event organised by the Central Bank of Cyprus, Nicosia, 30 March 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Remarks on the euro area economy
Key quote: Any adjustments to interest rates will take place some time after the end of our net purchases and will be gradual.
Rationale: The speech demonstrates a cautious approach towards adjusting interest rates, indicating potential monetary tightening in the future but emphasizes gradualism and data-dependence. The decision to reduce the pace of net asset purchases suggests a modest hawkish stance.
description: Remarks by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the "Wirtschaftsgipfel" of Welt/Axel Springer, Berlin, 15 March 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Any adjustments to the key ECB interest rates will take place some time after the end of our net purchases under the APP and will be gradual.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges inflationary pressures and indicates a readiness to end asset purchases sooner than previously anticipated, suggesting a shift towards tighter policy despite ongoing uncertainties due to the Ukraine conflict.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 10 March 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Introductory statement at the COSAC meeting
Key quote: We will take any measures necessary to ensure that we deliver on our inflation target of 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: Lagarde acknowledges the high inflation rates and emphasizes the ECB's commitment to price stability, suggesting a somewhat hawkish stance. The reduction of the pace of asset purchases and flexibility to change course supports holding rates.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the meeting of the Conference of Parliamentary Committees for Union Affairs of the Parliaments of the European Union (COSAC), Paris, 14 January 2022.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: monetary accommodation is still needed for inflation to stabilise at our two per cent inflation target over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates a reduction in asset purchases, which suggests a somewhat hawkish stance, yet emphasizes the need to maintain significant monetary accommodation to achieve the inflation target. This balance of gradual reduction with ongoing support suggests a neutral stance, likely resulting in holding the current rates.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 16 December 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: It remains crucial that policy support is not withdrawn prematurely.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes the continuation of supportive monetary policy and mentions that inflation pressures are mostly temporary. The ECB's forward guidance indicates a hold on interest rates until inflation trends meet their targets. The speech doesn't aggressively push for tightening or easing, suggesting a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-fourth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee (IMFC), IMF Annual Meetings, 14 October 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We did so to underline our commitment to maintain a persistently accommodative monetary policy stance to meet our inflation target.
Rationale: The speech highlights a commitment to maintaining an accommodative monetary policy and acknowledges that inflation is expected to remain below the target in the medium term. The probability for holding rates is high as the speech indicates that conditions have not yet been met for increasing rates.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 22 July 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Press Conference
Key quote: Addressing this requires especially forceful or persistent monetary policy measures to avoid negative deviations from the inflation target becoming entrenched.
Rationale: The speech highlights the ECB's new symmetric 2% inflation target and acknowledges the need for especially forceful or persistent monetary policy measures in the current low interest rate environment. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, preparing for flexibility in the ECB's approach to maintaining price stability, while not indicating an immediate rate cut or increase.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 8 July 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The Governing Council decided to confirm its very accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasized maintaining an accommodative stance and continuing asset purchases to support the recovery. While acknowledging a brighter economic outlook, she highlighted the need to tackle potential financial tightening, suggesting a predominantly dovish tone with a likely 'Hold' on rates for stability.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament (by videoconference), Frankfurt am Main, 21 June 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council decided to confirm its very accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The speech clearly emphasizes the continuation of a very accommodative monetary policy stance, acknowledging increased inflation as temporary and highlighting ongoing uncertainties, suggesting a cautious approach rather than tightening. Thus, holding rates is the most likely outcome.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 10 June 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Learning the right lessons from the past
Key quote: The ECB is committed to preserving favourable financing conditions throughout this period.
Rationale: Lagarde highlights the importance of strong policy support and credible commitment, reflecting a balanced view on maintaining current monetary policies without suggesting immediate changes to interest rates. This implies a neutral stance, leaning towards holding rates.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, on the occasion of the awarding of the Prix Turgot 2021, Paris, 2 June 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council decided to reconfirm its very accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The ECB is emphasizing the continuation of an accommodative monetary policy to support recovery, indicating dovishness. With the existing negative policy rate and commitment to asset purchases, the likelihood of cutting rates further is low, thus 'Hold' is the most likely action.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 22 April 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: It is crucial to refrain from withdrawing policy support prematurely, either on the monetary or fiscal side.
Rationale: The emphasis on maintaining policy support and not withdrawing it prematurely, along with concerns about downside risks, suggests a dovish stance. There's no indication of an imminent rate cut, hence predicting a hold on rates.
description: Statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-third meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Virtual IMF Spring Meetings, Washington DC, 8 April 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Preserving favourable financing conditions over the pandemic period remains essential to reduce uncertainty and bolster confidence, thereby underpinning economic activity and safeguarding medium-term price stability.
Rationale: Lagarde's speech emphasizes maintaining favorable financing conditions and supporting the economic recovery, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. The mention of increasing the pace of asset purchases under the PEPP suggests a commitment to accommodative measures rather than tightening. However, the emphasis on gradual inflation increase and balanced medium-term risks suggests a 'Hold' decision on rates with high probability.
description: Introductory statement (via videoconference) by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Frankfurt am Main, 18 March 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the continuation and intensification of stimulus measures such as asset purchases to maintain favorable financing conditions, despite economic improvements, which indicates a somewhat dovish stance. The probability of holding rates is high as there's no indication of an imminent rate cut or hike.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 11 March 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: The coronavirus crisis and SMEs
Key quote: The ECB will help ensure that firms and families can access the finance they need to weather this storm - and that they can do so in the confidence that financing conditions will not tighten prematurely.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued support for SMEs and the commitment to not tightening financing conditions prematurely, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. However, the emphasis is also on ensuring stability, which suggests that a rate cut is not being strongly suggested. Hence, a 'Hold' prediction is most likely.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the "Jahresimpuls Mittelstand 2021" of Bundesverband Mittelständische Wirtschaft, Frankfurt am Main, 1 March 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Investing in our climate, social and economic resilience - What are the main policy priorities?
Key quote: The ECB will continue to support all sectors of the economy by preserving favourable financing over the pandemic period, as it has done since the start of the crisis.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the continuation of accommodative policies such as PEPP and favorable financing conditions, signaling a priority on supporting economic recovery rather than tightening monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the opening plenary session of the European Parliamentary Week 2021 in virtual format, 22 February 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: European Parliament plenary debate on the ECB Annual Report
Key quote: In this environment, an accommodative monetary policy stance remains essential.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes the need for an accommodative monetary policy to support the recovery amidst continued economic uncertainty and low inflation rates. This dovish stance suggests that she is likely to vote to hold rates steady to maintain favorable financing conditions.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the plenary session of the European Parliament, Brussels, 8 February 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: In view of the current uncertainty, we need more than ever to maintain flexibility and optionality in the conduct of monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges elevated inflation but emphasizes the uncertainty and the need for cautious data-dependent decisions. While inflation is high, the policy stance highlights maintaining flexibility and gradual adjustments, suggesting a relatively dovish approach to avoid premature rate hikes.
description: Introductory statement (via video conference) by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Frankfurt am Main, 7 February 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: While the outlook for inflation is uncertain, inflation is likely to remain elevated for longer than previously expected, but to decline in the course of this year.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges inflation concerns but maintains a measured stance, indicating no immediate change in policy. The ECB plans to stay flexible and adjust as needed, but there's a sense of 'wait and see,' leading to a prediction of holding rates.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 3 February 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Against this background, we decided to reconfirm our very accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The ECB maintains an accommodative monetary policy stance with asset purchases through the PEPP and APP while highlighting downside risks to the economic outlook and low inflation. Although there are no rate cuts, the language suggests a readiness to maintain ample liquidity in the system to support recovery, which tilts the stance to somewhat dovish.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 21 January 2021.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: In view of the economic fallout from the resurgence of the pandemic, today the Governing Council recalibrated its monetary policy instruments as follows.
Rationale: The speech focused on maintaining accommodative monetary policy to support the economy, including the extension and increase of asset purchase programmes, which are typically dovish measures. However, there is no indication of an immediate rate cut, leading to a prediction of holding rates steady.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 10 December 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The key role of monetary policy in this situation is to preserve favourable financing conditions for all sectors and jurisdictions across the euro area, thereby providing crucial support to underpin economic activity and to safeguard medium-term price stability.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the need to preserve favorable financing conditions to support the economy, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. Her focus is on assessing incoming information and potentially recalibrating tools, suggesting that no immediate changes are anticipated.
description: Introductory speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON Committee of the European Parliament (by videoconference), 19 November 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Monetary policy in a pandemic emergency
Key quote: Continued policy support is therefore necessary to achieve our inflation aim.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the need for continued policy support and mentions the recalibration of tools to ensure favorable financing conditions, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. The likelihood of holding rates is high due to the focus on maintaining support and addressing economic uncertainty.
description: Keynote speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank at the ECB Forum on Central Banking (virtual event), Frankfurt am Main, 11 November 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: In the meantime, we decided to reconfirm our accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The speech highlights significant downside risks to the economic outlook due to the resurgence of COVID-19 and indicates continued accommodative monetary policy to support economic activity, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance. However, no immediate change in policy was announced, implying a likely 'Hold' in the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main,  29 October 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Rebuilding and sustaining growth
Key quote: In this context, it is clear that both fiscal support and monetary policy support have to remain in place for as long as necessary and 'cliff effects' must be avoided.
Rationale: Lagarde emphasizes the necessity of sustained monetary support to counteract the structural damage from the crisis, which denotes a dovish stance. However, given the significant challenges and uncertainties due to the pandemic, it's likely she would advocate maintaining current interest rates rather than cutting them further.
description: Remarks by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the G30 International Banking Seminar, Frankfurt am Main, 18 October 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: At the global level, it will be crucial not to withdraw the policy support prematurely, including on both the monetary and fiscal sides, as reducing support too soon would risk delaying the economic rebound.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to maintain policy support and the ECB's commitment to accommodative measures like PEPP and TLTROs. Given the backdrop of negative inflation and the economic strains from COVID-19, Lagarde suggests continued monetary easing, hence categorizing it as dovish.
description: Statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-second meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Virtual IMF Annual Meetings, Washington DC, 15 October 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: The monetary policy strategy review - some preliminary considerations
Key quote: Ensuring that there is sufficient space above zero to re-empower conventional monetary policy becomes more important.
Rationale: The speech indicates an awareness of a persistent low inflation environment and the need for possibly more flexible and supportive monetary policy measures, suggesting a dovish stance. However, since no immediate conclusions or policy changes were announced, and emphasis was placed on listening and reviewing, a 'Hold' prediction with moderate confidence is appropriate.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the "ECB and Its Watchers XXI" conference, Frankfurt am Main, 30 September 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The monetary policy measures that we have taken since early March are providing crucial support to the economic recovery and are helping to safeguard medium-term price stability.
Rationale: The emphasis on significant asset purchases and liquidity operations, combined with acknowledgment of downside risks and a weak inflation outlook, suggests a somewhat dovish stance. However, Lagarde emphasizes readiness to adjust measures, implying caution rather than a move towards immediate monetary easing, which suggests a hold on rates is more probable.
description: Introductory statement (by videoconference) by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON Committee of the European Parliament, Frankfurt am Main, 28 September 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Jointly shaping Europe's tomorrow
Key quote: The ECB has played its part in this collective effort in the face of an unprecedented crisis.
Rationale: The speech highlights the ECB's response to stabilize markets with the PEPP and stresses the importance of sustained policy support, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. However, there is no strong signal towards further easing, suggesting a 'Hold' at the next meeting.
description: Introductory remark by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the the Franco-German Parliamentary Assembly, Frankfurt am Main, 21 September 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Economic, financial and monetary impact of COVID-19 pandemic, and post-crisis options for policies and tools
Key quote: Monetary policy will continue to play its role in the euro area with full commitment to its mandate.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the high level of uncertainty and the need for continued caution, highlighting that monetary policy must remain supportive to tackle downside risks. Lagarde emphasizes the importance of fiscal policy, signifying a preference for maintaining current monetary measures rather than tightening, yet ultimately signaling readiness to adjust policies as needed.
description: Remarks by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Annual Meeting of the Council of Governors of the Arab Central Banks and Monetary Authorities, contribution during the session "Economic, financial and monetary impact of COVID-19 pandemic, and post-crisis options for policies and tools", Frankfurt am Main, 11 September 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Ample monetary stimulus remains necessary to support the economic recovery and to safeguard medium-term price stability.
Rationale: The speech outlines the need to maintain a highly accommodative monetary policy stance, including ongoing asset purchases and low policy rates, in response to the economic challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, which signals a dovish outlook.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 16 July 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: The path out of uncertainty
Key quote: Already our policies have dispelled tail risks in financial markets... We are now orienting our measures to ensure that the right financial conditions are in place to support a recovery from the crisis.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes supporting economic recovery and the expansion of monetary measures like the pandemic emergency purchase programme, which are typically seen as dovish actions to stimulate growth. However, there is an acknowledgment that monetary policy alone is insufficient for addressing structural changes, somewhat balancing the tone.
description: Remarks (via videoconference) by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the inaugural session of the Italian National Consultation, 13 June 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The Governing Council last Thursday decided to increase the amount of the pandemic emergency purchase programme (PEPP) by an additional €600 billion to a total of €1,350 billion.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the ECB's continued commitment to easing monetary conditions through expanded asset purchases and provision of liquidity. The measures described aim to combat the economic fallout from COVID-19, reflecting a dovish stance intent on supporting recovery rather than tightening.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 8 June 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council decided to increase the envelope for the pandemic emergency purchase programme (PEPP) by €600 billion to a total of €1,350 billion.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes significant monetary policy stimulus to support the economy amid unprecedented contraction due to COVID-19, and decisions to increase asset purchases (PEPP) signal a dovish stance to ensure liquidity and funding conditions. Although the situation calls for stimulus, the decision to keep interest rates unchanged points towards holding rates for now.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 4 June 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Opening remarks at the EUI's State of the Union event
Key quote: We will do everything necessary within our mandate to support the recovery and we remain undeterred in delivering on our price stability objective.
Rationale: The speech focuses more on European integration and fiscal cooperation than immediate monetary policy changes. However, Lagarde reaffirms the ECB's commitment to its mandate, implying a balanced approach. This suggests a neutral stance with a likelihood to 'Hold' rates pending further developments.
description: Opening remarks by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Online Edition of The State of the Union conference organised by the European University Institute, 8 May 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council is determined to continue to support households and firms in the face of the current economic disruption and heightened uncertainty, in order to safeguard medium-term price stability.
Rationale: The speech reflects a highly accommodative stance with strong emphasis on easing monetary conditions, liquidity provision, and support measures due to unprecedented economic contraction. The ECB's intent to keep interest rates at current or lower levels indicates a dovish posture, likely resulting in a 'Hold' or even a more accommodative future stance, but the probability for an actual rate cut is lower as rates are already negative.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 30 April 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: The Governing Council is committed to doing everything necessary within its mandate to help the euro area through this crisis.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes significant monetary easing measures, including a large-scale asset purchase program and liquidity provisions, to combat the economic impact of COVID-19. This indicates a dovish stance aimed at supporting economic recovery amid high uncertainty.
description: Statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the forty-first meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, IMF Virtual meetings, Washington DC, 16 April 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Interview in Le Parisien
Key quote: We are in a period where we need to use all of our tools without hesitation.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the use of a large monetary policy arsenal to address the economic crisis, with a focus on maintaining financial stability and price stability. This indicates a dovish stance, but given the toolbox mention and Lagarde's assurance of commitment to the euro area, it's likely there will be no immediate rate cut, but rather a holding pattern with a strong dovish bias.
description: Interview with Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Le Parisien, conducted by Mr Matthieu Pelloli and published on 9 April 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Accordingly, we decided on a comprehensive package of monetary policy measures.
Rationale: The emphasis on providing liquidity support and favorable lending conditions, in addition to leaving interest rates unchanged, indicates a dovish stance focused on maintaining economic stability amid the coronavirus impact.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 12 March 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Debate about the Annual Report
Key quote: But monetary policy cannot, and should not, be the only game in town.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech discusses the economic environment, the ECB's current strategies, and the importance of other policy areas, with a balanced view on the impact of current monetary policies. She does not indicate strong shifts towards tightening or easing, suggesting a 'Hold' stance on rates at the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, on the occasion of the presentation of the ECB Annual Report 2018 at the European Parliament, Brussels, 11 February 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The euro area economy therefore continues to require support from our monetary policy, which provides a shield from global headwinds.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech acknowledges risks to the euro area economy and emphasizes the need for continued monetary support. She doesn't indicate any shift toward tightening policy, which points to maintaining the current policy stance, hence a 'Hold' prediction with a somewhat dovish tone.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 6 February 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Remarks on the occasion of receiving the Grand Prix de l'Économie 2019 from Les Echos
Key quote: In the face of these uncertainties, the ECB's forward guidance on interest rates and asset purchases acts as an effective automatic stabiliser.
Rationale: The speech focuses on uncertainties like the coronavirus and ongoing accommodative policy, without suggesting any immediate change in policy stance, which indicates a neutral position.
description: Speech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the "Grand Prix de l'Économie des Echos pour l'année 2019", Paris, 5 February 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Interview with Bloomberg TV
Key quote: I'm an owl; I'm not a dove, I'm not a hawk!
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes a balanced approach in her strategy review and assessment of the economic conditions, suggesting no immediate change in policy but openness to adjustments based on future data. She avoids any strong commitment to either easing or tightening monetary policy at this time.
description: Interview with Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, conducted by Ms Francine Lacqua and broadcast on 24 January 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Based on our regular economic and monetary analyses, we decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The speech indicates a continuation of the accommodative monetary policy with the potential for further loosening if inflation remains below target. The ECB plans to maintain asset purchases and low rates, reflecting a somewhat dovish stance focused on supporting inflation and growth.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 23 January 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Interview in "Challenges" magazine
Key quote: Negative interest rates aim to keep the economy on a balanced growth path and to avoid a recession.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde emphasizes a balanced approach, advocating for both monetary and fiscal tools. While acknowledging economic challenges, there's no clear indication of a shift towards further easing or tightening, suggesting she would likely vote to keep rates unchanged.
description: Interview with Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, in "Challenges" magazine, conducted by Mr Pierre-Henri de Menthon and Ms Sabine Syfuss-Arnaud, and published on 8 January 2020.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: In light of the subdued inflation outlook, the Governing Council reiterated the need for monetary policy to remain highly accommodative for a prolonged period of time.
Rationale: The policy stance is clearly dovish, emphasizing the need for accommodative measures to support inflation dynamics. The decision to keep interest rates unchanged and ongoing asset purchases indicate a preference for maintaining current supportive measures over tightening monetary policy.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 12 December 2019.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The ECB's accommodative policy stance has been a key driver of domestic demand during the recovery, and that stance remains in place.
Rationale: The speech highlights the ECB's commitment to maintaining an accommodative policy to support the economy amid subdued inflation and a weak growth outlook, suggesting a 'somewhat dovish' stance aimed at keeping rates low and supporting demand.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 2 December 2019.

author: Christine Lagarde
title: The future of the euro area economy
Key quote: The ECB's accommodative policy stance has been a key driver of domestic demand during the recovery, and that stance remains in place.
Rationale: Christine Lagarde's speech discusses the challenges faced by the Euro area and emphasizes the importance of accommodating monetary policy while encouraging fiscal support. However, there is no clear indication of an imminent rate change, suggesting a neutral stance likely leaning towards holding rates.
description: Sspeech by Ms Christine Lagarde, President of the European Central Bank, at the Frankfurt European Banking Congress, Frankfurt am Main, 22 November 2019.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Monetary policy under uncertainty
Key quote: Our confidence in a return of inflation to target has been growing for some time and, in response, we have gradually reduced our policy rates over the past months.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of flexibility and state-dependence in response to uncertain economic conditions. While acknowledging recent rate cuts, there is no explicit push for further immediate easing, indicating a balanced approach that suggests holding rates steady at the next meeting.
description: Keynote speech by Philip R. Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the Bank of England Watchers’ Conference 2024, King’s College London

author: Philip R Lane
title: The 2021-2022 inflation surges and the monetary policy response through the lens of macroeconomic models
Key quote: If policymakers had had perfect foresight about the shocks that were about to hit the economy, interest rates would have been raised earlier and more sharply.
Rationale: The speech reflected on past policy decisions without signaling a clear preference for future rate changes, emphasizing the appropriateness of past actions and disinflation progress. This suggests a likely vote to 'Hold' as the current policy is seen as effectively addressing inflation.
description: Speech by Philip R. Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the SUERF Marjolin Lecture hosted by the Banca d’Italia

author: Philip R Lane
title: Underlying inflation: an update
Key quote: Each of the underlying inflation indicators tracked by the ECB has declined significantly since the post-pandemic inflation surges, with the range narrowing towards its historical average.
Rationale: The speech indicates a significant decline in underlying inflation indicators and easing wage pressures, suggesting a reduced immediate need for further monetary tightening. However, caution is still advised, with the focus on monitoring inflation dynamics, supporting a hold on rates.
description: Speech by Philip R. Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the Inflation: Drivers and Dynamics Conference 2024 organised by the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland and the ECB

author: Philip R Lane
title: Moving from 3.75 to 3.50: explaining the latest rate decision
Key quote: Based on this assessment, it is now appropriate to take another step in moderating the degree of monetary policy restriction.
Rationale: The speech explains the recent decision to lower the interest rate from 3.75% to 3.5%, indicating a shift towards easing monetary policy due to expectations of stable underlying inflation and a projection of slower wage growth. However, the emphasis on cautious moderation and maintaining optionality for future adjustments suggests a preference towards holding rates in the near term while monitoring economic data.
description: Keynote speech by Philip R. Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the European Investment Bank Chief Economists’ Meeting

author: Philip R Lane
title: The effectiveness and transmission of monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: My interim conclusion is that monetary policy has been effective in underpinning the disinflation process, with the transmission of monetary tightening operating to restrict demand and stabilise inflation expectations.
Rationale: Despite acknowledging progress in disinflation and the effectiveness of monetary policy, Philip R. Lane highlights the need to maintain a restrictive stance for a sustainable and timely return to target inflation. This suggests a somewhat hawkish outlook, aiming to hold current rates to ensure inflation expectations remain anchored without imposing excessive economic costs.
description: Contribution by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the panel on "Reassessing the Effectiveness and Transmission of Monetary Policy", an economic symposium sponsored by the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City, Jackson Hole, 24 August 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Modern monetary analysis
Key quote: Monetary analysis has been central to the regular assessment of the state of the monetary policy transmission, which has been a key guiding principle in calibrating the speed and scale of the monetary policy tightening over the last couple of years.
Rationale: The speech is analytical, focusing on the evolution of monetary analysis rather than signaling a clear policy direction. Lane acknowledges supply-side factors for inflation and highlights the complexity of monetary transmission, suggesting a cautious approach.
description: Speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 3rd Bank of Finland International Monetary Policy Conference  "Monetary Policy in Low and High Inflation Environments", Helsinki, 26 June 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Monetary policy and the disinflation process
Key quote: After nine months of holding the deposit facility rate at 4.0 per cent, we cut it to 3.75 per cent.
Rationale: The speech reflects a somewhat dovish stance, given the recent interest rate cut and the focus on maintaining disinflation while still acknowledging elevated wage growth. The emphasis on a restrictive monetary stance suggests further rate cuts may occur if disinflation continues, but the commitment to carefully assess data introduces some caution.
description: Speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Banking & Payments Federation Ireland (BPFI) National Banking Conference, Dublin, 11 June 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Inflation in the euro area
Key quote: At our June meeting, if our updated assessment of the inflation outlook, the dynamics of underlying inflation and the strength of monetary policy transmission were to further increase our confidence that inflation is converging to our target in a sustained manner, it would be appropriate to reduce the current level of monetary policy restriction.
Rationale: Philip R. Lane highlights the decline in inflation and the forecasts for continued disinflation. Although there is a note on careful monitoring of underlying inflation dynamics, the speech leans toward acknowledging the possibility of reducing monetary restriction if conditions continue to align with projections. This suggests a somewhat dovish inclination, while indicating potential for maintaining rates for now.
description: Speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Institute of International and European Affairs, Dublin, 27 May 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: The analytics of the monetary policy tightening cycle
Key quote: Our future decisions will ensure that our policy rates will stay sufficiently restrictive for as long as necessary.
Rationale: The speech outlines the ECB’s significant tightening cycle and its focus on maintaining a restrictive stance to ensure inflation returns to target. While suggesting flexibility to adjust policy if needed, the tone remains committed to keeping rates high enough to control inflation. Therefore, the prediction is to 'Hold' given the current 4% rate, with further rate increases being less likely unless inflationary pressures rise unexpectedly.
description: Guest lecture by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Stanford Graduate School of Business, Stanford, California, 2 May 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Disinflation in the euro area - an update
Key quote: If our updated assessment of the inflation outlook, the dynamics of underlying inflation and the strength of monetary policy transmission were to further increase our confidence that inflation is converging to our target in a sustained manner, it would be appropriate to reduce the current level of monetary policy restriction.
Rationale: While disinflationary trends have been observed and there is an indication of a potential future rate reduction, the speech emphasizes the need for sustained confidence in the inflation outlook before any policy easing. Current policy rates are seen as contributing to disinflation, suggesting a preference for holding rates in the near term.
description: Speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the University College Dublin Economics Society, Dublin, 15 April 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Disinflation in the euro area
Key quote: The declining trend in underlying inflation has continued, and our past interest rate increases keep being transmitted forcefully into financing conditions.
Rationale: Philip R. Lane emphasizes that disinflation is progressing, and while some factors may renew upward pressure, the medium-term inflation is expected to stabilize around the ECB's target. His caution about premature policy changes indicates a neutral stance, suggesting a hold on rates.
description: Speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Hutchins Center on Fiscal & Monetary Policy at the Brookings Institution, Washington DC, 8 February 2024.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Central bank liquidity - a macroeconomic perspective
Key quote: The appropriate level of central bank reserves in the 'new normal' steady state should avoid the risks associated with excessively-scarce or excessively-abundant reserves.
Rationale: Lane discusses the transition to a new steady state with higher central bank reserves, emphasizing the supportive role of liquidity for credit creation and macroeconomic stability, suggesting a cautious approach by holding the policy rate rather than reducing or increasing it.
description: Welcome address by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Conference on Money Markets 2023, Frankfurt am Main, 9 November 2023.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Disinflation and monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: The additional rate hike will reinforce progress towards our target for two basic reasons. First, if the economy evolves according to the staff projections baseline case, last week's decision to hike bolsters confidence that inflation will return to target within the projection horizon.
