description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at a talk followed by a panel discussion ikf institut für kredit- und finanzwirtschaft e. V., Bochum, 5 June 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Prosperity for all – also in the future!
Key quote: Several more interest rate increases will be necessary in order to achieve a sufficiently restrictive level.
Rationale: Dr. Joachim Nagel emphasizes the need for several more interest rate increases to reach a sufficiently restrictive level to curb high core inflation, indicating a hawkish stance towards monetary policy tightening.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Economic Conference (Wirtschaftstag) of the Economic Council of the Christian Democratic Union, Berlin, 23 May 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Climate change and central banks – supporting the green transition by pursuing price stability
Key quote: Our primary objective is to maintain price stability. Consequently, I see the safeguarding of price stability as the starting and reference point for any consideration of climate-related issues in monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the central bank's commitment to price stability while discussing climate change, suggesting a balanced approach without immediate bias towards tightening or loosening monetary policy.
description: Welcome address (virtually) by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Deutsche Bundesbank Spring Conference 2023 "Climate Change and Central Banks", Eltville, 12 May 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Getting inflation under control in turbulent times
Key quote: In other words: unless the inflation outlook improves significantly, expect us to raise interest rates further.
Rationale: Dr. Joachim Nagel's speech clearly outlines the need for further interest rate hikes to combat high inflation, which he perceives as persistent and potentially entrenched. His emphasis on a hawkish stance is evident from his confidence in the resilience of the euro area economy and his dismissal of concerns about financial instability due to rate hikes.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Peterson Institute for International Economics, Washington DC, 14 April 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The labour market – supporting the economy or fuelling inflation?
Key quote: If inflation develops as projected, this should, in my view, not mark the end of the hike sequence. It will be necessary to raise policy rates to sufficiently restrictive levels in order to bring inflation back down to 2% in a timely manner.
Rationale: Dr. Joachim Nagel emphasizes the importance of raising policy rates to tackle persistent inflation and highlights the need for vigilance in monetary policy due to tight labor market conditions, making his stance strongly hawkish.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the OMFIF Economic and Monetary Policy Institute, Edinburgh, 24 March 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Current challenges facing the European Monetary Union
Key quote: If inflation develops as projected, further interest rate hikes have to follow in upcoming meetings.
Rationale: Dr. Joachim Nagel's speech emphasizes the need for bold and decisive action to tame inflation, highlighting that the ECB's job is not done and suggests further interest rate hikes are necessary. This hawkish stance suggests a high likelihood of voting to raise rates at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at King's College, London, 22 March 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Presentation of the Deutsche Bundesbank's Annual Report 2022
Key quote: Further significant interest rate steps might even be necessary afterwards, too.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for higher interest rates and maintaining these rates to combat persistently high inflation, with no indication of interest rate cuts, indicating a strongly hawkish stance.
description: Introductory statement by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the press conference presenting the Annual Report 2022, Frankfurt am Main, 1 March 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The current economic situation
Key quote: In December, we will certainly be following up with a further interest rate increase to bring the inflation rate back to 2% in the medium term.
Rationale: Joachim Nagel emphasizes the need for decisive action to combat high inflation and hints at an upcoming interest rate increase, indicating a strong commitment to raising rates to address inflationary pressures.
description: Welcome words by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at a Club evening of the International Club of Frankfurt Economic Journalists, Frankfurt am Main, 21 November 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The long shadow of high inflation
Key quote: If high inflation threatens to become entrenched, we must resolutely raise our key rates further and adopt a restrictive stance.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the need for decisive action to combat high inflation, including raising key rates further. This is indicative of a hawkish stance, aimed at tightening monetary policy to ensure inflation returns to the target rate.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the 32nd Frankfurt European Banking Congress, Frankfurt am Main, 18 November 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Uncertain times - banks need resilience
Key quote: Further interest rate increases are necessary to bring the inflation rate back to 2%.
Rationale: Dr. Nagel emphasized the need for continued rate hikes to combat high inflation and strongly supports the normalization of monetary policy. His stance is clear in advocating for decisive action, despite potential economic growth dampening effects.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Deutsche Bundesbank's symposium "Banking supervision in dialogue", Frankfurt am Main, 8 November 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: El economista
Key quote: We have to fulfil our mandate of safeguarding price stability in Europe.
Rationale: The speech highlights the shared views on the importance of bringing inflation back to target but does not provide specific guidance on immediate rate changes, suggesting a balanced position on monetary policy.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, in honour of Mr Pablo Hernández de Cos, Governor of the Bank of Spain and recipient of the Echegaray Prize, Madrid, 2 November 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: High inflation, weak growth – the priorities of monetary, fiscal and economic policy
Key quote: Monetary policy in the euro area now needs to step up to the plate - and that's what we are doing.
Rationale: Dr. Joachim Nagel emphasizes the need for strong action to combat high inflation, which includes raising interest rates and moving towards monetary policy normalization. His remarks suggest a hawkish stance, as he acknowledges the need for continued rate increases to prevent inflation from becoming entrenched.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Bundesbank's Capital City Reception, Berlin, 18 October 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Into the new - economic realities after the shockwaves
Key quote: Further interest rate hikes will be needed to bring the inflation rate back to 2% in the medium term - not just at the monetary policy meeting at the end of October, in my opinion.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the need for further interest rate hikes to combat high inflation, indicating a hawkish stance. He stresses the importance of decisive action to prevent inflation expectations from de-anchoring, which reinforces the intention to raise rates.
description: Keynote speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum (OMFIF)  and DZ Bank breakfast discussion, Washington DC, 15 October 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Doing what's possible – how the central bank and credit institutions can support the necessary transition towards a carbon-neutral economy
Key quote: Further interest rate increases are expected to follow over the next few monetary policy meetings as the risks to the inflation outlook are still tilted to the upside.
Rationale: The speech expresses strong concern about high inflation rates, signals determination to restore price stability, and indicates further rate hikes are expected, reflecting a decidedly hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, marking the retirement of Dr Karl-Peter Schackmann-Fallis, Executive Board Member of the German Savings Banks Association, Berlin, 26 September 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Is monetary policy still regulatory policy today?
Key quote: Further tightening steps have been signalled and will have to follow, in my view.
Rationale: The emphasis on the need for further rate hikes and a decisive approach to fighting inflation, coupled with the desire to end non-standard measures swiftly, demonstrates a hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the  University of Lucerne, Reichmuth & Co Lecture No 19, Lucerne, 23 September 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Monetary policy in times of geopolitical crises and high inflation
Key quote: To prevent an unanchoring of inflation expectations, the Eurosystem should therefore not allow any doubts whatsoever to emerge in the first place over its determination to combat inflation.
Rationale: The speech strongly emphasizes the need for decisive monetary policy action to address high inflation and preserve the credibility of the inflation target. The speaker mentions the recent rate hike and suggests further rate increases will be necessary, indicating a hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the European School of Management and Technology (ESMT), Berlin, 30 August 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Speech at the ceremony marking the change of office at the Regional Office in Bavaria
Key quote: I am convinced that the era of negative key interest rates is drawing to a close.
Rationale: The speech discusses the significant rise in interest rates worldwide, high inflation rates, and the need for central banks to adapt their monetary policy. The mention of the ECB's intention to raise interest rates and a conviction that negative rates are ending indicates a hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the change of office at the Regional Office in Bavaria, Munich, 12 July 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Where is monetary policy headed?
Key quote: Thus, a de-anchoring of inflation expectations has to be prevented no matter what. Which now calls for resolute monetary policy action.
Rationale: With inflation significantly above target and expectations for it to remain high, Dr. Nagel emphasizes the need for resolute monetary policy action, suggesting that the ECB must raise interest rates to ensure inflation does not become entrenched, indicating a hawkish stance.
description: Virtual keynote speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Frankfurt Euro Finance Summit, 4 July 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Return of inflation - what do we learn from survey data?
Key quote: Currently, in my view, central banks must not respond with too little, too late. If monetary policy falls behind the curve, even stronger hikes in interest rates could become necessary to get inflation under control.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the necessity of taking timely and adequate measures to control inflation, endorsing upcoming rate hikes, and highlighting risks of inflation becoming entrenched if the central bank delays action.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Joint Spring Conference on Monetary Policy and Expectations of Households and Firms, Eltville am Rhein, 23 June 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Introductory statement to the presidency press conference
Key quote: Central banks need to ensure that the very strong inflationary pressures do not become entrenched. We must therefore take decisive action.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the importance of decisive action to combat inflation, indicating an urgency to raise interest rates, which is a hawkish stance.
description: Introductory statement to the presidency press conference following the meeting of the G7 finance ministers and central bank governors by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, Königswinter, 20 May 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Preparing for rising rates
Key quote: In my view, negative interest rates will relatively soon be history in the euro area.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to prepare for rising rates and move away from the highly accommodative monetary policy, indicating a clear hawkish stance towards tightening monetary policy.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the DZ Bank Capital Markets Conference 2022, Berlin, 11 May 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The impact of the Russian aggression on inflation prospects and monetary policy's response
Key quote: As inflation in the euro area continues to run high, we need to act. I expect the net purchases under the APP to be discontinued at the end of June. And if both the incoming data and our new projection confirm this view in June, I will advocate a first step normalising ECB interest rates in July.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for a monetary policy response to rising inflation pressures, suggests ending asset purchases, and recommends raising interest rates, demonstrating a clear focus on tightening policy to prevent inflation from entrenching.
description: Closing keynote address by Mr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the International Economic Symposium co-hosted by the Deutsche Bundesbank and NABE, Eltville, 10 May 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Speech to mark the inauguration of the new President of the Deutsche Bundesbank
Key quote: While prices might also rise by less than projected in the forecasts, right now I see more of a risk that the inflation rate could remain elevated for longer than expected at the current time.
Rationale: Dr. Nagel acknowledges the recent steep rise in inflation and expresses concern that inflation could remain elevated longer than expected, suggesting that the very accommodative policy may no longer be appropriate, indicating a preference for tightening monetary policy.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at a virtual ceremony marking the change of office of the President of the Bundesbank, 11 January 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Banks and the economy - credit, regulation and growth
Key quote: The fall in inflation has made it possible to start easing monetary conditions.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges the fall in inflation and the recent rate cut, with a forward-looking approach that suggests a gradual easing if conditions remain favorable, but also indicates readiness to react to shocks. This aligns more closely with a somewhat dovish stance given the context of reduced inflation pressures and cautious optimism.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Annual Meeting of the Italian Banking Association (ABI), Rome, 9 July 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary policy after a perfect storm - festina lente
Key quote: My main message is that the disinflation process requires two ingredients. We must keep adjusting policy rates... But we also need to be prudent, and stand ready to adjust our policy in response to shocks.
Rationale: The speech conveys a cautious outlook for monetary policy, recognizing the need for some rate cuts already implemented due to declining inflation, but emphasizing prudence and readiness to adjust policy in response to possible risks. This stance suggests neither aggressive easing nor tightening, indicating a preference to hold rates in the near term.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the 3rd Bank of Finland International Monetary Policy Conference "Monetary Policy in Low and High Inflation Environments", Helsinki, 26 June 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Overview of economic and financial developments in Italy
Key quote: Over the coming months, if the incoming data is consistent with the current projections, it will be appropriate to ease monetary conditions.
Rationale: The speech signals a future easing of monetary policy due to ongoing disinflation and expectations of further reductions in inflation. Moreover, the Governor mentions that cuts in key interest rates may be warranted, indicating a dovish stance.
description: Concluding remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at a meeting for the presentation of the Annual Report 2023 - 130th Financial Year, Rome, 31 May 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary policy in a shifting landscape
Key quote: With inflation progressively moving towards our target, the question arises of what the ECB should do next. The emergence of downside risks to the outlook implies that the ECB should consider the possibility that monetary policy could become 'too tight' going forward.
Rationale: Panetta discusses the changing macroeconomic outlook and suggests caution in future rate hikes due to downside risks, indicating openness to slowing the pace of the current tightening policy.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Inaugural Conference of the Research Network on "Challenges for Monetary Policy Transmission in a Changing World" (ChaMP), Frankfurt am Main, 25 April 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Overview of economic and financial developments in Italy
Key quote: Risks to price stability have subsided and the conditions for starting monetary easing are taking shape.
Rationale: The speech highlights the subsiding risks to price stability and notes that conditions for monetary easing are taking shape, indicating a dovish stance towards reducing interest rates in the near future.
description: Address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the ordinary general meeting of shareholders, Rome, 28 March 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Economic developments and monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: The time for a reversal of the monetary policy stance is fast approaching.
Rationale: Governor Fabio Panetta's speech highlights the advanced stage of disinflation and the rapid progress towards the 2% inflation target, reflecting a somewhat dovish view with a suggestion that monetary policy easing may soon be appropriate. However, the emphasis on sustained disinflation and consideration of short-term normalization conditions suggests a balanced view without immediate action, leading to a prediction of holding rates in the near-term ECB meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the 30th Congress of ASSIOM FOREX (the Italian financial markets association), Genoa, 10 February 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Disinflation in the euro area and the opportunities for the Italian economy
Key quote: However, disinflation is well under way and the current level of the ECB key interest rates is sufficient to bring inflation back to the 2 per cent target.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges the progress in disinflation and suggests that current policy rates are enough to bring inflation back to target, indicating a preference against further tightening. It warns against abrupt changes that could hinder growth and price stability, which is a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the conference "The Cooperative Banking Group: opportunities and challenges of a new banking model", organised by the ICCREA Cooperative Banking Group to mark its 60th anniversary, Rome, 30 November 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Getting disinflation right
Key quote: Persistence matters as much as level.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the complexity of the current monetary environment and highlights the importance of persistence over further rate hikes. Given that rates are already in restrictive territory and the risks to inflation and economic growth are more balanced, the likely policy action is to hold rates steady to observe the effects of previous tightening.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Bocconi University, Milan, 3 August 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Everything everywhere all at once - responding to multiple global shocks
Key quote: We must remain fully data-dependent and avoid pre-committing to any specific policy path.
Rationale: Panetta emphasizes caution and adaptability in monetary policy due to high uncertainty and the impacts of previous tightening, suggesting a tendency to pause any further rate increases to carefully assess ongoing conditions. His focus on remaining data-dependent and avoiding pre-commitments indicates a preference for risk mitigation over aggressive tightening.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a panel on "Global shocks, policy spillovers and geo-strategic risks: how to coordinate policies" at "The ECB and its Watchers XXIII" conference, Frankfurt am Main, 22 March 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary policy after the energy shock
Key quote: We now need to take into account the risk of overtightening alongside the risk of doing too little.
Rationale: Panetta emphasizes the importance of maintaining a tight monetary policy stance until inflation is under control, showing a preference towards cautious tightening rather than aggressive hikes, and highlighting balanced risks in the current environment.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at an event organised by the Centre for European Reform, the Delegation of the European Union to the United Kingdom and the ECB Representative Office in London, London, 16 February 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The complexity of monetary policy
Key quote: Monetary policy has to tighten to ensure that inflation does not become entrenched. But the impact of the current shocks on the output gap is clearly unclear.
Rationale: Panetta acknowledges the need for monetary policy adjustments due to inflation risks but expresses caution about aggressive tightening because of uncertainties around output potential and the economy’s recovery.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the CEPR-EABCN conference on "Finding the Gap: Output Gap Measurement in the Euro Area", held at the European University Institute, Florence, 14 November 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Mind the step - calibrating monetary policy in a volatile environment
Key quote: A further policy adjustment is warranted in order to keep inflation expectations anchored and stave off second-round effects.
Rationale: Panetta emphasizes the need to adjust policy to keep inflation expectations anchored and mitigate second-round effects, indicating a preference for raising rates to address inflation concerns, while acknowledging the challenges involved in its calibration in a volatile environment.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Money Market Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 3 November 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Europe as a common shield -  protecting the euro area economy from global shocks
Key quote: We signalled that we intend to raise our policy rates by 25 basis points in July and that we expect to raise them again in September.
Rationale: The speaker discusses the challenges posed by external shocks and the need for monetary policy normalisation to be cautious and gradual. He indicates steps to raise policy rates but emphasizes the gradual nature of the approach and indicates a need to prevent fragmentation, suggesting a balanced view of holding rates for now.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Parliament's Innovation Day "The EU in the world created by the Ukraine war", Brussels, 1 July 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Normalising monetary policy in non-normal times
Key quote: For now, given the exceptional level of uncertainty we face, we should normalise our monetary policy gradually, in line with the progressive adjustment that has inspired our action in recent months.
Rationale: Panetta advocates for gradual and cautious policy normalization due to high uncertainty and the negative impacts of supply shocks and geopolitical conflicts, emphasizing gradualism to prevent over-tightening which suggests a dovish stance but not fully dovish as he doesn't advocate for further easing or cuts.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a policy lecture hosted by the SAFE Policy Center at Goethe University and the Centre for Economic Policy Research (CEPR), Frankfurt am Main, 25 May 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Europe's shared destiny, economics and the law
Key quote: Monetary policy will play its role, adjusting policy in line with the medium-term inflation outlook.
Rationale: Panetta acknowledges the inflationary pressures but emphasizes that they are external and beyond the control of monetary policy, suggesting a cautious approach to tightening. He expresses willingness to hold off on tightening unless inflation expectations de-anchor.
description:
Lectio Magistralis by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, on the occasion of the conferral of an honorary degree in Law by the University of Cassino and Southern Lazio
Cassino, 6 April 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary-fiscal interactions on the way out of the crisis
Key quote: We do not see, however, convincing signs that this upward movement will translate into a sustained inflationary process.
Rationale: The speech highlights the necessity of ongoing monetary-fiscal cooperation to escape the liquidity trap, with an emphasis on keeping interest rates low and continuing asset purchases until inflation is sustainably on target. The emphasis on prolonged accommodative measures suggests a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Conference of the Governors of Mediterranean Central Banks on "Central banks at the frontline of the COVID-19 crisis: weathering the storm, spurring the recovery" Frankfurt am Main, 28 June 2021.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary autonomy in a globalised world
Key quote: Faced with uncertainty about the true economic damage caused by the pandemic, we must preserve accommodative financing conditions well into the recovery.
Rationale: Fabio Panetta stresses the need to maintain accommodative monetary policy and financing conditions to support the recovery and to prevent inflation from remaining below target. This dovish stance suggests the ECB is unlikely to cut rates further but will hold them at current levels to support the economy.
description: Welcome address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the joint BIS, BoE, ECB and IMF conference on "Spillovers in a "post-pandemic, low-for-long" world", Frankfurt am Main, 26 April 2021.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Mind the gap(s): monetary policy and the way out of the pandemic
Key quote: The harder we push to close the output and inflation gaps, the better the outlook for the euro area economy.
Rationale: Panetta emphasizes the need for 'ample policy support' and warns against withdrawing support too quickly, highlighting significant economic slack and the need for continued monetary accommodation to boost demand and close output and inflation gaps.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at an online event organised by Bocconi University, Milan, 2 March 2021.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: A commitment to the recovery
Key quote: The ECB is committed to preserving favourable financing conditions well into the future.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policies to ensure favorable financing conditions and support the recovery. The commitment to expand and extend pandemic emergency measures if needed, coupled with the low inflation forecast, underscores a dovish stance. An interest rate cut is unlikely given the already negative policy rate, while tightening does not align with the current outlook, making 'Hold' the most probable prediction.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Rome Investment Forum 2020, Rome, 14 December 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Asymmetric risks, asymmetric reaction - monetary policy in the pandemic
Key quote: For as long as the growth and inflation outlook are at risk, monetary policy support will have to remain substantial, and if those risks to the outlook rise, our policy impulse will have to rise in tandem.
Rationale: Fabio Panetta highlights the necessity of maintaining substantial monetary policy support due to downside risks and a fragile economic outlook, indicating a dovish stance. However, given the existing significant measures in place, a rate cut is not highly probable in the immediate next meeting, so a hold is more likely.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the meeting of the ECB Money Market Contact Group, Frankfurt am Main, 22 September 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Healing after the pandemic - supporting and sustaining the recovery
Key quote: It is necessary to maintain very favourable liquidity conditions and an ample degree of monetary accommodation for an extended period of time, and in any case for as long as necessary.
Rationale: The speech highlights the need for ongoing monetary accommodation and expresses concerns about subdued inflation and downside risks, indicating a dovish stance. There is no indication of tightening, suggesting a hold on rates might be favored.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the 24th Economist Roundtable with the Government of Greece, Athens, 15 September 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Interview with TG1
Key quote: President Lagarde has stated that there are no limits to the action we will take to ensure that the European economy is able to continue on a path of growth.
Rationale: The emphasis on providing substantial support to the economy during the pandemic and the commitment to take unlimited action to ensure economic growth indicate a highly accommodative monetary policy stance, which is dovish.
description: Interview by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, with TG1,  conducted by Mr Gennaro Pellino on 19 March 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Interview in Corriere della Sera
Key quote: The global shock we face could be even worse than the one in 2008 if it is not managed with the necessary care.
Rationale: The focus on providing liquidity, maintaining low interest rates, and willingness to take further necessary actions indicates a somewhat dovish stance, aiming to support the economy amid the COVID-19 crisis.
description: Interview with Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Corriere della Sera, conducted by Mr Daniele Manca on 14 March 2020 and published on 15 March 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Deepening and widening Economic and Monetary Union - finding the right speed
Key quote: Against this background, the euro area economy will continue to require support from our monetary policy for as long as necessary to ensure the robust convergence of inflation to our aim.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes ongoing need for monetary policy support and acknowledges current challenges with inflation below target, suggesting a dovish stance but stops short of indicating further rate cuts, leaning towards holding rates steady.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Parliamentary Week, Brussels, 18 February 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary policy in the new normal - strategy, instruments and transmission
Key quote: Let me conclude by saying that the New Normal is already with us: returning to the pre-crisis status quo is not only unlikely, it is probably unfeasible.
Rationale: Panetta's speech acknowledges the challenges presented by the low interest rate and low inflation environment but does not advocate for immediate policy changes. The focus on understanding and adapting to the 'New Normal' suggests a neutral stance, indicating a likelihood of holding rates steady in the near term.
description: Welcome address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Senior Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the workshop on "Monetary Policy in the New Normal: Strategy, Instruments and Transmission", Rome, 11 October 2019.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Monetary policy in the euro area - past, present and near future
Key quote: Monetary policy must remain expansionary for an extended period of time.
Rationale: Fabio Panetta emphasizes the importance of maintaining an accommodative monetary policy stance to stimulate demand and exert upward pressure on wages. He acknowledges the need for gradual normalization in the future but stresses current low inflation and growth challenges, suggesting a bias towards maintaining current policy settings.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the conference "A Future for Europe", held in memory of Giacomo Vaciago and organised by the Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore and the Associazione per lo Sviluppo degli Studi di Banca e Borsa (ASSBB), Milan, 6 April 2018.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Italian banks - where they stand and the challenges ahead
Key quote: To conclude, now that the economic recovery is gaining momentum, banks can make further progress in strengthening their balance sheets.
Rationale: While the speech recognizes improvements in the Italian banking sector and economy, there is a strong emphasis on ongoing challenges and the need for further progress. Given the current policy rate of -0.4%, the speech leans towards maintaining supportive measures, making a 'hold' decision more likely.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Bank of America Merrill Lynch Italy Day Conference, London, 19 February 2018.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The Italian banking system and the exit from the crisis
Key quote: Although the risks of deflation have declined, upward pressures on prices have not emerged to the extent that they are self-sustained in the medium term or that justify a revision of the monetary policy stance.
Rationale: Panetta acknowledges the improving economic growth and diminishing deflation risks, but also highlights weak core inflation and the absence of self-sustained price pressures, suggesting a continuation of the current monetary policy stance.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the conference "Unione Bancaria e Basilea 3 - Risk &amp; Supervision 2017", organized by the Italian Banking Association (ABI), Rome, 14 June 2017.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Central banking in the XXI century - never say never
Key quote: There are no obvious limits to what central banks can do.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the continued need for expansionary monetary policy given the context of persistently low inflation and growth, while rejecting the notion that monetary policy has reached its limits. Despite this dovish tone, the recognition of some positive effects from recent measures suggests a 'Hold' rather than a cut recommendation.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the SUERF/BAFFI CAREFIN Centre Conference "Central banking and monetary policy: Which will be the new normal?", Milan, 14 April 2016.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The distributional consequences of monetary policy
Key quote: Given how little we know about the distributional implications of monetary policy, central banks should certainly not think of attenuating inequality as an additional implicit policy objective.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the distributional impact of monetary policy, emphasizing potential benefits for inequality reduction through monetary expansions. The focus on expansionary measures and the defense of current policies suggests a dovish stance, but the overall tone remains analytical and not extreme, warranting a 'Hold' on policy rates with moderate probability.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Netherlands Bank, Amsterdam, 20 November 2015.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The transition towards a more stable financial system
Key quote: In this phase a further stiffening of capital and liquidity requirements could impede the supply of credit, delaying the economic upturn.
Rationale: Deputy Governor Panetta highlights the importance of maintaining the current monetary policy to support the ongoing economic recovery and warns against an increase in capital and liquidity requirements which could hinder credit supply, indicating a cautious approach towards tightening policy.
description: Address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Conference on "Strategic choices for the Italian banking industry", organized by the Associazione per lo Sviluppo degli Studi di Banca e Borsa in collaboration with the Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore of Milan, Perugia, 21 March 2015.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: A financial system for growth
Key quote: The scarcity of credit is set to continue in the months to come.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the fragile state of the economy, highlighting issues such as high unemployment and financial constraints. It suggests that monetary policy should remain supportive, implying that interest rates should be held steady to aid economic recovery.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Director General of the Bank of Italy, at The Adam Smith Society, "Italians' savings are in support of growth", Milan, 27 January 2014.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Credit and the financing of firms
Key quote: There can be no enduring recovery without adequate financial support to firms.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges severe economic challenges with no room for growth through deficit spending, while underscoring the need for reform and bank action to support economic recovery. It suggests cautiousness on monetary tightening as the central bank needs to focus on stabilizing the struggling economy.
description: Address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Director General of the Bank of Italy, at the Federazione delle Banche di Credito Cooperativo Lazio Umbria Sardegna, "Reload Banking. La Banca del domani per un nuovo sviluppo dell'Italia", Rome, 21 June 2013.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Banks, finance, growth
Key quote: In order to preserve the prospective recovery, action to support business activity is necessary.
Rationale: Fabio Panetta highlights the difficult economic period Italy is undergoing and emphasizes the need for support to preserve potential recovery. Although the speech details challenges faced by banks, including risks to the credit system and necessary reforms, there is no strong indication of intent to change interest rates imminently. The overall tone suggests caution and a preference to maintain current policy measures.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Director General of the Bank of Italy, at a colloquium entitled "Beyond the crisis: What lies in store for Italian banks?", by Associazione per lo Sviluppo degli Studi di Banca e Borsa in collaboration with Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore of Milan, Perugia, 23 March 2013.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The mission of Gerard Vissering - why we need independent central banks
Key quote: Monetary policy credibility does not come overnight. It has to be earned. Again and again.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of central bank independence and credibility, but does not suggest any specific changes in interest rates or policy direction, thus reflecting a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Koç University, Istanbul, 19 September 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Monetary-fiscal policy mix in the euro area - lessons learnt and the way forward
Key quote: Lately, however, monetary and fiscal policy have gotten mixed up again, although with both policies now having traded places.
Rationale: While Klaas Knot discusses the inefficiencies in the current monetary-fiscal mix, he doesn't advocate for an urgent change in monetary policy. His remarks indicate a desire for fiscal policy to complement monetary efforts, suggesting a balanced view without a specific bias towards immediate rate changes.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the European Central Bank policy panel at the annual congress of the European Economic Association, Rotterdam, 27 August 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Play defensively, but be ready to strike back: a gradual easing of monetary policy
Key quote: We can continue to, slowly but surely, lift our foot off the brake.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes a gradual easing of monetary policy and mentions the ability to reduce rates at a gradual pace. This suggests a somewhat dovish approach, indicating a preference for further rate cuts, provided the data supports such actions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at Analysis Forum, Milan, 20 June 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Main risks to the financial system
Key quote: It is therefore important to base further monetary decisions on incoming data rather than pre-empting future developments.
Rationale: The speech notes that inflation has fallen and expresses confidence in a 'soft landing' for the economy, suggesting a balanced view rather than a strong inclination towards easing or tightening policy. The emphasis on data-dependency indicates a neutral stance.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, prior to the session with the Standing Parliamentary Committee for Finance, The Hague, 18 June 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Learn from the past and plan for the future - a perspective on monetary policy
Key quote: Consequently, it can soon be appropriate to ease the currently restrictive monetary policy stance, and gradually take our foot off the brake.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes confidence in returning to the inflation target and the potential for easing restrictive measures, indicating a somewhat dovish stance but a continued emphasis on data-dependency, suggesting a 'Hold' stance in the upcoming meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 3rd annual Barclays-Centre for Economic Policy Research (CEPR) International Monetary Policy Forum, London, 28 May 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Central bank capital - of capital importance?
Key quote: In transitioning to a phase with a normalised monetary policy, these considerations will also help to normalise central bank capital adequacy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on central bank capital and risks associated with recent monetary policy tools like QE, but does not suggest any immediate change in policy. Klaas Knot highlights the importance of capital adequacy and transparency without indicating a need for rate changes, suggesting a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the DNB-Risk Management Workshop on "Central bank capital in turbulent times", Amsterdam, 12 April 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: High debt and financial stress - implications for Asian financial stability
Key quote: Vulnerabilities in the global financial system remain elevated. Tightening financial conditions and high levels of debt create challenges for both bank and non-bank lenders.
Rationale: The speech discusses financial vulnerabilities and the challenges posed by high debt and tightening conditions but does not indicate clear direction regarding monetary policy adjustments. It highlights the need for resilience and coordination, suggesting a cautious approach to maintaining the current policy environment.
description: Speech (online) by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank and chair of Financial Stability Board, at the ASEAN+3 Economic Cooperation and Financial Stability Forum, Kanazawa, 5 December 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The recent financial tumult - lessons and responses
Key quote: And, of course, until inflation is returned to target, monetary policy space is similarly constrained.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial stability and lessons from recent financial turbulence, with an emphasis on the resilience of the financial system rather than providing a direct stance on monetary policy. However, it acknowledges limitations in monetary policy due to inflation targets, suggesting a balanced view rather than leaning strongly in any particular directional stance for policy changes.
description: Keynote speech (virtual) by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 7th Annual Conference of the European Systemic Risk Board "Financial stability challenges ahead: emerging risks and regulation", 16 November 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: You can't always get what you want, but after 25 years of EMU, we just might find we get what we need
Key quote: The role of budget constraints to discipline fiscal policy is particularly relevant today, as inflation is still too high and government spending keeps adding to inflationary pressures.
Rationale: The speech discusses concerns about inflationary pressures and the need for fiscal discipline, indicating some hawkish tendencies. However, it also acknowledges the need for growth and investments at the European level, suggesting a balanced approach, leading to a prediction to 'Hold' rates to address the underlying issues without increasing them.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at a seminar, organised by the Netherlands Bank and Bruegel, Amsterdam, 9 November 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Challenges for monetary policy that make us think
Key quote: Restrictive policies will likely remain needed for some time to come to get inflation back down to target.
Rationale: Knot expresses a relatively hawkish view by indicating the necessity of maintaining restrictive policies for some time, yet he is also cautious due to the long transmission lags and the need for data confirmation.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 26th Annual DNB Research Conference "Challenges for monetary policy that make us think", Amsterdam, 2 November 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Regaining control
Key quote: To continue this progress, and reach our target, restrictive policies will likely remain needed for some time to come.
Rationale: Knot acknowledges the progress in combating inflation but emphasizes the need for maintaining restrictive policies. The speech implies caution in declaring victory over inflation, suggesting holding rates, while being prepared to act if disinflation stalls.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Euro50 Marrakech Roundtable on 'Inflation, Deflation: Looking for price stability in various parts of the world', Marrakech, 13 October 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Introduction to the press conference on the Financial Stability Report
Key quote: Inflation has started to decline, but is expected to remain above 2% for some time to come.
Rationale: Klaas Knot highlights both the necessity of tight monetary policy to bring inflation down and the risks associated with higher interest rates. His comments suggest a balanced view, acknowledging current economic challenges while also recognizing the benefits of higher rates to financial stability. This suggests a 'hold' stance as Knot may want to evaluate the effects of past hikes before any further action.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the press conference on the Financial Stability Report, Amsterdam, 9 October 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Bold, but realistic - monetary policy and financial stability
Key quote: Central bankers will have to continue tightening monetary policy for as long as necessary, until we see inflation return to our two percent target over the medium term.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the need to continue tightening monetary policy to bring inflation back to target, indicative of a somewhat hawkish stance. He acknowledges the progress made in inflation reduction but points out the necessity of further action to address persistent inflationary pressures.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 5th Capital Markets Seminar, jointly organised by the European Stability Mechanism, the European Investment Bank and the European Commission, Luxembourg, 6 June 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: To improve is to change
Key quote: While higher interest rates generally benefit financial institutions, the pace of the recent increases and the adjustments financial markets and institutions need to make as a result are cause for concern.
Rationale: The speech by Mr. Klaas Knot emphasizes both the resilience and challenges faced by the financial system, with specific reference to recent events like the SVB collapse and Credit Suisse issues. However, it does not signal a strong leaning towards either tightening or easing monetary policy, thus representing a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the International Banking Summit, Brussels, 1 June 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Mamma Mia, here we go again? Lessons from Silikon Valley Bank and Credit Suisse
Key quote: We need to remain vigilant. We need to remain diligent, in mapping, measuring and monitoring vulnerabilities.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the importance of regulation and supervision to prevent financial instability, without indicating an immediate need for changes in interest rates. Knot stresses vigilance and learning from past experiences, advocating for strong regulatory frameworks while not suggesting a shift in monetary policy stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi High-level Seminar 2023, Stockholm, 28 April 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Striving for financial stability
Key quote: To maintain financial stability we do not only have to adapt to changing conditions, we also have to create the conditions to be able to adapt when stability is threatened.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of financial stability and resilience, highlighting the need for buffers and international cooperation. The references to current risks and the importance of stable financial systems suggest a neutral stance, focusing on maintaining stability rather than immediate policy changes.
description: Text of the Whitaker Lecture by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, Dublin, 19 April 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: In resolute pursuit of price stability
Key quote: Our response needs to be resolute, implying that monetary policy needs to enter restrictive territory to dampen demand.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasized the need for resolute action to address high inflation and mentioned that monetary policy should enter restrictive territory. This implies a hawkish stance, suggesting a likelihood to raise rates to tackle persistent inflation.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 32nd Frankfurt European Banking Congress, Frankfurt am Main, 18 November 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Inflation strikes back - drivers and policy reactions
Key quote: The question is: does this uncertainty imply that policy-makers should react strongly to these kind of shocks? Act faster, intervene earlier to avoid the dangerous fall-out of inflation?
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the high inflation rates and suggests that monetary policymakers need to react strongly, implying a hawkish stance towards raising rates to control rising inflation.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 25th Annual DNB Research Conference "Inflation strikes back: drivers and policy reactions", Amsterdam, 10 November 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Policy responses in a pandemic- and conflict-impacted world
Key quote: I am increasingly convinced that we need to do more than just removing accommodation to fulfil our price stability mandate.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the importance of taking decisive steps to address high inflation, mentioning clear intention to raise policy rates and possibly reduce the central bank's balance sheet, reflecting a strong commitment to combating inflation.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the G30 37th Annual International Banking Seminar, Washington DC, 15 October 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Spreading our wings. How monetary and fiscal policy can fight inflation
Key quote: And I anticipate further rate hikes over the coming months, to be specified meeting by meeting, based on data, and guided by our objective of price stability.
Rationale: Klaas Knot's speech clearly advocates for strong measures against inflation, emphasizing the need for further rate hikes and rapid transition from accommodative monetary policy. This indicates a hawkish stance, suggesting a strong likelihood of voting for a rate increase.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank,to the Economic and Financial Committee, at the Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, 23 September 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: From thaler to tackle. On how to lift us out of the current crises
Key quote: In response, the ECB rallied to raise policy rates to calm down the business cycle and keep inflation expectations anchored. We will continue doing so until the inflation outlook has stabilized around our 2% target in the medium term.
Rationale: Knot explicitly mentions raising policy rates and the commitment to continue doing so until inflation is under control, which indicates a hawkish stance aimed at tackling rising inflation.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi 2022 Financial Forum, Prague, 9 September 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: A time to act. The outlook for monetary policy in the euro area.
Key quote: We must forcefully tackle the still growing problem of persistently high inflation, within the core of our mandate.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the urgency to address high inflation and suggests that interest rate increases with some front-loading may be necessary. The strong language and focus on acting decisively against inflation highlight a hawkish stance, suggesting a high likelihood of voting to raise rates.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Danske Bank, Copenhagen, 30 August 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The outlook for inflation and monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: The recent increase in inflationary pressures does not mean that we have already achieved our goal of inflation converging durably to our 2% target.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes that while transitory inflationary pressures are present, they have not led to durable target-level inflation. He indicates that current monetary accommodations will not end soon and stresses the need for policy optionality, which suggests a balanced approach rather than a shift towards tightening or easing.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the UBS European Conference, 9 November 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Back to the future - euro area inflation outlook is back on track
Key quote: Based on the current outlook, the ECB's monetary policy intention is to keep rates at their current or lower levels until we see a durable convergence of inflation.
Rationale: The speech indicates expectations for inflation to temporarily rise, but the ECB plans to maintain current or lower rates in the meantime, implying a neutral stance with a slight bias towards holding rates steady.
description: Speech (virtually) by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Euro50 Group meeting "Coping with the legacy of the Covid-19 crisis", Washington, 14 October 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Introduction to the press conference
Key quote: I also still expect that the inflation shock we are currently witnessing is largely temporary.
Rationale: Klaas Knot acknowledges the current inflationary pressures but views them as largely temporary. He discusses vulnerabilities in financial markets and the housing market, which suggests a cautious tone. However, there is no indication of a need to tighten policy immediately, implying a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, to the press conference of the Financial Stability Report, 11 October 2021

author: Klaas Knot
title: The case for fiscal stabilization in a low interest rate environment
Key quote: In order to make our monetary union more stable, we need a fiscal framework that enhances coordination between member states and allows for a better alignment of monetary and fiscal policy over the entire economic cycle.
Rationale: Knot emphasizes the importance of fiscal policy in conjunction with monetary policy to stabilize the economy in a low interest rate environment, suggesting a somewhat accommodative approach but not advocating for immediate changes in interest rates.
description: Text of the Witteveen lecture by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Erasmus School of Economics, Rotterdam, 11 June 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: From intensive care to full recovery - finding the way out of the Covid crisis
Key quote: Monetary policy in the Eurozone will have to continue to support the recovery.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the importance of ongoing support from monetary policy but discusses eventual withdrawal and resilience rebuilding, indicating a gradual but cautious approach to normalizing policy. This suggests a 'somewhat hawkish' stance, favoring holding rates to balance recovery support and careful exit planning.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi High Level Seminar 2021, 16 April 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: International spillovers and the ECB's monetary policy
Key quote: Not every rise in yields is inconsistent with our pledge to maintain favorable financing conditions.
Rationale: Knot indicates the ECB's commitment to maintaining favorable financing conditions by frontloading asset purchases, showing a willingness to loosen policy if necessary, despite acknowledging some positive signals from higher inflation expectations.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at a panel of the CF40, Euro50 Group and Peterson Institute for International Economics (PIIE) conference on "The Dollar, the Euro and the Renminbi in the new geopolitical environment", 27 March 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Monetary policy in the face of the Corona pandemic
Key quote: Monetary authorities have to stand ready to act and contribute to tackling any escalation of the Corona crisis. But beyond that, there are limits to what monetary policy can achieve.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the limits of monetary policy in the current environment and suggests readiness to recalibrate instruments, indicating a dovish stance. However, it also acknowledges the importance of fiscal policy and holistic approaches, which tempers the dovishness slightly. Therefore, it's likely he would prefer to hold rates while assessing the effectiveness of other tools.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank (DNB), at the UBS European Conference, online, 10 November, 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The European Central Bank's strategy review against the background of the Covid-19 crisis
Key quote: First, it is fiscal policy that has to be in the lead in mitigating the macro-economic consequences of this prolonged public health emergency.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the need for fiscal policy to take the lead, supported by monetary policy in keeping financing costs low. Given the already stretched monetary policy measures, the tone is somewhat dovish, indicating support for holding rates to assist economic recovery during the pandemic.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Euro50 Group Videoconference, 15 October 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: COVID-19 - how to contain the impact on the financial system
Key quote: But now is not the time to phase out the fiscal and monetary stimulus.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes continued support and stimulus due to ongoing economic risks, suggesting a dovish stance. However, the acknowledgment of eventual need to halt the stimulus suggests a somewhat dovish position rather than fully dovish, indicating a likely hold on rates.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the online IIF Annual Membership Meeting, 14 October 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Introductory - Financial Stability Report Autumn 2020
Key quote: Particularly now that a second wave has arrived, we need to be especially cautious about a premature scaling back of these crisis measures.
Rationale: While acknowledging the economic challenges and the second wave of COVID-19, the focus is on maintaining support measures rather than immediate monetary adjustments, indicating a somewhat dovish stance toward maintaining current policy rates.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the  press conference for the autumn 2020 Financial Stability Report, Amsterdam, 13 October 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Monetary policy responses to the corona crisis
Key quote: The necessity of continued monetary policy support follows from the mandate of the ECB, which states that price stability is the primary objective.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the need for continued monetary support to prevent deflationary threats and support recovery, indicating a dovish stance. However, he also highlights the need to balance with potential side effects, suggesting a somewhat cautious approach rather than fully dovish.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum, Berlin, 11 September 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Relaunching growth in Europe together
Key quote: It is also important to note that the fund is temporary. There are no direct transfers between countries. Nor do countries assume responsibility for each other's debts.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for collective action and coordination to address economic divergence within the Eurozone but stops short of advocating for immediate changes to monetary policy. The mention of avoiding direct financial responsibilities suggests a cautionary stance on aggressive interventions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum, Berlin, 10 September 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Emerging from the crisis stronger together"- How we can make Europe more resilient, prosperous and sustainable
Key quote: That is why I see no reason to cut spending or raise taxes at this time.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on the need for European cooperation, integration, and economic policy coordination to emerge from the crisis stronger. While it touches on economic issues and the role of central banks, it does not express a clear stance on monetary policy changes, hence suggesting a neutral position with no immediate call for rate adjustments.
description: Text of the HJ Schoo lecture by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, Amsterdam, 1 September 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Entering and exiting the frozen-state economy
Key quote: Our policy is directed at maintaining favourable financing conditions for households, firms and governments, to mitigate any amplification of the 'corona shock' through financial channels.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the need for maintaining favorable financing conditions and acknowledges the ongoing and future challenges, highlighting a supportive stance from central banks. The speech focuses on mitigating adverse impacts rather than taking any contractionary monetary policy action, indicating a dovish position given the crisis context.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at "Virtual session with Klaas Knot: the economic impact of COVID-19", organised by Danske Bank, 21 April 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Macroprudential modesty
Key quote: The observation that macroprudential policies cannot be fully relied upon to contain systemic risks would also have to be taken into account in the conduct of monetary and fiscal policy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the limitations and modest impact of macroprudential policies, without suggesting significant changes to monetary policy. The emphasis is on the coordination of macroeconomic policy tools, implying a neutral stance overall.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 82nd Plenary Meeting of the Group of Thirty, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, New York, City, 6 December 2019.

author: Klaas Knot
title: What do low inflation and low interest rates
Key quote: A discussion is therefore warranted on the merits of increased flexibility.
Rationale: The speech discusses the persistent low inflation environment and the limitations of monetary policy tools, advocating for increased flexibility, which suggests a dovish tilt but not extremely so. The implication is that with these considerations, holding rates steady to reassess strategy is the likely outcome.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the farewell seminar for ABN Amro's Chief Economist Han de Jong, Amsterdam, 4 December 2019.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Knowns and unknowns of monetary policy instruments implications for monetary policy strategies
Key quote: Our knowledge of unconventional monetary policy tools is still less developed than our understanding of conventional interest rate policies.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the need for caution in employing unconventional tools and suggests a strategic review, indicating neutrality towards immediate monetary policy changes. The speech reflects a balance of understanding current measures while acknowledging uncertainties and the potential need for future adjustments rather than immediate rate changes.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the European Banking Institute Policy Conference "Banking in Europe; a political, a monetary and a supervisory perspective", Frankfurt am Main, 14 November 2019.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The advanced countries - economic challenges for the medium term
Key quote: Without additional action, once more monetary policy will risk ending up as the only, and perhaps stuttering, engine supporting growth.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes challenges for EMU and recommends strengthening policies beyond monetary measures, indicating a tilt towards a somewhat dovish stance by highlighting risks and reliance on monetary policy alone. However, no immediate aggressive action is suggested, thus leading to a 'Hold' prediction.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the panel "The Advanced Countries: Economic Challenges for the Medium Term" during the G30 34th International Banking Seminar, Washington DC, 20 October 2019.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The quest for policy scope - implications for monetary policy strategies
Key quote: Despite accommodative monetary policy, inflation may remain persistently below the central bank's objective for a considerable amount of time.
Rationale: Klaas Knot discusses persistently low inflation and the challenges it poses for monetary policy, suggesting even more aggressive easing might be needed. This implies a dovish stance. Although aggressive easing is implied, the speech's broader context and uncertainty around effective measures suggest he would likely vote to hold rates while still analyzing impacts.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the fourth annual high-level conference "Racing for Economic Leadership: EU-US Perspectives", New York City, 16 October 2019.

author: Klaas Knot
title: "Easy Money, Uneasy Finance" On the relationship between monetary policy and financial stability
Key quote: As long as inflation remains subdued, central banks are likely to maintain an ample degree of monetary accommodation.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of maintaining financial stability and continuing regulatory reforms while stating that monetary policy is likely to remain accommodative as long as inflation is subdued. This suggests a balanced view without a strong indication of tightening or easing monetary policy, hence a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Peterson Institute for International Economics, Washington DC, 24 September 2018.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Modesty in times of uncertainty - monetary policy after the crisis
Key quote: Absent deflation risk, a full phasing-out of net asset purchases from September 2018 onwards is warranted.
Rationale: Klaas Knot advocates for a cautious approach to unconventional monetary policy measures, emphasizing the need for modesty and patience. Given the robust economic growth and lack of deflation risk, he suggests phasing out the Asset Purchase Programme, indicating a somewhat hawkish stance but not a call for immediate rate hikes.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Business Economists' Annual Dinner, London, 29 November 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Pendulums and pitfalls on the road to resolution
Key quote: The crisis illustrates the importance of quickly restoring the banking system, both for the real economy and the effectiveness of monetary transmission.
Rationale: The speech by Klaas Knot focuses on bank resolution and regulatory frameworks rather than directly addressing future monetary policy actions. However, he emphasizes the importance of a resilient banking system for effective monetary policy transmission, suggesting that policy rates might remain stable to support this objective.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the annual Single Resolution Board (SRB) Conference, Brussels, 29 September 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Striking the right balance in policies and institutions in the euro area
Key quote: Consequently, the main rationale for central bank asset purchases has disappeared.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes that the improved economic outlook and reduced deflationary risks lessen the need for continued monetary policy expansion, suggesting a bias towards normalization, yet not immediately advocating for a rate rise, aligning with a somewhat hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at Econopolis' Twain Talks, Brussels, 20 September 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Tilting the policy mix in the euro area
Key quote: Fortunately, the improved economic outlook reduces the need for additional monetary stimulus.
Rationale: While Mr. Knot acknowledges the unprecedented monetary accommodation and side-effects, his emphasis on gradually reducing asset purchases and rebalancing towards longer-term structural issues suggests a neutral stance. This indicates a preference to hold rates while focusing on structural and fiscal reforms.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Finanzmarktklausur Wirtschaftsrat, Berlin, 26 January 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Germany and the quest for a stable monetary union
Key quote: Monetary policy cannot solve the problems of EMU. It can only buy time that should be used effectively.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for structural reforms and improvements at both the national and European levels, while also acknowledging improvements made so far. Klaas Knot does not advocate for changing interest rates, but instead focuses on non-monetary measures, suggesting a neutral stance with a likelihood of maintaining the current policy rate.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Duitsland Instituut, Amsterdam, 7 April 2014.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Central bank independence and unconventional monetary policy - challenges for the European Central Bank
Key quote: It is imperative that the ECB sticks to its mandate to maintain price stability over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of central bank independence and the need for accountability, while also acknowledging the limitations of monetary policy. Knot advocates for maintaining price stability and transparency without abrupt changes, suggesting a balanced stance with no immediate shift in policy direction.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Bank of Mexico international conference "Central bank independence - Progress and challenges", Mexico City, 15 October 2013.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The eurozone crisis - causes and solutions
Key quote: European policymakers and central bankers do their utmost to solve this crisis.
Rationale: Mr. Knot's speech highlighted both the challenges and measures taken to address the Eurozone crisis but did not suggest imminent changes to monetary policy or rate adjustments, indicating a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, to the Asia Society, Hong Kong, 15 October 2012.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Dutch financial stability in the Asian era
Key quote: Further debt reduction is absolutely necessary, even if it will probably reduce growth in the short run.
Rationale: Knot emphasizes the importance of debt reduction despite short-term growth impacts, suggesting a focus on long-term stability and credibility, which leans hawkish. However, given the complexity of the European debt crisis and the zero policy rate, this translates to a most likely 'Hold' stance with a tendency towards tight policy measures in the future.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the symposium "The future of the Netherlands in the Asian era", Center for Japanese Studies, University of Groningen, 31 August 2012.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The future of EMU and the Netherlands' place in Europe
Key quote: Therefore, Dutch policymakers and central bankers should do their utmost to solve this crisis.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasizes the importance of solving the sovereign debt crisis and discusses structural reforms and fiscal discipline, which indicates a concern for stability and might lean towards somewhat hawkish. However, his discussion on past ECB actions suggests a likelihood to hold rates to ensure economic stability.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, before the OMFIF (Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum), London, 17 February 2012.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Monetary policy and the Great Financial Crisis
Key quote: All monetary policy can do is to buy time, at the cost of stretching its mandate to the limit, if not beyond.
Rationale: Klaas Knot emphasized the limitations of monetary policy in addressing the broader crisis, indicated risks associated with unconventional measures, and suggested a need for a gradual exit from such tools, suggesting a preference for maintaining the current policy stance rather than tightening it further.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Third Annual Nyenrode Finance Day, Breukelen, 28 October 2011.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: The central bank of the future - opportunities and challenges
Key quote: Learning from both successes and potential errors of the past will be instrumental in shaping our future policy decisions.
Rationale: The speech discusses both challenges and opportunities for the central bank, indicating a balanced outlook on current monetary policy tools and the need for thoughtful future strategies. There is no strong indication that the policy rate should be adjusted immediately, suggesting a 'Hold' stance at the next meeting.
description: Opening remarks by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Oesterreichische Nationalbank, the Austrian central bank, at the Oesterreichische Nationalbank (OeNB) Economics Conference and SUERF Conference Colloquium, Vienna, 11 June 2024.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: Normalization of monetary policy - challenges and outlook
Key quote: However, let me reiterate that the ECB will continue to follow a data-dependent and meeting-by-meeting approach to determining the appropriate level and duration of restriction.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes a data-dependent approach and meeting-by-meeting assessment, indicating a careful balance without a strong inclination towards raising or cutting rates. This suggests a neutral stance, leading to the prediction of holding the current policy rate.
description: Speech by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Oesterreichische Nationalbank, the Austrian central bank, at a reception of the Austrian Embassy, London, 29 April 2024.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: Lámfalussy Lecture 2023
Key quote: Our monetary policy must continue to show its teeth until we see a credible convergence to our inflation target - a convergence that is also felt by the wider public.
Rationale: Governor Holzmann's speech emphasizes the need for continued strong action to combat inflation and maintain public confidence in monetary policy. He expresses concerns about high inflation rates and the risk of doing too little, signaling a preference for raising rates to ensure credibility and price stability.
