description: Text of the Lámfalussy Lecture by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Oesterreichische Nationalbank, the Austrian central bank, at the Lámfalussy Lectures Conference, Budapest, 6 February 2023.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: Challenges of balancing monetary policy with fiscal policy
Key quote: Accommodating monetary policy with low rates of interest allows fiscal policy to expand its policy scope.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation to support fiscal policy, reflecting a somewhat dovish stance. Given the current economic climate and policy rate of -0.5%, the speaker is likely to support holding rates steady to maintain such monetary support.
description: Opening statement by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Central Bank of the Republic of Austria, at the Warwick Economics Summit 2021, 5 February 2021.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: To each crisis its analogy, to each analogy its critical reflection
Key quote: The first debate I think we should be having now is about when and how we can achieve a structured, well-timed decoupling of monetary policy from the current unconventional contingency measures.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on reflecting on monetary policy challenges and strategic considerations for the future rather than advocating for immediate policy changes. The emphasis is on the future trajectory of monetary policy rather than pushing for immediate action, which suggests a neutral stance.
description: Opening remarks by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Central Bank of the Republic of Austria, at the Konrad-Adenauer-Haus, Berlin, 11 September 2020.

author: Claudia Buch
title: Bridges to the future - managing bank risk amid uncertainty
Key quote: Banks' future resilience hinges on their ability to adapt to a changing environment marked by higher interest rates and evolving risks.
Rationale: The speech focused on the challenges and uncertainties facing banks, highlighting the need for improved risk management and preparation for future risks. While there is acknowledgement of higher interest rates and profitability pressures, it remains balanced between potential upsides and vulnerabilities without explicitly calling for a monetary policy shift. Thus, a 'Hold' prediction aligns with this neutral assessment.
description: Speech by Prof Claudia Buch, Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Morgan Stanley annual conference, London, 12 March 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: This time is different or back to basics? Reflections on monetary policy normalisation
Key quote: There were good reasons for easing monetary policy: inflation has continued to slow down, and inflation expectations are close to the ECB's 2 percent target.
Rationale: The speaker discusses recent rate cuts, indicating a dovish stance due to slowing inflation and subdued economic activity. By lowering rates to stimulate economic recovery, the speech signals a preference for easing policy further if necessary.
description: Policy keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland and Centre for Economic Policy Research (CEPR) Joint Conference, Helsinki, 13 September 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: The European and Finnish economies - pursuing growth in the shadow of geopolitical challenges
Key quote: In my view, the recent increase in negative growth risks in the euro area has reinforced the case for a rate cut at the next ECB monetary policy meeting in September - provided that disinflation is indeed on track.
Rationale: Olli Rehn acknowledges the negative growth risks in the euro area, points out the slowdown in inflation, and suggests that a rate cut might be justified if disinflation continues, indicating a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Fireside chat by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, organised by the European American Chamber of Commerce New York in collaboration with the Consulate General of Finland, New York City, 19 August 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy in low and high inflation environments
Key quote: The ECB Governing Council is determined to ensure that inflation stabilizes to the 2% medium-term target in a timely manner.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges progress towards the inflation target and emphasizes monitoring inflation dynamics, suggesting a balanced view between risks and achievements. There is no indication of an imminent rate change, supporting a 'hold' decision.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland and First Vice-Chair of the European Systemic Risk Board, at the Bank of Finland's 3rd International Monetary Policy Conference "Monetary Policy in Low and High Inflation Environments", Helsinki, 26 June 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Europe's economy - taming inflation, tackling productivity
Key quote: Yesterday we decided at the Governing Council of the European Central Bank to reduce the ECB's key monetary policy rates by 0.25 percentage points.
Rationale: The speech highlights a recent decision to cut rates, acknowledges progress in disinflation, and improvements in economic activity, suggesting a preference for easing monetary policy further to support growth.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland and First Vice-Chair of the European Systemic Risk Board, at the 2024 RiskLab/BoF/ESRB Conference on AI and Systemic Risk Analytics, Helsinki, 7 June 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Price dynamics
Key quote: Thanks to this disinflationary process, inflation is converging to our 2% target in a sustained way, and the time is thus ripe in June to ease the monetary policy stance and start cutting rates.
Rationale: The speech suggests that the central bank is likely to cut rates given that inflation is converging towards the target. The emphasis on easing the monetary stance to avoid delaying closing the negative output gap and acknowledging the fading of supply shocks is consistent with a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the 2024 BOJ-IMES Conference "Price Dynamics and Monetary Policy Challenges: Lessons Learned and Going Forward", hosted by the Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies, Tokyo, 27 May 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Dialling back monetary restraint
Key quote: As headline inflation and underlying inflation have continued to slow down and inflation expectations have remained well anchored, we can start dialling back monetary restraint as summer approaches.
Rationale: Governor Rehn's speech indicates that with inflation declining and economic growth being delayed, there is room to dial back monetary policy restraint. The speech suggests the ECB is considering a rate cut in June if the current trends in inflation continue, signaling a somewhat dovish perspective.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Citi Macro Forum, Washington DC, 18 April 2024.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Whither r*? The outlook for the natural rate of interest under short-run inflationary pressures and structural shifts
Key quote: The Governing Council's future decisions will continue to follow a data-dependent approach.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes a data-dependent approach and acknowledges uncertainty in monetary policy decisions. Given the ongoing monetary tightening and the fact that inflation is expected to moderate, the speech does not strongly advocate for further rate hikes or cuts, suggesting a neutral stance likely resulting in holding rates steady.
description: Policy keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland and CEPR Joint Conference 'Monetary Policy in Times of Large Shocks', Helsinki, 16 June 2023.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Eternal challenges in monetary policy
Key quote: In my view, it is essential that we see a steady and sustained decline in underlying inflation before we start considering easing the policy again.
Rationale: While acknowledging risks of global policy over-tightening, Rehn emphasizes the need for a sustained decline in inflation before policy easing, indicating a cautious approach to maintaining restrictive rates.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the 2023 Bank of Japan and Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies (BOJ-IMES) conference, hosted by the Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies, Tokyo, 1 June 2023.

author: Olli Rehn
title: European economic policy in the times of crises - rules, discretion and coordination
Key quote: By tightening monetary policy, the risk of a detrimental wage-price spiral will be reduced and inflation will be stabilised at its target of 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of tightening monetary policy to prevent inflation from becoming entrenched and to avoid a wage-price spiral. The commitment to further interest rate hikes, if necessary, to stabilize inflation supports a hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the EU Heads of Mission Lunch Seminar, Bank of Finland, Helsinki, 28 November 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: The European and Finnish economies in the shadow of the war and energy crisis
Key quote: By tightening monetary policy, the risk of a detrimental wage-price spiral will be reduced and inflation will be stabilised at its target of 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: Olli Rehn discusses the need to tighten monetary policy to prevent a wage-price spiral and to stabilize inflation at its 2% target, which indicates a somewhat hawkish stance. Although inflation is primarily driven by energy prices, which are not directly manageable through monetary policy, the speech conveys a strong concern about maintaining inflation expectations, suggesting a likelihood to continue raising rates.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at a public hearing of the Committee of Economic Affairs of the Parliament of Finland (Eduskunta), Helsinki, 22 November 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Making monetary policy in the shadow of Russia's war and the energy crisis
Key quote: That's why we have frontloaded the transition from highly accommodative policy rates towards levels that will stabilize inflation to our two percent inflation target over the medium term.
Rationale: Governor Rehn emphasizes the need for decisive action to address high inflation and suggests that monetary policy tightening is necessary. This suggests a hawkish stance towards raising interest rates to stabilize inflation and avoid a wage-price spiral.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Citi Macro Forum, Washington DC, 14 October 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy and the contemporary dynamics of inflation
Key quote: Because inflation is already far too high and is likely to stay above target for an extended period, the ECB Governing Council began a tightening cycle in July by raising our three key interest rates by 50 basis points. Last week, the Governing Council decided to raise them by an additional 75 bps, and we can assume further rises going forward.
Rationale: Olli Rehn's speech indicates a strong stance on addressing high inflation, with consecutive interest rate hikes and plans for further tightening. This clearly reflects a hawkish outlook, prioritizing inflation control and suggesting further rate raises are necessary.
description: Policy keynote by Mr Olli Rehn, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the BoF-CEPR Joint Conference 'Monetary Policy in the Post-Pandemic Era', Helsinki, 16 September 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Beyond crypto-mania - digital euro as monetary anchor
Key quote: The ongoing monetary policy normalisation is a response to the dramatically changed inflation outlook.
Rationale: The speech largely discusses the concept and future of digital currencies and references current monetary policy adjustments without signaling a clear stance on immediate rate changes, indicating a neutral position.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Finland, at an panel at University of California, Berkeley, California, 23 August 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy at a crossroads
Key quote: That is why the ECB's first interest rate hike in over a decade will take place soon.
Rationale: Governor Rehn's speech indicates a strong inclination toward raising rates, emphasizing the need for policy normalization and the upcoming interest rate lift-off. The focus on controlling inflation expectations and exiting negative interest rates further supports a somewhat hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Policy panel at the Dallas Fed Conference, Dallas, 18 June 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Reflections on the post-crisis lessons learnt in European monetary and macroprudential policies
Key quote: That's why the first interest rate hike in over a decade is likely to take place in the summer.
Rationale: The speech discusses the necessity of moving out of negative interest rate territory quickly due to concerns over unanchored inflation expectations and rising inflation figures, suggesting a likelihood of a rate hike.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Farewell seminar for Anneli Tuominen, Director General of the FIN-FSA, Helsinki, 18 May 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Two decades of the euro – which way forward?
Key quote: If, however, inflation threatens to climb too high and for a prolonged period, the ECB's monetary policy will work to prevent this by reducing the purchase programmes and refinancing operations as well as by raising policy interest rates.
Rationale: Olli Rehn acknowledges current inflationary pressures and supports a gradual normalization of monetary policy, which suggests a somewhat hawkish stance. He does not, however, indicate an immediate need to raise rates, suggesting a 'Hold' prediction for the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at a Bank of Finland webinar, Helsinki, 10 February 2022.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy in the emerging post-pandemic context
Key quote: In my view, euro area inflation is still mostly transitory, even if some of its components are partly more persistent than previously expected.
Rationale: Rehn emphasizes that inflation is expected to moderate and remain in line with ECB's targets, indicating that the ECB is inclined not to overreact to transitory inflation peaks. His tone suggests a cautious approach, supportive of maintaining the current policy stance, hence likely voting to hold interest rates.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland-SUERF Joint Conference "Monetary policy approaches: a comparative appraisal", 19 October 2021.

author: Olli Rehn
title: New avenues for monetary policy
Key quote: Thus we maintain our very accommodative monetary policy stance, appropriate for the rebounding eurozone economy and the still remaining uncertainties.
Rationale: The speech highlights a commitment to maintaining accommodative monetary policy with a symmetric 2% inflation target, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. The ECB is expected to hold rates given current uncertainty, as they seek to support recovery while acknowledging inflation dynamics.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland - Centre for Economic Policy Research (CEPR) Joint Conference "New avenues for monetary policy", 10 September 2021.

author: Olli Rehn
title: A European and Rawlsian view on inequality, inclusive growth and monetary policy
Key quote: In fact, considerations about labour-income and wealth inequality strengthen the case for a 'lower for longer' strategy, when monetary policy is constrained by the effective lower bound.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to keep interest rates low for a longer period to address inequality and support employment, aligning with a somewhat dovish stance. The ECB's current inflation stance and economic outlook suggest holding rates rather than cutting or raising them.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the high-level panel discussion on "Central banking after the pandemic: the challenges of inequality and inclusive growth", CEBRA Annual Meeting, virtual, 8 July 2021.

author: Olli Rehn
title: It's the resilience, smarty! - Lessons of the COVID-19 crisis for systemic risk analysis and financial sector policies
Key quote: Premature tightening of financing conditions must be prevented, as this would pose a risk to the ongoing economic recovery and the outlook for inflation.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes that inflation is transitory and below target, indicating a preference for continued accommodative policy. The focus on maintaining favorable financial conditions suggests the speaker is unlikely to support tightening, thus aligning with a decision to hold rates constant.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at a joint conference by RiskLab at Arcada, Bank of Finland and European Systemic Risk Board, held at Bank of Finland, Helsinki, 1 July 2021.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Rethinking the ECB's strategy in the world of low rates
Key quote: By way of its forward guidance, the Governing Council has made it clear that it is ready to do whatever it takes, within its mandate, to support economic activity across Europe in these tough times.
Rationale: Rehn's speech emphasizes the need for accommodative monetary policy in the current environment of low inflation and economic challenges due to the pandemic. His focus on ensuring inflation expectations do not remain too low and the importance of fiscal policy working alongside monetary policy suggests a 'somewhat dovish' stance, though he does not advocate for immediate rate cuts, warranting a prediction of 'Hold'.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland webinar "New Challenges to Monetary Policy Strategies", 24 November 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Eurozone - monetary policy and strategy review
Key quote: Through its forward guidance, the Governing Council has stated that it is ready to do whatever it takes, within its mandate, to maintain price stability and support economic activity across Europe in these tough times.
Rationale: The speech highlights the ECB's highly accommodative monetary policy stance and emphasizes further support if needed. The focus on a symmetric inflation target and acknowledging low inflation expectations suggests a dovish bias, indicating a likelihood to hold rates given current negative rates.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Citi Virtual Macro Forum, 14 October 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy tools and their impact on the macroeconomy
Key quote: This week the Governing Council decided to reconfirm its accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: Rehn highlights the ECB's stance of ensuring stimulus and readiness to adjust instruments, reflecting a somewhat dovish approach in light of the economic challenges posed by COVID-19. The emphasis on accommodative policy suggests a preference to hold rates while monitoring economic conditions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland and CEPR Joint Webinar on "Monetary Policy Tools and Their Impact on the Macroeconomy", 12 September 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: To what extent should the State or the European Union use monetary and budgetary policies to counter the effects of crises and promote business development?
Key quote: This justifies the forceful monetary policy accommodation by the ECB, which is both proportionate and necessary.
Rationale: Olli Rehn emphasized the necessity of maintaining the current strong monetary policy accommodation in response to disinflationary pressures and potential deflation. He cautioned against a premature withdrawal of monetary support, indicating a dovish stance, but simultaneously recognized future needs for normalization, which moderates the stance slightly.
description: Initial remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, in a panel on "State at the helm of the economy", "Les Rencontres Economiques 2020" webinar, 3 July 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: A globally symmetric crisis calls for a globally coordinated and forceful policy response
Key quote: Together with the substantial monetary policy stimulus already in place, these measures will provide ample liquidity and funding support to euro area households, businesses and banks.
Rationale: The speech highlights an overwhelming focus on providing support and stimulus to combat the economic effects of the pandemic, emphasizing coordinated global and regional interventions. This implies a dovish stance but the acknowledgment of ample existing measures suggests a high probability of holding rates rather than further cuts.
description: Remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Reinventing Bretton Woods Committee Panel Discussion on "The world economy transformed: Reflections on policy responses and the future post pandemic monetary architecture", in the context of the virtual IMF Spring Meetings, Washington DC, 17 April 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Economic effects of the corona crisis and measures by the central banks
Key quote: The key issue is to secure the financing of companies and households.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for expansive monetary measures to mitigate the economic effects of the pandemic, highlighting efforts to provide liquidity and funding. These are characteristic of a highly dovish stance during a crisis situation.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the stakeholder event in connection with the publication of the Bank of Finland's Annual Report, Bank of Finland, Helsinki, 20 March 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Transformation of central banking and monetary policy in Europe
Key quote: A powerful monetary response is needed in situations where inflation expectations have become depressed for a protracted period.
Rationale: The speech highlights ongoing challenges with low inflation and the role of unconventional monetary policy measures at the ECB, yet does not indicate an immediate move to further cut rates. It reflects a cautious stance with acknowledgment of persistent economic challenges that limit hawkish policy adjustments, indicating the likelihood of holding rates steady and assessing the macroeconomic landscape.
description: Lecture notes by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, lecture series "Current Trends on European Politics", Helsinki University, 30 January 2020.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Global and European economy from the Finnish perspective
Key quote: That's why monetary policy will remain accommodative for an extended period of time.
Rationale: The speech indicates a commitment to maintaining an accommodative monetary policy stance due to subdued inflation and slower growth, suggesting a dovish outlook. The emphasis on extended accommodation implies a likelihood of holding the current policy rate.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the National University of Singapore, Singapore, 7 November 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: On conventional and unconventional monetary policies
Key quote: Let me be clear. We all, I assume, would like to get rid of negative interest rates. However, as long as the synchronized slowdown continues, there is no economically meaningful alternative to unconventional monetary policies.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges a challenging economic environment with inflation falling short of targets and a slowdown in growth, while also emphasizing the necessity of maintaining accommodative monetary policies. The mention of the lack of alternatives to unconventional monetary policies suggests a somewhat dovish stance, although there is recognition of the current constraint posed by global economic conditions, leading to a prediction that rates would likely be held steady.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the 70th Economic Policy Panel Meeting at the Bank of Finland, Helsinki, 10 October 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Next steps towards a stronger monetary union
Key quote: Monetary policy cannot be the only active player in the field.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges the limitations of monetary policy and emphasizes the need for fiscal measures, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance. Combined with the current economic downturn, this indicates a preference for holding rates while assessing fiscal policies' support.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, in the Inter-parliamentary Conference on "Stability, Economic Coordination and Governance in the EU", Session "Economic Governance in the EMU: What Next?", Helsinki, 30 September 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Global economic outlook - a European perspective
Key quote: Therefore, a significant degree of monetary stimulus continues to be necessary to ensure that financial conditions remain very favourable and to support euro area growth and domestic price pressures.
Rationale: Governor Rehn highlights the need for accommodative monetary policy due to persistently low inflation and a deteriorating global economic outlook, strongly suggesting a dovish stance and likely support for cutting rates.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas, Dallas, 19 August 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Challenges of monetary policy - past, present, future
Key quote: The Governing Council of the ECB recently responded to the prolonged uncertainty by amplifying the accommodative monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The speech discusses current economic uncertainties, inflation expectations, and policy tools. The emphasis on accommodative monetary policy indicates a somewhat dovish stance, suggesting a preference to hold rates to support growth amid uncertainties.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland Conference on Monetary Policy and Future of European Monetary Union, Helsinki, 1 July 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Impact of structural economic changes on monetary and macroprudential policies
Key quote: Moreover, the Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate, so that inflation converges with our aim of below but close to 2% in a sustained manner.
Rationale: Olli Rehn acknowledges current economic uncertainties and the need to maintain accommodative policies given low inflation expectations, but does not specifically advocate for a more dovish or hawkish stance, suggesting a largely neutral position supportive of holding the rate.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the 2019 RiskLab/BoF/ESRB Conference on Systemic Risk Analytics, Helsinki, 24 May 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: European economic and monetary policy outlook
Key quote: As a consequence of the slowdown, (almost) all major central banks needed to put monetary policy normalisation on hold and instead maintain an accommodative policy stance.
Rationale: Olli Rehn acknowledges the slowdown in economic activity and emphasizes the need to maintain an accommodative monetary policy stance, suggesting some dovishness. However, the emphasis on readiness to adjust policy instruments keeps the overall stance somewhat dovish rather than fully dovish.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the symposium organized by the Sveriges Riksbank and the US National Association of Business Economics (NABE) on "Global Economics at the Crossroads: Growing Together While Growing Apart", Stockholm, 2 May 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Economic outlook and monetary policy - a European perspective
Key quote: As a consequence of the slowdown, (almost) all major central banks have had to put monetary policy normalisation on hold and instead to maintain an accommodative policy stance.
Rationale: Olli Rehn emphasizes the need to maintain an accommodative monetary policy stance in response to the weakened economic outlook and slowing growth, with continued reinvestment and low policy rates through the end of 2019, indicating a dovish approach aiming to stimulate the economy.
description: Talk by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Council on Foreign Relations, New York City, 17 April 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Bretton Woods @ 75 - What Is New with the International Monetary System?
Key quote: After two years of robust expansion, global growth is waning. As a result, (almost) all major central banks have had to put monetary policy normalisation on hold and instead to maintain an accommodative policy stance.
Rationale: The speech highlights the need for sustained monetary accommodation given the global economic slowdown and explicitly mentions the ECB's decision to maintain an accommodative policy stance. This indicates a dovish outlook with a likely preference to hold interest rates steady.
description: Remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Panel Discussion on "Bretton Woods @ 75 - What Is New with the International Monetary System?" in the context of the IMF Spring Meetings, Washington DC, 12 April 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Counter-cyclical burden-sharing of fiscal and monetary policy
Key quote: A combination of global uncertainties and adverse domestic factors in some euro area countries are likely to continue to weigh on euro area activity in the short term.
Rationale: The speech highlights sluggish growth and references recent ECB decisions aimed at maintaining accommodative monetary policy, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance. However, it does not signal an immediate need for rate cuts, making a 'Hold' the more likely expectation at the next meeting.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland Seminar on the 2018 Annual Report of the European Fiscal Board, Helsinki, 18 March 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: The euro beyond 20 - monetary policy in the real economy
Key quote: All in all, my analysis is that the current situation requires patience and persistence in removing the monetary policy accommodation.
Rationale: Olli Rehn emphasizes the need for patience in removing monetary policy accommodation due to incomplete inflation convergence and downside risks to growth. He suggests a cautious approach, which implies maintaining current interest rates rather than raising them prematurely.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Conference on financial market policy, at the Economic Council (CDU Wirtschaftsrat Deutschland), Berlin, 29 January 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy and bank supervision in Europe after the last financial and sovereign debt crisis and challenges for the future
Key quote: The European economy continues to need a degree of monetary policy support in order to converge sustainably to a state of price stability.
Rationale: Olli Rehn emphasizes the need for continued monetary policy support and suggests a cautious, patient approach to policy normalization. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, focused on supporting economic recovery.
description: Remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, in the governors' panel discussion at the Bank of Greece Economic History Conference "The birth of inter-war central banks: building a new monetary order", Athens, 2 November 2018.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Monetary policy normalisation in the world of uncertainties
Key quote: Both the decline in the natural rate of interest and the low inflation expectations reinforce the case for a gradual approach to normalisation.
Rationale: Olli Rehn highlights uncertainties in economic indicators such as the natural rate of interest and the Phillips curve, suggesting a cautious approach to policy normalization. The emphasis on gradualism and the acknowledgment of lower inflation expectations point to a somewhat dovish stance. However, the focus on normalization suggests a leaning towards maintaining current policy rates unless significant changes occur.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland monetary policy seminar, Helsinki, 31 October 2018.

author: Olli Rehn
title: On the road to a new global equilibrium
Key quote: Where the convergence to sustainable price stability still requires significant monetary stimulus, as is the case in the euro area, this calls for prudence and for a gradual approach to monetary policy normalisation.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes prudence and a gradual approach to monetary policy normalization due to prevailing uncertainties and vulnerabilities. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, indicating a likelihood to maintain current policy rates until such issues are resolved.
description: Remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Panel Discussion on "Monetary Policy Frameworks", Reinventing the Bretton Woods Committee, in the context of the IMF Annual Meetings, Bali, Indonesia, 11 October 2018.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Europe, EMU and the banks
Key quote: The ECB Governing Council reiterated on 26 April that an ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for reforms and strengthening the eurozone alongside maintaining an accommodative monetary policy, which suggests a dovish stance. However, the acknowledgment of economic improvements and risks implies a somewhat balanced approach, leading to a 'Somewhat dovish' classification with a prediction to hold rates.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Italian Banking Association, Rome, 14 May 2018.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Some like it hotter: the conditions for a cyclical recovery in euro area productivity
Key quote: The current balance of risks suggests that we can and should reduce further the current level of monetary policy restriction.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes risks to economic growth and productivity, argues for reducing monetary policy restriction, and suggests further rate cuts to support the economy, indicating a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Contribution by Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, to the Centre for European Reform’s annual economics conference on “A European path to higher economic growth”

author: Piero Cipollone
title: The confidence to act - monetary policy and the role of wages during the disinflation process
Key quote: If incoming data confirm the scenario foreseen in the March projections, we should stand ready to swiftly dial back our restrictive monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The speaker discusses an increased confidence in inflation converging to the target and highlights conditions for easing monetary policy, hinting at a dovish stance. However, the cautious approach indicated by waiting for further data suggests a 'Hold' decision for the next rate meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at an event organised by the House of the Euro and the Centre for European Reform, Brussels, 27 March 2024.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: The euro at 25 - what next for Economic and Monetary Union?
Key quote: With demand still weak and inflation expectations anchored, there is no need for monetary policy to generate further slack to keep inflation in check.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the current stability in inflation expectations and suggests no immediate need for further monetary tightening, which indicates a neutral stance on monetary policy. The overall tone suggests keeping the current policy rate given the circumstances described.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Parliamentary Week 2024, Brussels, 12 February 2024.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Securing stability in an insecure environment: navigating a bottleneck economy
Key quote: Finally – all else being equal – monetary policy may have to respond more proactively to bottlenecks than has been considered appropriate in the past.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the potential for future proactive responses to bottlenecks that could affect inflation, suggesting readiness to act if necessary. However, it also highlights current stability and the possibility that rates might be held if inflation and economic risks continue to be managed effectively.
description: Speech by Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the ECB, at the University of Cyprus, Nicosia

author: Frank Elderson
title: Family ties - ten years of monetary policy and banking supervision under one European roof
Key quote: That is why, at last week's meeting of the ECB's Governing Council, we considered it appropriate to moderate the degree of monetary policy restriction by lowering our key interest rates by 25 basis points.
Rationale: The speech highlights the ECB's cautious yet determined approach towards maintaining stability, reflecting both celebration of past achievements and acknowledgment of future challenges. Indicators are mixed, as banks are resilient yet risks remain, suggesting 'Hold stance.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the 2024 Annual ECB Banking Supervision Research Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 11 June 2024.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Monetary policy in the climate and nature crises - preserving a "Stabilitätskultur"
Key quote: Preserving price stability means preserving climate and nature stability.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the integration of climate considerations into monetary policy and emphasizes the importance of stability. While it doesn't directly indicate a change in monetary policy stance (hiking or cutting rates), it reflects a balanced approach, hence 'Neutral'.
description: Speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Bertelsmann Stiftung Berlin, Berlin, 22 November 2023.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Maintaining prudence when navigating unexpected tides and firming currents
Key quote: Monetary policy must be on its guard.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes continued action to raise policy rates to combat high inflation, reflecting a hawkish stance. It acknowledges the need for caution but underlines determination to adjust rates despite potential recessive risks.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the 25th Frankfurt Euro Finance Week, Frankfurt am Main, 15 November 2022.

author: Frank Elderson
title: The European Central Bank's monetary policy strategy - delivering our mandate in all circumstances
Key quote: Inflation is currently far too high... we will raise rates further in the pursuit of our objective.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the ECB's commitment to raising rates further to address high inflation, which signals a hawkish stance. This is reinforced by the mention of accelerated monetary policy normalization and the need to prevent persistent upward shifts in inflation expectations.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the ECB, at the European Parliament conference on "Greening monetary policy in times of soaring inflation", Brussels, 28 September 2022.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Proportioning policy action to the evidence - making the monetary policy strategy of the European Central Bank concrete
Key quote: If the evolution of the inflation outlook supported by incoming data allows a further normalisation of monetary policy, we stand ready to adjust our instruments accordingly.
Rationale: The speech indicates a readiness to end asset purchases and normalize policy if inflation allows, suggesting a leaning towards tightening, but highlights the current uncertainties and ongoing data dependency, thus not fully committing to a rate hike immediately.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the ECB, at The Institute of International & European Affairs webinar, Frankfurt am Main, 24 March 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Policy mix of the future - the role of monetary, fiscal and macroprudential policies
Key quote: Monetary policy also faces a challenging choice between a more gradual increase of the policy rate, which takes into account the high uncertainty and its effects on the real economy, and a stronger response that tames the risks of inflation remaining noticeably above the objective for a protracted period.
Rationale: While Centeno acknowledges the challenges of high inflation and the need for monetary policy to ensure inflation expectations remain anchored, he also emphasizes the risks of acting too quickly. His view on coordinating fiscal and monetary policy indicates a balanced approach, suggesting he would be likely to vote to hold rates at the next meeting.
description: Keynote intervention by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the international conference "Future of Central Banking" organised by the Bank of Lithuania and the Bank for International Settlements on the occasion of the centenary of the Bank of Lithuania, Vilnius, 29 September 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: A new EU, new world?
Key quote: The critical question for monetary policy right now is whether it is possible to tame inflation with real interest rates at such low levels.
Rationale: The speaker acknowledges high inflation but argues for a gradual, predictable monetary policy approach, suggesting a preference for holding rates while assessing the situation further.
description: Closing remarks by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the Reinventing Bretton Woods Committee High-level Seminar "A New EU, New World?", Rome, 26 September 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: The future of the EU financial system in a new geo-economic context
Key quote: Monetary policy must remain predictable and acting at the margin in as small steps as possible.
Rationale: The speech reflects a balanced view on monetary policy with an emphasis on stability and gradual adjustments rather than aggressive changes. Governor Centeno acknowledges the need for addressing high inflation but cautions against abrupt normalization that might destabilize the economy, suggesting he will likely vote to hold rates at the next meeting.
description: Keynote intervention by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the CIRSF Annual Conference "The future of the EU financial system in a new geo-economic context", Lisbon, 15 September 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Keynote intervention - 26th Economist Government Roundtable
Key quote: A cycle of interest rates increases is desirable, but brings about risks that should be mitigated.
Rationale: Governor Centeno acknowledges the need for interest rate increases despite potential risks, indicating a somewhat hawkish stance due to concerns about inflation pressures broadening.
description: Keynote intervention (virtual) by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the 26th Economist Government Roundtable, 7 July 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Global capital markets - understanding the future
Key quote: Nevertheless, once base effects are off and supply bottlenecks ease, inflation is projected to decline.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges economic recovery but highlights challenges like inflation pressure and the need for sustainable policy decisions, which suggests a balanced view rather than a leaning towards either easing or tightening monetary policy.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the Conference "Global capital markets - understanding the future", Lisbon, 5 November 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: The recovery of the European economy in the post-pandemic context – challenges and opportunities for the financial system
Key quote: Concerning monetary policy, the best answer to uncertainty is to keep a close monitoring, a steady hand, and stand ready to act flexibly.
Rationale: The speech indicates a recognition of an ongoing economic recovery but emphasizes the need to keep financing conditions supportive, suggesting a cautious approach to withdrawing policy support. This points towards a somewhat dovish stance, likely resulting in a prediction to hold interest rates.
description: Keynote intervention by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the CIRSF Conference 2021 - The Financial System and the European economic recovery, 30 September 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Introductory statement at the Conference of the Governors of Mediterranean Central Banks
Key quote: Monetary policy should remain accommodative to help preserve favourable financing conditions until the recovery is on firmer ground.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policy to support the recovery, avoiding premature tightening, which signals a dovish stance. The speaker supports maintaining current support levels until economic recovery is more secure.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the Conference of the Governors of Mediterranean Central Banks - Central Banks at the Frontline of the Covid-19 crisis, 28 June 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Monetary policy in transition
Key quote: Monetary policy is expected to remain very accommodative, amid a persistently low inflation environment.
Rationale: The speech highlights the accommodative stance of monetary policy and acknowledges the low inflation environment, suggesting a 'Holding' stance on interest rates to support economic recovery amid the ongoing pandemic.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at The Institute of International and European Affairs webinar "Monetary Policy in Transition", 28 April 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Opening remarks - Eurofi High Level Seminar
Key quote: A generalized backtracking in monetary policy may be ill advised.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of maintaining supportive monetary and fiscal policies for a broad-based recovery and cautions against withdrawing these measures prematurely, which indicates a somewhat dovish stance. However, it does not explicitly call for further monetary easing, suggesting a 'Hold' position on interest rates.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the "Eurofi High Level Seminar", virtual, 14 April 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: The Portuguese presidency - on the road to a European recovery post-Covid
Key quote: Looking ahead, in 2021, to pave the way for recovery, the measures must be adapted to the evolution of the crisis.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for adaptation of policies to the evolving crisis, suggests coordinated actions, and highlights the role of central banks in preserving financing conditions. The tone is cautious and supportive of ongoing accommodative measures.
description: Address by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Bank of Portugal, at the CFA Institute &amp; CFA Society Portugal virtual conference, Panel 1: "Ensuring financial stability in Covid-19 times: what is the role of regulators to address the threats to the stability of the EU banking system?", 26 January 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Monetary policy in transition
Key quote: The premature withdrawal of monetary and fiscal stimulus can be detrimental to the rebound of our economies.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the need to maintain monetary and fiscal stimulus for the foreseeable future, indicating a reluctance to tighten policy too soon, which is a dovish stance. However, he notes that adjustments may be needed, suggesting a nuanced approach that leans towards holding rather than cutting rates.
description: Address by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Bank of Portugal, at the Virtual IMF Annual Meetings: Macro Conversations in the session "Monetary Policy in Transition", Washington DC, 16 October 2020.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Address - Eurofi Financial Forum 2020
Key quote: Monetary policy PEPP should remain flexible, and Next Generation EU funds should be used efficiently.
Rationale: The speech highlights the importance of maintaining flexible monetary policy and the risks associated with the current economic situation. While it acknowledges the strong monetary response, it cautions against the premature withdrawal of measures, indicating a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Address by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Bank of Portugal, at the Eurofi Financial Forum 2020, Berlin, 11 September 2020.

author: Yannis Stournaras
title: Greeting - 5th Simulation Conference of the European Central Bank
Key quote: The new strategy sets out the basic principles that guide us in shaping the direction of monetary policy so that we can respond more effectively to various circumstances in order to fulfill our primary goal of price stability.
Rationale: The speech highlights the need for strong monetary policy measures and discusses the use of the PEPP and TLTRO III to support economic growth and stabilize inflation, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. Given the current low interest rate, it suggests holding rates steady while continuing accommodative measures.
description: Greeting by Mr Yannis Stournaras, Governor of the Bank of Greece, at the 5th Simulation Conference of the European Central Bank, 10 December 2021.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: Stay the course in turbulent times - old and new challenges for central banks
Key quote: All in all, inflationary pressures have been abating, and in case we do not face some new shocks, inflation should gradually come down, and hopefully in a sustainable manner, to our medium-term target.
Rationale: The speech balances a historical perspective with current policy, highlighting past price control failures and acknowledging recent inflation abatement. It suggests caution and vigilance rather than immediate action, indicating a likely decision to 'Hold' rates at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the 8th Annual Conference of Mediterranean Central Banks, Split, 14 February 2024.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: One year with the euro
Key quote: To conclude, the introduction of the euro has not been accompanied by any negative surprises. As I have elaborated in detail, the expected benefits have materialised and will continue to materialise given their permanent character.
Rationale: The speech highlights the successful transition to the euro and its benefits, without indicating any specific changes to monetary policy. The overall tone is balanced and focused on the positive effects of the euro adoption, suggesting a likely neutral stance towards changes in the current policy rate.
description: Speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the conference "One year with the euro", Zagreb, 30 January 2024.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: European finance in 2020s - new risks in a volatile world
Key quote: While the muted response of interest rates of Croatian banks reduces the risks to financial stability of sudden, unexpected and until very recently unprecedented monetary policy tightening, it may also weaken the pace of disinflation.
Rationale: Governor Vujčić acknowledges the risks associated with rising interest rates and financial stability, highlighting the muted response of Croatian banks' interest rates which may weaken the pace of disinflation. However, he also notes the strength of Croatian banks and the benefits of euro adoption, suggesting a balanced stance with readiness to act if inflation persistently exceeds targets. Given the current interest rate environment and the emphasis on financial stability, the most likely prediction is to hold rates while continuing to monitor conditions closely.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the FBF Executive Seminar "European finance in 2020s: new risks in a volatile world", organised by the Florence School of Banking and Finance - The European University Institute, Florence, 29 June 2023.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: The role of central banks and how to insure their independence
Key quote: Central banks today operate in an environment of extremely low interest rates and high indebtedness of both the private sector and sovereigns, which narrows their maneuvering space.
Rationale: The speech discusses the challenges central banks face in maintaining independence and managing new mandates but does not suggest a change in the policy rate. Given the discussion on low yields and mandate pressures, a neutral stance with a prediction to hold rates is appropriate.
description: Speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the Symposium on "Central Banking in Central and Eastern Europe: Policy Making, Investment and Low Yields", organized by the Czech National Bank and OMFIF (Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum), Prague, 10 June 2016.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: Challenges for policy responses within the European Union in the context of post-crisis reconstruction
Key quote: We need to improve our understanding of the processes underlying crisis episodes and adjust our policies accordingly.
Rationale: The speech outlines challenges with current policy frameworks and discusses the risks and limitations of expansionary policies but does not advocate for immediate tightening or loosening. The emphasis on improving understanding and cautious adjustment suggests a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the international conference "Economic and Financial Cycle Spillovers: Reconsidering Domestic and Cross Border Channels and Policy Responses", organized by the National Bank of the Republic of Macedonia, Skopje, 7-8 April 2016.

author: Boštjan Vasle
title: Introductory remarks - 9th European Central Bank conference on central, eastern and south-eastern European countries
Key quote: We have already done a lot on the monetary policy side, but high and broad-based inflation resonates further action.
Rationale: The speech highlights the persistent and widespread nature of inflation and calls for continued action, including potentially more rate hikes, to address it. The emphasis on the need for coordinated policy efforts to tackle inflation and the mention of 'further action' indicate a hawkish stance.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Boštjan Vasle, Governor of Bank of Slovenia, at the panel of the 9th European Central Bank conference on central and south-eastern European (CESEE) countries, Frankfurt am Main, 17 July 2023.

author: Boštjan Vasle
title: Opening address for Governor Madis Müller's lecture
Key quote: With headline inflation remaining high and core inflation even increasing, our intention is to raise interest rates still further.
Rationale: Governor Vasle clearly indicates an intention to continue with interest rate hikes to combat persistently high inflation, showing strong resolve and prioritizing price stability.
description: Opening address by Mr Boštjan Vasle, Governor of Bank of Slovenia, for governor Madis Müller's lecture entitled "Why is inflation so high and so different in different euro area countries?", Ljubljana, 3 March 2023.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: Evolution of structural underpinnings of monetary policy
Key quote: Nevertheless, this does not change the fact that in the current environment we must tighten monetary policy to keep inflation expectations from increasing to unsustainable levels.
Rationale: The speaker emphasizes the importance of tightening monetary policy to prevent inflation expectations from becoming unsustainable. This suggests a commitment to raising rates to maintain price stability.
description: Initial remarks by Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the first conference for central banks of the Three Seas Initiative (3SI) countries "Monetary policy in a New European Reality", Warsaw, 10 June 2022.

author: Gaston Reinesch
title: Beyond the horizon of the Luxembourg presidency - a central banker's perspective
Key quote: The risk of inflation remaining low for too long a period of time thus became a key concern.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the risks of prolonged low inflation and discusses various accommodative monetary measures, suggesting a dovish tone. However, the readiness to adjust policy if economic conditions worsen indicates a somewhat dovish stance, with a higher likelihood to hold rates rather than making immediate cuts.
description: Speech by Mr Gaston Reinesch, Governor of the Central Bank of Luxembourg, at the National Bank of Poland's Biannual EU Presidency Lecture, Warsaw, 27 October 2015.

author: Gaston Reinesch
title: How to achieve stronger growth in the EU?
Key quote: The monetary policy stance currently provides a window of opportunity to implement reforms.
Rationale: Gaston Reinesch highlights a weaker economic recovery and downward revisions to GDP growth and inflation projections. He emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policy to support economic activity, indicating a dovish tone. However, the speech focuses more on structural reforms than immediate monetary policy changes, suggesting a likelihood to hold interest rates steady.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Gaston Reinesch, Governor of the Central Bank of Luxembourg, at the Eurofi Financial Forum 2015, Luxembourg, 9 September 2015.

author: Gabriel Makhlouf
title: Staying the course - monetary policy to avoid persistent inflation
Key quote: Policy rates will need to be kept at a restrictive level to dampen demand.
Rationale: Governor Makhlouf emphasizes the need to maintain restrictive policy rates to ensure the 2% inflation target is met, indicating a hawkish stance focused on preventing persistent inflation.
description: Remarks by Mr Gabriel Makhlouf, Governor of the Central Bank of Ireland and Member of the Governing Council of the European Central Bank, at the Markets News International event, London, 4 April 2023.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council reiterated the need for a highly accommodative stance of monetary policy for a prolonged period of time to support underlying inflation pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the continuation of a highly accommodative monetary policy, maintaining or lowering rates until inflation converges to the target. The start of asset purchases and the emphasis on downside risks and muted inflation pressures indicate a dovish stance.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 24 October 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: Confronted with a more protracted weakness of the euro area economy, the persistence of prominent downside risks, and muted inflationary pressures, resulting in a continued shortfall of medium-term inflation with respect to its aim, the ECB's Governing Council decided in September on a package of monetary policy measures.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes significant downside risks to growth and muted inflationary pressures, highlighting recent monetary policy actions to provide substantial monetary stimulus. This dovish stance suggests caution in policy adjustments, thus a likely 'Hold' on rates in the near term.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the fortieth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 18 October 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Stabilisation policies in a monetary union
Key quote: Monetary policy increasingly has to use unconventional policies to achieve its mandate, and to do so for longer and with more intensity.
Rationale: The speech by Mario Draghi emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policy to support growth and inflation, highlighting the constraints posed by low natural rates and suggesting that fiscal policy should play a more supportive role. This indicates a dovish stance, likely advocating to hold rates to maintain monetary support.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Academy of Athens, Athens, 1 October 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Interview in the Financial Times
Key quote: The answer is to persist with monetary policy. Although, as I said before, fiscal policy could greatly help.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes the readiness to use unconventional measures and advocates for fiscal policy to complement monetary policy, indicating a dovish stance. However, given the existing policy rate of -0.5%, suggesting further cuts are unlikely, leading to a 'Hold' prediction.
description: Interview with Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, in the Financial Times, conducted by Mr Lionel Barber and Ms Claire Jones on 25 June and 20 September, and published on 30 September 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council decided to restart net purchases under its asset purchase programme (APP) at a monthly pace of €20 billion as from 1 November.
Rationale: The speech outlines multiple measures reinforcing a strong accommodative stance, including a rate cut and restarting asset purchases, signaling dovish intent to stimulate inflation and growth, suggesting a likelihood to cut rates if necessary.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 12 September 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council also underlined the need for a highly accommodative stance of monetary policy for a prolonged period of time.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the continuation of accommodative policy, readiness to use further monetary tools if inflation remains below target, and maintaining low interest rates. This indicates a dovish stance, and the likelihood of a rate cut is not very high, suggesting a 'Hold' prediction.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 25 July 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Twenty years of the European Central Bank's monetary policy
Key quote: In the absence of improvement, such that the sustained return of inflation to our aim is threatened, additional stimulus will be required.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech emphasizes the ECB's readiness to provide additional stimulus if inflation fails to return to target, highlighting persistent risks and the need for accommodation, indicating a dovish stance and potential for rate cuts.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Forum on Central Banking, Sintra, 18 June 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged. We now expect them to remain at their present levels at least through the first half of 2020.
Rationale: The speech indicates a dovish stance with the decision to hold rates unchanged and signals of continued accommodative policy. Mention of global headwinds and uncertainties further supports the expectation of a cautious approach.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Vilnius, 6 June 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: Overall, an ample degree of monetary accommodation remains necessary to safeguard favourable financing conditions and support the economic expansion.
Rationale: The speech discusses the need for continued monetary accommodation and highlights economic uncertainties and downside risks. Despite slight improvements, the ECB is maintaining its current policy stance with no immediate plans to raise interest rates, indicating a somewhat dovish approach.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-ninth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 12 April 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged. We continue to expect them to remain at their present levels at least through the end of 2019.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation and highlights slower growth momentum and downside risks to growth. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, where the likelihood of holding rates is indicated, as more accommodation is viewed as necessary.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 10 April 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: Substantial accommodation is still needed to secure the path of inflation convergence and this is reflected in our past monetary policy decisions.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes risks to growth and downside risks to the inflation outlook and expresses a commitment to maintaining accommodative monetary policy. This indicates a somewhat dovish stance, suggesting a hold on rates, with a high probability given the economic uncertainties expressed.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the conference "The ECB and its watchers XX", Frankfurt am Main, 27 March 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We now expect them to remain at their present levels at least through the end of 2019, and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation to levels that are below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech outlines a continuation of low interest rates and the introduction of further stimulative measures (TLTRO-III), reflecting a somewhat dovish stance aimed at supporting growth and inflation. However, there is no imminent move to cut rates as policy is set to hold for the foreseeable future.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 7 March 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: A strong monetary policy response was therefore essential.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech emphasizes a strong need for accommodative monetary policy given the persistent downside risks to the euro area's economic outlook and inflation below the ECB's target. This suggests a dovish stance, with a likelihood of further rate cuts.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 23 February 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Significant monetary policy stimulus remains essential to support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: Draghi acknowledges weaker economic information and uncertainties impacting sentiment, yet he emphasizes the need for continued monetary stimulus. While this leans dovish, his encouragement of monetary policy support without indicating strong concern for immediate rate cuts suggests a likelihood to hold rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 28 January 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Based on our regular economic and monetary analyses, we decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to maintain an ample degree of monetary accommodation due to weaker-than-expected economic data and downside risks, indicating a dovish stance. However, they are not lowering rates further, hence 'somewhat dovish' and likely to hold rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 24 January 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Debate about the Annual Report
Key quote: A significant amount of monetary policy stimulus is still needed to support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges the need for continued monetary stimulus amid weaker-than-expected economic developments, and while it recognizes past achievements, it emphasizes caution and the continuation of accommodative measures, suggesting a likelihood to hold rates steady.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at plenary debate of the European Parliament about the ECB's annual report 2017, Strasbourg, 15 January 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Europe and the euro 20 years on
Key quote: We need to make these changes as soon as possible, but we also need to explain why they are important to the people of Europe.
Rationale: The speech addresses the importance of making structural changes to the Monetary Union, highlighting concerns about growth and stability without explicitly advocating for immediate monetary policy action. It suggests more of a focus on structural reforms and institutional strength rather than a change in monetary policy stance.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at Laurea Honoris Causa in Economics by University of Sant'Anna, Pisa, 15 December 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Based on our regular economic and monetary analyses, we decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The ECB maintains a dovish stance by continuing with significant monetary policy stimulus, yet acknowledges domestic demand strength and risks, opting to hold interest rates for the foreseeable future.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 13 December 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Significant monetary policy stimulus is still needed to support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech indicates cautious optimism regarding inflation but emphasizes the need for ongoing monetary policy stimulus due to existing uncertainties, suggesting a neutral stance on immediate interest rate changes.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 26 November 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The outlook for the euro area economy
Key quote: We have conveyed that we expect interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the summer of 2019, and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure that inflation continues to move towards our aim in a sustained manner.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges growth concerns with temporary factors influencing the slowdown, but maintains confidence in the resilience of domestic demand and expected inflation path. The ECB is unlikely to cut rates, preferring to maintain current accommodative policies as they evaluate future data.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Frankfurt European Banking Congress, Frankfurt am Main, 16 November 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Exchange of views with members of the Irish Parliament
Key quote: significant monetary stimulus will still be needed to ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation to levels that are below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech reflects a cautious optimism about the euro area's recovery but also emphasizes the need for continued monetary support to achieve inflation goals. This suggests a 'Somewhat dovish' stance with a probability of voting to 'Hold' rates as they anticipate ending net asset purchases but still maintain accommodative stances.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, during his exchange of views with the House of Representatives, Dublin, 8 November 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Central bank independence
Key quote: Faced with future crises, central banks will adhere to their mandates and use their independence to fulfil them.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the importance of central bank independence and its role in maintaining price stability. While it defends the use of unconventional tools, it mostly reaffirms the current policy framework without signaling imminent policy changes.
description: Text of the First Lamfalussy Lecture by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the National Bank of Belgium, Brussels, 26 October 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Significant monetary policy stimulus is still needed to support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates a commitment to maintain current interest rates and extend asset purchases to ensure that inflation converges towards their target. This indicates a continuation of accommodative monetary policy, with no immediate move towards tightening.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 25 October 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: Significant monetary policy stimulus is still needed to support the further build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for significant monetary policy stimulus and anticipates maintaining low interest rates while gradually reducing asset purchases. It conveys some dovishness by highlighting ongoing support needed for inflation and economic growth, suggesting that rates will remain unchanged for a period.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-eighth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Bali, Indonesia, 12 October 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: We anticipate that, subject to incoming data confirming our medium-term inflation outlook, we will then end net purchases.
Rationale: Draghi conveys a neutral stance by emphasizing patience and persistence in maintaining current monetary stimulus without drastic changes, signaling likelihood of holding rates in the near term.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 24 September 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Based on our regular economic and monetary analyses, we decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: The ECB emphasizes maintaining the current rates and expresses confidence in the economy's strength while acknowledging uncertainties. The mention of ongoing monetary accommodation and future policy readiness implies a neutral stance, suggesting a hold in rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 26 July 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: We expect key ECB interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the summer of 2019 and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure that the evolution of inflation remains aligned with our current expectations of a sustained adjustment path.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges progress towards sustained inflation but highlights uncertainties and a cautious approach by maintaining low interest rates and gradual reduction in asset purchases, signaling a somewhat dovish stance with a likelihood of holding rates steady.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 9 July 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: Monetary policy in the euro area will remain patient, persistent and prudent.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges moderate economic growth and downplays immediate inflationary pressures, indicating that the current monetary policy support should remain in place. Draghi suggests a cautious approach to tightening, thus implying a 'Hold' stance at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Forum on Central Banking, Sintra, 19 June 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Based on our regular economic and monetary analyses, we decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
