Rationale: The speech emphasizes steady growth and inflation expectations while maintaining current policy rates, indicating a neutral stance. Draghi confirms the continuation of existing monetary measures, suggesting a 'Hold' in the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 26 April 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: An ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech emphasizes the need to maintain substantial monetary stimulus to support inflation, while noting that uncertainties warrant patience and prudence in policy decisions. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, leaning towards holding rates stable.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-seventh meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 20 April 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: But we still need to see further evidence that inflation dynamics are moving in the right direction. So monetary policy will remain patient, persistent and prudent.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes a cautious approach, focusing on the necessity to see further evidence of inflation trends before making changes. It suggests that the ECB will maintain a steady policy, making it somewhat dovish, indicating a preference for holding rates with some likelihood.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at The ECB and Its Watchers XIX Conference, organised by the Institute for Monetary and Financial Stability, Frankfurt am Main, 14 March 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We continue to expect the key ECB interest rates to remain at their present levels for an extended period of time, and well past the horizon of our net asset purchases.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech indicated a commitment to maintaining the current policy rates and asset purchases, reflecting a neutral stance as he acknowledged strong growth while underlying inflation remained subdued.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 8 March 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Patience and persistence with regard to monetary policy is still needed for inflation to sustainably return to levels of below, but close to, 2%.
Rationale: The speech expresses optimism about economic growth but continues to emphasize the need for monetary accommodation to support inflation. This indicates a somewhat dovish stance focused on maintaining current policies, suggesting a hold recommendation in the near term.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 26 February 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: An ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges robust economic growth but highlights the need for continued monetary stimulus to support weak inflation pressures. The ECB is committed to keeping rates unchanged and continuing asset purchases, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance, likely resulting in a decision to hold rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 25 January 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes continued economic expansion and a steady approach by maintaining rates while underscoring the importance of the asset purchase program, suggesting a neutral stance focused on stability and growth.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 14 December 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Despite the firm economic recovery, inflation dynamics have yet to show convincing signs of a self-sustained upward trend.
Rationale: Draghi acknowledges the solid economic and employment growth yet highlights that inflation dynamics have not shown convincing signs of a self-sustained uptrend. The ECB has recalibrated its monetary policy to maintain a degree of stimulus, suggesting a neutral stance aimed at holding current policy rates while maintaining asset purchases.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 20 November 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Monetary policy and the outlook for the economy
Key quote: An ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation over the medium term.
Rationale: Mario Draghi emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policy and the incomplete progress towards sustained inflation, which indicates a dovish stance despite confidence in economic recovery.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Frankfurt European Banking Congress "Europe into a New Era - How to Seize the Opportunities", Frankfurt am Main, 17 November 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: European banking supervision three years on
Key quote: Healthier banks have, in turn, helped transmit the ECB's accommodative monetary policy more evenly across the euro area, leading to a stronger and broader recovery.
Rationale: The speech focuses on improvements in banking supervision and bank resilience, which support the accommodative monetary policy stance. Draghi highlights how the financial environment has stabilized, suggesting a balanced view without immediate pressure to adjust rates.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the second ECB Forum on Banking Supervision, Frankfurt am Main, 7 November 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Today's monetary policy decisions were taken to preserve the very favourable financing conditions that are still needed for a sustained return of inflation rates towards levels that are below, but close to, 2%.
Rationale: The ECB has decided to keep interest rates unchanged and maintain their asset purchase program but at a reduced pace. This suggests a balanced approach—acknowledging economic improvement yet recognizing the need for continued support, indicating a neutral stance.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 26 October 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: Thus, a very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed to secure a sustained return of inflation towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation due to insufficient progress towards inflation targets, indicating a dovish stance. The expectation for key interest rates to remain at current levels supports a 'Hold' prediction for rates.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-sixth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 13 October 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Overall, we are becoming more confident that inflation will eventually head to levels in line with our inflation aim, but we also know that a very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for the upward inflation path to materialise.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation to ensure a durable inflation increase, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. Although economic growth is strong, there is acknowledgment of uncertainties and the necessity to maintain support, suggesting a likely decision to hold rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 25 September 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to gradually build up and support headline inflation developments in the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates that the ECB is maintaining its current policy stance and keeping interest rates unchanged, reflecting a balanced view between economic growth and subdued inflation.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 7 September 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Sustaining openness in a dynamic global economy
Key quote: With monetary policy globally very expansionary, regulators should be wary of rekindling the incentives that led to the crisis.
Rationale: Draghi's speech acknowledges a firming global recovery but stresses the importance of sustained growth through openness and multilateral cooperation rather than signaling an immediate change in monetary policy. This suggests a neutral stance, likely leading to a decision to hold rates steady in the context of already expansionary monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City Economic Symposium "Fostering a Dynamic Global Recovery", Jackson Hole, Wyoming, 25 August 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Accompanying the economic recovery
Key quote: A considerable degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up, and to support headline inflation in the medium term.
Rationale: Mario Draghi emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation and exercise of caution in adjusting policy measures. He acknowledges temporary factors weighing on inflation and the necessity for a persistent, yet gradual policy approach, indicating a slight dovish stance with a likelihood to hold rates.
description: Introductory speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Forum on Central Banking, Sintra, 27 June 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation in the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates a continuation of the current accommodative monetary policy, highlighting the need for very substantial monetary accommodation and readiness to increase the asset purchase programme if the outlook becomes less favorable. This dovish stance is reflected in their decision to keep interest rates unchanged and signals to hold them steady in the foreseeable future.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Tallinn, 8 June 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Despite a firmer recovery, and looking through the volatile readings in HICP inflation over recent months, underlying inflation pressures have remained subdued.
Rationale: The speech highlights that while economic recovery is strengthening, inflation pressures remain subdued, necessitating continued monetary accommodation. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance with a likely hold on rates to maintain support for inflation to meet the 2% target. The emphasis on maintaining monetary accommodation reflects a caution towards tightening policy too soon.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 29 May 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The interaction between monetary policy and financial stability in the euro area
Key quote: The breadth of our monetary policy measures and the length of the time they are in place are necessary for achieving our objective of price stability.
Rationale: Mario Draghi emphasizes maintaining the current monetary policy stance, reflecting a 'hold' position given the effectiveness of previous measures and no immediate need for change.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the First Conference on Financial Stability, organised by the Bank of Spain and the Centro de Estudios Monetarios y Financieros, Madrid, 24 May 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Introductory remarks at the House of Representatives of the Netherlands
Key quote: Maintaining the current very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation in the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates that while recovery is solidifying, inflation pressures remain subdued and monetary accommodation needs to be sustained, suggesting a cautious approach rather than immediate tightening of policy.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Tweede Kamer der Staten-Generaal (House of Representatives of the Netherlands), The Hague, 10 May 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation in the medium term.
Rationale: The ECB decided to keep rates unchanged and emphasized the need for substantial monetary accommodation to support inflation, highlighting subdued underlying inflation pressures. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance with no immediate push for tightening monetary policy, indicating a high probability of holding rates in the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 27 April 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC statement
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed to secure a sustained return of inflation rates towards levels below, but close to, 2% - in line with the ECB's mandate.
Rationale: The speech notes that while economic recovery is firming, underlying inflation remains subdued and substantial monetary accommodation is still needed. This suggests a dovish stance but not the most extreme, as they are holding off immediate new easing measures.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-fifth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 21 April 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Monetary policy and the economic recovery in the euro area
Key quote: Hence a reassessment of the current monetary policy stance is not warranted at this stage.
Rationale: The speech indicates that monetary policy is still critical and inflation depends on continued policy support, suggesting no rush to tighten policies, aligning with a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at The ECB and Its Watchers XVIII Conference, organised by the Center for Financial Studies and the Institute for Monetary and Financial Stability at Goethe University Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, 6 April 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation in the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates that a continued very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is needed, implying no urgency in raising rates, reflecting a somewhat dovish stance. The probability of 'Hold' is high as they are currently content with keeping rates at present or lower levels for a significant period.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 9 March 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Our December decisions strike a balance between our growing confidence that the euro area's economic prospects are firming up, and - at the same time - the lack of a clear sign of sustained convergence of inflation rates towards the desired level.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policy to support the recovery and the potential for increasing asset purchases if necessary, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. Although there is growing confidence in economic recovery, concerns about inflation convergence and global risks suggest a likelihood to maintain the policy rather than cut rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 6 February 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Introductory statement to the plenary debate of the European Parliament on the European Central Bank's Annual Report 2016
Key quote: Overall, while we can be more confident about the path of inflation, patience and persistence with regard to monetary policy is still warranted for underlying inflation pressures to build up and inflation to converge durably towards our objective.
Rationale: Draghi acknowledges the positive economic developments but maintains a cautious tone regarding inflation, signaling the continuation of the current monetary policy without a shift towards tightening or easing beyond the existing asset purchase program.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, to the plenary debate of the European Parliament on the European Central Bank's Annual Report 2016, Strasbourg, 5 February 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is needed for euro area inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation in the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes maintaining a very substantial degree of monetary accommodation and mentions the possibility of increasing asset purchases if conditions deteriorate, indicating a dovish stance. The unchanged policy and commitment to extended low rates suggest a hold position for the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 19 January 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: Today's extension of the asset purchase programme has been calibrated to preserve the very substantial degree of monetary accommodation necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation rates towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech indicates a continuation and extension of the asset purchase program, showing a strong commitment to maintaining a very accommodative monetary policy stance to support inflation convergence. This suggests a dovish position focused on sustaining monetary accommodation.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 8 December 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The productivity challenge for Europe
Key quote: The ECB's current monetary policy settings are designed to support activity to bring inflation back to our objective of close to, but below, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the need for structural reforms to address productivity challenges and emphasizes the supportive role of the ECB's current monetary policy. The discussion of productivity issues and the neutral stance towards future monetary policy actions suggest a 'Somewhat dovish' stance. Given the concerns about productivity and structural reforms, it is likely that Draghi would vote to hold rates to maintain supportive conditions.
description: Lectio magistralis by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, marking the 100th anniversary of the Deusto Business School, Madrid, 30 November 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: In particular, our very low policy interest rates, the favourable lending conditions in our targeted longer-term refinancing operations and our ongoing asset purchases have resulted in lower borrowing costs.
Rationale: Mario Draghi emphasizes the role of ECB's monetary policy in supporting the economy but highlights the need for additional fiscal and structural measures to reinforce growth. His focus on maintaining stimulus to support the recovery suggests a somewhat dovish stance, indicating a likelihood to hold rates steady.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECON committee of the European Parliament, Brussels, 28 November 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Introductory statement to the plenary debate of the European Parliament on the European Central Bank's Annual Report 2015
Key quote: It is for this reason that we remain committed to preserving the very substantial degree of monetary accommodation necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the necessity of maintaining substantial monetary accommodation, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. However, as attention is given to structural reforms and the need for policy support alongside ECB's efforts, a hold decision on interest rates seems likely to sustain ongoing measures.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, to the plenary debate of the European Parliament on the European Central Bank's Annual Report 2015, Strasbourg, 21 November 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The state and prospects of the euro area recovery
Key quote: It is for this reason that we remain committed to preserving the very substantial degree of monetary accommodation, which is necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation towards level below, but close to, 2% over the medium-term.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation and acknowledges that the recovery and inflation path still rely heavily on accommodative monetary policy. This suggests maintaining current policy rather than tightening, but with a readiness to act if needed, which leans somewhat dovish.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the European Banking Congress, Frankfurt am Main, 18 November 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Stability, equity and monetary policy
Key quote: We remain committed to preserving the very substantial degree of monetary accommodation which is necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes maintaining a substantial degree of monetary accommodation and articulates that low interest rates and unconventional measures are necessary for stability and growth, suggesting a dovish stance. However, there is also an awareness of the need to eventually normalize rates, which tempers the dovishness slightly.
description: Text of the 2nd DIW Europe Lecture by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the German Institute for Economic Research (DIW), Berlin, 25 October 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We remain committed to preserving the very substantial degree of monetary accommodation which is necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech highlights a commitment to keeping rates low while maintaining monetary accommodation through asset purchases, reflecting a dovish stance aimed at supporting inflation and economic recovery. However, there's no indication of further easing imminently, making 'Hold' the likely vote with medium probability.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 20 October 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: Our very accommodative monetary policy stance provides the impetus that is necessary for the euro area recovery to strengthen and for inflation to gradually return to levels that we consider consistent with our objective.
Rationale: The speech highlights the ECB's very accommodative monetary policy stance and commitment to maintain or enhance this approach if needed. There is an emphasis on supporting the Euro area's economic recovery and ensuring inflation rises towards the target, indicating a dovish posture, but given the context, the likelihood is to 'Hold' rates unless circumstances worsen significantly.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-fourth meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 7 October 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Interview with ARD Tagesthemen
Key quote: The measures we have taken, of lower interest rates, are always measures that will produce and are producing the objective that we are pursuing, namely higher growth and higher inflation.
Rationale: While Draghi acknowledges the challenges of negative interest rates, he justifies their continuation by emphasizing their benefits in terms of growth and inflation, and even suggests that bank profits have improved. He signals that negative rates cannot continue indefinitely, suggesting a 'hold' on further rate cuts.
description: Interview with Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and ARD Tagesthemen, conducted by Mr Thomas Roth and broadcast on 28 September 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: Overall, our projections indicate that the accommodative monetary policy stance will continue to provide effective support to the cyclical recovery and the upward path in inflation.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech indicates a continuation of the ECB's accommodative policy to support economic recovery and inflation. While he acknowledges downside risks and the need for supportive financing conditions, there is no immediate indication of changing rates, suggesting a preference to hold current policies.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 26 September 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged. We continue to expect them to remain at present or lower levels for an extended period of time.
Rationale: The speech indicates readiness to preserve substantial monetary support and keep interest rates unchanged. The ECB is monitoring developments without a clear indication of tightening or loosening policy, suggesting a neutral stance with a likelihood of holding rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 8 September 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We continue to expect them to remain at present or lower levels for an extended period of time.
Rationale: The speech highlights an accommodative monetary policy stance with a commitment to maintaining or lowering rates if needed, reflecting dovish tendencies. However, the acknowledgment of resilience post-UK referendum and plans to reassess conditions implies a somewhat dovish approach rather than fully dovish. The ECB is maintaining policy rates, suggesting a 'Hold' vote at the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 21 July 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The international dimension of monetary policy
Key quote: None of this means that central banks should give up on pursuing their domestic price stability mandates. We have demonstrated with our unconventional tools that it is possible to engineer accommodative financial conditions even when the equilibrium interest rate is low.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's speech acknowledges the global low inflation environment and the need for international policy alignment. It suggests maintaining accommodative financial conditions using unconventional tools, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. However, it also emphasizes the importance of fulfilling domestic price stability mandates, suggesting a likelihood to 'Hold' rates in the upcoming meeting.
description: Introductory speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Forum on Central Banking, Sintra, 28 June 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: We will closely monitor the evolution of the outlook for price stability. We stand ready to act by using all the instruments available within our mandate, if necessary, to achieve our objective.
Rationale: While Draghi acknowledges improving economic conditions, he emphasizes the subdued inflation and readiness to use all available instruments to ensure price stability, indicating a cautious stance on economic risks and further easing potential.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 21 June 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: On the importance of policy alignment to fulfil our economic potential
Key quote: But monetary policy does not exist in a vacuum.
Rationale: The speech discusses the importance of policy alignment rather than signaling any imminent change in monetary policy, suggesting a likely 'Hold' stance in the upcoming meeting.
description: Text of the 5th Annual Tommaso Padoa-Schioppa Lecture by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Brussels Economic Forum 2016, Brussels, 9 June 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Delivering a symmetric mandate with asymmetric tools - monetary policy in a context of low interest rates
Key quote: Today, this means raising inflation back towards 2%. And the series of measures we have adopted in recent years - bringing policy rates into negative territory, engaging in large-scale asset purchases, and providing banks with long-term refinancing on conditional terms - are geared exactly to achieving that.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need to raise inflation towards 2% and references the use of unconventional monetary policy tools to achieve this goal, which suggests a dovish stance focused on continued stimulus. However, given the already negative rates, the probability of holding rather than further cutting rates is higher.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ceremony to mark the 200th anniversary of the Central Bank of the Republic of Austria, Vienna, 2 June 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Addressing the causes of low interest rates
Key quote: Thus the second part of the answer to raising rates of return is clear: continued expansionary policies until excess slack in the economy has been reduced and inflation dynamics are sustainably consistent again with price stability.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes the necessity of continued expansionary monetary policies to combat low inflation and output gaps, indicating a dovish stance aimed at maintaining low rates until economic slack is reduced.
description: Introductory speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at a panel on "The future of financial markets: A changing view of Asia" at the Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 2 May 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Interview in Bild
Key quote: Low interest rates today will lead to higher rates tomorrow.
Rationale: Draghi emphasizes the need for low interest rates due to low growth and inflation, suggesting a dovish stance focused on supporting economic recovery. He indicates rates will remain low until economic indicators improve significantly, suggesting he would vote to hold rates at the next meeting.
description: Interview with Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, in Bild, conducted by Mr Kai Diekmann, Mr Nikolaus Blome and Mr Daniel Biskup on 25 April 2016 and published on 28 April 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We continue to expect them to remain at present or lower levels for an extended period of time, and well past the horizon of our net asset purchases.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the ECB's commitment to maintaining very accommodative monetary policy to support economic recovery and return inflation to target. The focus on preserving monetary accommodation and readiness to act further if necessary suggests a dovish stance, indicating a high likelihood of holding rates steady.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 21 April 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: IMFC Statement
Key quote: The Governing Council expects the ECB's key policy rates to remain at present or lower levels for an extended period of time, well past the horizon of the net asset purchases.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's statement emphasizes the ECB's commitment to maintaining an accommodative monetary policy stance, with measures such as reducing key policy rates and expanding asset purchases. This dovish approach is aimed at supporting economic recovery and addressing low inflation, suggesting that rate hikes are unlikely, hence a 'Hold' prediction on rates.
description: Statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the thirty-third meeting of the International Monetary and Financial Committee, Washington DC, 15 April 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Participation of the President in the Portuguese Council of State
Key quote: The ECB did not hesitate to act in this regard. To preserve price stability, we have adopted an accommodative monetary policy stance without precedent and the ECB has and will continue to do whatever is needed to comply with its mandate.
Rationale: The speech indicates a commitment to an accommodative monetary policy stance, highlighting the ECB's readiness to take further action if necessary. The emphasis on supporting recovery and addressing vulnerabilities indicates a somewhat dovish stance. While no immediate interest rate cuts are suggested, the continuation of current measures suggests holding rates steady.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Portuguese Council of State, Lisbon, 7 April 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: The Governing Council has decided on a set of measures in the pursuit of its price stability objective. This comprehensive package will exploit the synergies between the different instruments and has been calibrated to further ease financing conditions.
Rationale: The speech announces a comprehensive package of easing measures, including lowering interest rates, expanding asset purchases, and introducing additional targeted refinancing operations, all of which indicate a strongly dovish stance aimed at stimulating the economy and countering deflationary pressures.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 10 March 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament
Key quote: The ECB is ready to do its part. As we announced at the end of our last monetary policy meeting in January, the Governing Council will review and possibly reconsider the monetary policy stance in early March.
Rationale: Mario Draghi's statement reflects concerns about the economic outlook and suggests readiness to adjust monetary policy, indicating a dovish stance with a likelihood of reducing interest rates if risks persist.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, before the Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 15 February 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: How central banks meet the challenge of low inflation
Key quote: But it does mean we have to design our instruments to compensate for it.
Rationale: The speech places significant emphasis on addressing low inflation and the risks of acting too late, suggesting a preference for further monetary easing. This dovish stance aligns with a likely prediction to cut rates to counteract the low inflation environment.
description: Text of the Marjolin lecture delivered by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the SUERF-Deutsche Bundesbank-IMFS Conference on "SSM at 1", Frankfurt am Main, 4 February 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Plenary debate of the European Parliament on the ECB's Annual Report 2014
Key quote: Therefore, at our last meeting in January we judged that it will be necessary to review and possibly reconsider our monetary policy stance at our next monetary policy meeting in early March.
Rationale: Draghi's speech indicates concern over inflation dynamics being weaker than expected and hints at the possibility of reconsidering the monetary policy stance, which suggests openness to further easing measures.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, to the plenary debate of the European Parliament on the ECB s Annual Report 2014, Strasbourg, 1 February 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: How domestic economic strength can prevail over global weakness
Key quote: The ECB has a central role to play in supporting confidence. We do that by fulfilling our price stability mandate: an inflation rate of below, but close, to 2%.
Rationale: The speech highlights the accommodative monetary policies of the ECB and the commitment to recalibrating the APP to address downside risks, emphasizing cautious optimism about domestic recovery but cautious about global uncertainties.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Deutsche Börse Group New Year s reception 2016, Eschborn, 25 January 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: It will therefore be necessary to review and possibly reconsider our monetary policy stance at our next meeting in early March.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges increased downside risks and weak inflation dynamics, suggesting a readiness to consider policy easing in the future. However, no immediate action is announced, indicating a cautiously dovish stance.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 21 January 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview with Bloomberg TV
Key quote: The perspective of low rates for longer has triggered that debate about the side effects of negative rates.
Rationale: Peter Praet's statements suggest a careful and measured approach to current economic challenges without indicating a clear direction towards easing or tightening monetary policy at the moment.
description: Interview with Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, and Bloomberg TV, conducted by Ms Jana Randow on 27 March 2019 and broadcast on 28 March 2019.

author: Peter Praet
title: Providing monetary policy stimulus after the normalisation of instruments
Key quote: In March we judged that recalibrating the date-based leg of our rate forward guidance, complemented with the announcement of a new series of TLTROs, was appropriate to respond to the weaker economic momentum and the related slowdown in the pace of inflation convergence to our aim.
Rationale: The speech indicates a recognition of slowing economic momentum, and highlights the need to maintain or potentially increase monetary accommodation, but no immediate rate cut is signaled. Thus, the stance is somewhat dovish. The likelihood of a ‘Hold’ outcome at the next meeting is high due to a focus on preserving current accommodative measures.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the conference "The ECB and its watchers XX", Frankfurt am Main, 27 March 2019.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in  Börsen-Zeitung
Key quote: We have revised our assessment of risks to growth downward. I would say that is a clear indication that the level of alert is higher than before.
Rationale: Peter Praet highlights increased risks and weaker economic data, expressing concerns over persistent political uncertainties and their impacts on business investment. While confidence is held for medium-term inflation goals, the tone reflects caution rather than a tightened policy outlook, suggesting a 'hold' stance with a dovish lean.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Börsen-Zeitung, conducted by Mr Detlef Fechtner and Mr Mark Schrörs on 11 February 2019 and published on 18 February 2019.

author: Peter Praet
title: Preserving monetary accommodation in times of normalisation
Key quote: The winding-down of net asset purchases is not tantamount to a withdrawal of monetary policy accommodation.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes maintaining monetary accommodation despite reducing asset purchases, signaling a cautious approach toward tightening, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. Therefore, it suggests holding rates steady to support inflation convergence.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, on "Herausforderungen für die Europäische Geldpolitik 2019" at 33. Internationales ZinsForum 2018, Frankfurt am Main, 26 November 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in Handelsblatt
Key quote: Significant monetary policy stimulus is still needed at present.
Rationale: Although there are concerns about risks and volatility, Praet emphasizes the need for continued accommodative policy to ensure inflation converges to target levels. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance with a likely decision to hold rates for the time being.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Handelsblatt, conducted by Mr Jan Mallien and Mr Frank Wiebe on 19 November 2018 and published on 23 November 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Preserving monetary accommodation in times of normalisation
Key quote: Significant monetary policy stimulus is still needed to support the build-up of domestic price pressures and headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: Peter Praet emphasizes the continuation of monetary accommodation, despite transitioning from asset purchases to forward guidance. This indicates a preference for maintaining supportive monetary conditions, aligning with a policy of holding interest rates steady.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the UBS Conference, London, 13 November 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Economic policymaking under uncertainty
Key quote: Population ageing is a challenge for the sustainability of public finances and monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech discusses demographic trends and their implications on fiscal and monetary policy without suggesting any immediate changes to monetary policy. It refers to the challenges posed by the aging population and potential impacts on real interest rates, suggesting a neutral stance on policy rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the "la Caixa" Chair for Economics and Society conference, Madrid, 17 October 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Ensuring a sustained adjustment in inflation
Key quote: Patience, prudence and persistence continue to be essential in determining the future course of monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech suggests a need for continued monetary stimulus, emphasizing patience and persistence, with no immediate hike in rates anticipated, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance and likely holding rates in the short term.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the National Bank of Romania, Bucharest, 3 July 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in Expresso
Key quote: We think that the underlying strength of the economy gives grounds that inflation convergence will continue in the period ahead, even after a gradual winding down of net asset purchases.
Rationale: The speech reveals confidence in the progress made towards the ECB's inflation target despite new uncertainties, implying a gradual winding down of asset purchases while maintaining an accommodative stance. This suggests holding rates steady despite the hawkish tone.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Expresso, conducted by Mr João Silvestre on 18 June 2018 and published on 23 June 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Monetary policy in a low interest rate environment
Key quote: The objective of this paper is to offer an organized discussion of the causes of the low interest rate environment by relying on a common framework that can help the debate on the implications for monetary policy-making going forward.
Rationale: The speech extensively discusses the low interest rate environment, its causes, and its effects on the natural rate of interest and monetary policy. The focus on both structural and cyclical factors reflects a balanced view, leaning neither towards aggressive policy shifts nor towards significant easing, suggesting a neutral stance in terms of monetary policy outlook.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Congress of Actuaries, Berlin, 6 June 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Economic developments in the euro area
Key quote: Overall, an ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges some economic moderation but emphasizes the necessity of maintaining substantial monetary stimulus due to subdued inflation, suggesting a preference to 'Hold' rather than raise rates, in order to support inflation towards the ECB's objective.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Swiss Financial Analysts Association (SFAA), Geneva, 7 May 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Economic and monetary policy in EMU - from unconventional times to sustainable and balanced growth
Key quote: Overall, an ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for maintaining significant monetary stimulus to support inflation and economic activity, reflecting a dovish stance. Despite acknowledging economic expansion, the concerns about subdued inflation and downside risks suggest a stance towards holding rates.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the OECD Chief Economist Talks, Paris, 3 May 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Improving the functioning of Economic and Monetary Union - lessons and challenges for economic policies
Key quote: Overall, an ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued monetary stimulus to build inflation pressures, indicating a dovish stance. The speaker suggests being patient and persistent with the policy, making it likely they would vote to hold rates to maintain stimulus.
description: Keynote dinner speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the NABE (National Association for Business Economics) International Symposium "Global Recovery: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly", Madrid, 16 April 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Economic developments in the euro area
Key quote: Overall, an ample degree of monetary stimulus remains necessary for underlying inflation pressures to continue to build up and support headline inflation developments over the medium term.
Rationale: Peter Praet emphasizes the need for continued monetary stimulus due to subdued inflation and the lack of a sustained adjustment in the inflation path. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, aiming to maintain current rates to support inflation without committing to further easing.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Finance Forum, Frankfurt, 9 April 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Assessment of quantitative easing and challenges of policy normalisation
Key quote: We cannot yet declare 'mission accomplished' on the inflation front, but we have made substantial progress on the path towards a sustained adjustment in inflation.
Rationale: The speech highlights the effectiveness of past measures and the importance of patience, persistence, and prudence going forward, suggesting a cautious approach without signaling immediate changes in policy rates.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the The ECB and Its Watchers XIX Conference, organised by the Institute for Monetary and Financial Stability, Frankfurt am Main, 14 March 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Global monetary policies - similarities and differences on the way to the new normal
Key quote: So, we still need patience and persistence in our monetary policy.
Rationale: Peter Praet's speech emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation due to lacklustre inflation and uncertain inflationary pressures. While he acknowledges economic improvement, the need for 'patience and persistence' suggests a cautious approach toward withdrawing monetary support, indicating a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the GIC/SUERF/Deutsche Bundesbank Conference "Monetary and economic policies on both sides of the Atlantic", Frankfurt am Main, 8 February 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Economic developments in the euro area
Key quote: We have not yet accomplished our mission: with inflation convergence proceeding only gradually, patience and persistence in our monetary policy remain warranted.
Rationale: Despite robust economic expansion, inflation is subdued and the central bank acknowledges the need for continued monetary stimulus. This signals a reluctance to tighten policy, suggesting a 'Hold' decision at the next meeting with persistence in current measures.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Cercle de Lorraine, Brussels, 1 February 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Maintaining price stability with unconventional monetary policy
Key quote: Today, we are still some distance away from meeting all three criteria at the same time. So, we still need patience and persistence in steering our policy conduct.
Rationale: The speech highlights a strong commitment to maintain current monetary policy measures, suggesting that while economic growth is solid, inflation pressures remain subdued, and thus the current accommodative policy remains necessary. This points to a neutral stance with a hold on rates in the near term.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Council of the European Union, Brussels, 29 January 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Recent economic developments in the euro area
Key quote: Convergence of inflation towards our aim therefore remains conditional on a substantial degree of monetary policy accommodation.
Rationale: The speaker acknowledges solid economic growth and a reduction in deflation risks but stresses the need for continued monetary policy accommodation to achieve target inflation, which suggests a bias towards maintaining the current policy stance rather than tightening it.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Febelfin working group of bank economists, Brussels, 16 November 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Communicating the complexity of unconventional monetary policy in EMU
Key quote: Central banks' monetary policy instruments have undergone a sea change over the last decade.
Rationale: The speech discusses communication and clarity in monetary policy without indicating a change in policy direction, suggesting a holding pattern in interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 2017 ECB Central Bank Communications Conference "Communications challenges for policy effectiveness, accountability and reputation", Frankfurt am Main, 15 November 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Opening remarks - "Money markets, monetary policy implementation and central bank balance sheets"
Key quote: A substantial amount of monetary accommodation continues to be necessary to secure the gradual convergence of inflation towards our inflation aim.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation, citing subdued inflation despite solid economic growth. While confident about gradual inflation convergence, the need for a lower pace of asset purchases points to a somewhat dovish stance, likely leading to a 'Hold' in rates.
description: Speaking points by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Workshop on "Money markets, monetary policy implementation and central bank balance sheets", Frankfurt am Main, 6 November 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Monetary policy and the euro area economic expansion
Key quote: We have not yet accomplished our mission, and so we must remain patient and persistent.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges the strong economic recovery and reduced deflation risks, but emphasizes the need for ongoing monetary policy support to achieve the inflation target. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance with a likelihood to hold interest rates steady while continuing asset purchase programs.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the JP Morgan Seminar entitled "Euro Zone: Will the European Recovery Continue?", Washington DC, 12 October 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Maintaining price stability with unconventional monetary policy measures
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to gradually build up and support headline inflation developments in the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the continuation of accommodative monetary policy and highlights insufficient progress towards inflation targets, suggesting a dovish stance but not immediately indicating a need for further cuts.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the SUERF - The European Money and Finance Forum Conference "Globalisation Dynamics - EU and US perspectives", New York City, 11 October 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Maintaining price stability with unconventional monetary policy measures
Key quote: A very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to gradually build up.
Rationale: Peter Praet acknowledges a solid recovery but highlights the lack of sufficient progress in inflation towards target and the need for continued substantial monetary accommodation. This indicates a somewhat dovish stance, suggesting the policy rates are likely to be held steady with an emphasis on continued support via unconventional measures like APP.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the MMF Monetary and Financial Policy Conference 2017 "Unconventional monetary policy in the UK", London, 2 October 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in Les Echos
Key quote: The economic expansion that is under way is not yet feeding through into higher inflation.
Rationale: Praet emphasizes that while economic conditions are improving, inflation is not yet at desired levels, indicating continued support for maintaining accommodative monetary policy and likely voting to hold rates.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Les Echos, conducted by Ms Isabelle Couet and Ms Catherine Chatignoux on 25 September 2017 and published on 29 September 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in De Tijd
Key quote: A substantial stimulus is still necessary.
Rationale: The speech highlights that the ECB is still patient and needs to continue substantial stimulus as underlying inflation remains low. Praet emphasizes the importance of patient and steady policy adjustment without excessive shocks, which suggests a somewhat dovish stance.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in De Tijd, conducted by Mr Wouter Vervenne and Mr Bart Haeck on 13 September and published on 16 September 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Karl-Otto Pöhl Lecture
Key quote: Our mission is not yet accomplished and we must remain patient and persistent.
Rationale: Despite the positive economic recovery, Mr. Praet emphasizes the need for patience and persistence in achieving inflation targets, suggesting that the current accommodative policy stance should be maintained. The speech indicates a cautious view towards changing interest rates until inflation shows convincing signs of an upward trend.
description: Text of the Karl-Otto Pöhl Lecture by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 13 September 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in De Standaard
Key quote: We need patience and persistence. We need to be patient because inflation convergence needs more time to show through convincingly in the data.
Rationale: Peter Praet emphasizes the need for patience and persistence with accommodative policy due to subdued inflation pressures, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance. However, the acknowledgment of improved economic growth balances the message, leading to a prediction to 'Hold' rates.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in De Standaard, conducted by Mr Pascal Dendooven and Ms Goele De Cort on 3 July 2017 and published on 8 July 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Europe's economic recovery and implications for monetary policy
Key quote: But our mission is not yet accomplished. We need patience and persistence.
Rationale: Although the economic recovery is gaining momentum, Praet emphasizes the need for patience and persistence, highlighting subdued underlying inflation and wage growth as reasons to maintain current accommodative policies.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Conference of Commercial Bank Economists (ICCBE) in France, Paris, 6 July 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Unconventional monetary policy and fixed income markets
Key quote: But our mission is not yet accomplished. We need patience and persistence.
Rationale: Peter Praet highlights the need for patience and persistence in achieving the ECB's inflation targets, emphasizing ongoing accommodative monetary policy and suggesting no imminent rate increases.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Fixed Income Market Colloquium, Rome, 4 July 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in Der Spiegel
Key quote: There is a broad-based recovery happening and it will probably continue.
Rationale: Peter Praet provides a balanced view, acknowledging economic recovery while noting that inflation is still low. This suggests a 'wait-and-see' approach rather than immediate policy shifts, hence the prediction to 'Hold' rates.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Der Spiegel, conducted by Mr Stefan Kaiser on 19 June 2017 and published on 22 June 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Europe's economic recovery - challenges and opportunities for the banking sector
Key quote: At our last policy meeting in April, the Governing Council took into account all available information and concluded that there was insufficient evidence to warrant a scaling back of the exceptional degree of monetary accommodation.
Rationale: While there is recognition of a solid economic recovery, the emphasis on subdued wage dynamics and the need for continued monetary accommodation suggests a somewhat dovish stance, indicating that the ECB is not yet ready to scale back its supportive measures. This implies a likelihood of holding the current policy rate.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Association of Banks in Bulgaria, Sofia, 24 May 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: The role of the European Central Bank - pudence and responsibility in times of crisis
Key quote: The euro area economy, including the public sector, currently benefits from very low interest rates.
Rationale: The speech reflects a focus on the ECB's responsibility for maintaining price stability using unconventional measures and expresses the need for a cautious future policy normalization. The emphasis on low interest rates benefiting the economy and the call for readiness to normalize suggests a 'somewhat dovish' outlook with a likely 'hold' on rates in the near term.
description: Lecture by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the "Heidelberg Symposium", Heidelberg, 11 May 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Ensuring price stability
Key quote: In view of currently available evidence, the Governing Council in its April meeting has judged that there is not yet sufficient evidence of progress towards a durable and self-sustaining convergence in the path of euro area inflation that would warrant a scaling back of the exceptional degree of monetary policy accommodation.
Rationale: The speech highlights both improved economic conditions and the continuation of subdued inflation, which suggests a balanced stance with no immediate change in policy. The ECB's commitment to a gradual normalization echoes a 'Hold' prediction on interest rates.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Belgian Financial Forum colloquium on "The low interest rate environment", Brussels, 4 May 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in Expansión
Key quote: At the present time, I would have to say no, but it's clear that the tone of our communication has changed - we are now more optimistic on the economic outlook.
Rationale: Despite improving economic conditions and reduced deflationary concerns, Praet emphasizes the necessity of continuing expansionary policy, indicating a somewhat dovish stance with a higher likelihood of holding rates steady.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Expansión, conducted by Andres Stumpf Guirao on 27 March 2017 and published on 3 April 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: How does monetary policy secure price stability over the medium term?
Key quote: We are not yet sufficiently confident that inflation will converge to levels consistent with our aim in a durable manner.
Rationale: The speech highlights the reliance on accommodative measures to support inflation dynamics and secure economic recovery, indicating a preference for maintaining current policy to promote price stability.
description: Intervention by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 4th European Technical Consumer Goods Retail Summit, Berlin, 30 March 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Have unconventional policies overstretched central bank independence? Challenges for accountability and transparency in the wake of the crisis
Key quote: Unconventional policies have been complicated to implement and to communicate. But they have been effective in enhancing our ability to deliver on our mandate in a medium-term perspective.
Rationale: The speech discusses the challenges and necessity of unconventional monetary policies to achieve the ECB's mandate. While it acknowledges the complexity and new communication challenges, it ultimately supports the continuation of accommodative measures to ensure low and stable inflation, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. Given this context, the prediction is that the speaker would likely vote to hold rates, given the emphasis on the effectiveness of current measures.
description: Keynote address by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the "Symposium on Building the Financial System of the 21st Century: An Agenda for Europe and the United States", Frankfurt am Main, 29 March 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: The economic situation in the euro area and the implications for monetary policy
Key quote: Our conclusion that a very substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation in the medium term remains valid.
Rationale: The speech highlights the need for continued monetary accommodation due to subdued underlying inflation pressures despite an economic recovery. This suggests a neutral stance focused on maintaining current policy support.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the IE Business School Leadership Forum, Madrid, 27 March 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in VDI Nachrichten
Key quote: So far, we can only say that the economic situation is improving. That gives us confidence, but the upward trend and hence the normalisation of inflation are still very dependent on monetary policy stimulus.
Rationale: Peter Praet emphasizes that despite improvements, the economic recovery is still highly dependent on monetary policy stimulus. He notes that inflation is not robust, suggesting a cautious approach and potential continuation of current policies rather than tightening.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in VDI Nachrichten, conducted by Ms Sabine Seeger and published on 24 March 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: The European Central Bank's monetary policy - past and present
Key quote: We no longer perceive a sense of urgency to take further measures to combat adverse tail risks.
Rationale: The speech outlines the ECB's monetary policy measures and their impact, while recognizing improvements in the economic outlook and the reduced need for further measures. However, it also notes remaining economic risks and subdued inflationary pressures, suggesting a neutral stance with a likelihood of holding rates steady.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Febelfin Connect event, Brussels/Londerzeel, 16 March 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: The euro area economic outlook and monetary policy
Key quote: Looking through recent volatility, the inflation outlook does not at this stage warrant a reassessment of the current monetary policy stance.
Rationale: While Praet acknowledges the euro area's economic recovery, he emphasizes that underlying inflation pressures remain subdued and a substantial degree of monetary accommodation is still needed. This suggests a cautious stance towards changing the monetary policy rate.
description: Intervention by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a panel discussion at the G-20 conference "The G20 Agenda under the German Presidency", organised by the Institute of International Finance, Frankfurt am Main, 15 March 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: The macroeconomic situation and monetary policy in the euro area
Key quote: The economic recovery and the outlook for price stability are still predicated on the very favourable financing conditions that to a large extent depend on continued monetary policy support.
Rationale: Peter Praet's speech highlights the positive impact of the ECB's accommodative monetary policy on the economic recovery and inflation expectations. However, he mentions the need for continued support to ensure a durable convergence of inflation towards the target. This suggests a somewhat dovish stance, favoring ongoing stimulus rather than tightening.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the MNI Connect Roundtable and OMFIF lunch discussion, London, 23 February 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Maintaining price stability in the euro area
Key quote: Continued monetary policy support is necessary to ensure a sustained convergence of inflation towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: Praet's speech suggests that while there has been some improvement in inflation and economic conditions, underlying inflationary pressures remain subdued and monetary policy needs to stay accommodative to achieve the ECB's inflation target. The current stance is supportive, indicating a 'hold' on interest rates with a somewhat dovish overall tone.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 15. Handelsblatt Jahrestagung "Zukunftstrategien für Sparkassen und Landesbanken", Berlin, 2 February 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Is secular stagnation the new economic reality?
Key quote: In fulfilling its role in this comprehensive response, monetary policy is confronted with three key challenges.
Rationale: Peter Praet acknowledges slow growth and the challenges faced by monetary policy, but emphasizes the use of non-standard measures to support the economy. The focus on maintaining a comprehensive and cooperative policy approach indicates a dovish stance, though the commitment to the ongoing recovery suggests holding rates for now.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, for the policy panel entitled "How to deal with potential secular stagnation?" at the Secular Stagnation and Growth Measurement Conference, Bank of France, Paris, 16 January 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in the Telegraaf
Key quote: We see moderate but strengthening growth; that is better than it was a while ago.
Rationale: Praet acknowledges the progress in economic growth and improved employment, but also notes challenges such as income distribution issues, unresolved banking sector problems, and the need for further reforms. His tone suggests cautious optimism but an overall need for continued monetary accommodation, indicating a somewhat dovish stance. However, there's no clear indication of a need for policy change, suggesting a likely hold at the next meeting.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in the Telegraaf, conducted by Mr Martin Visser and Ms Dorinde Meuzelaar on 12 December, and published on 20 December 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in Die Zeit
Key quote: We want to continue the level of monetary policy support that we have been administering to the European economy so far.
Rationale: Peter Praet emphasizes that the ECB is prolonging its accommodative policy to support recovery, indicating a somewhat dovish stance by maintaining low rates and extending the bond purchase program despite global trends of rising rates.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Die Zeit, conducted by Ms Lisa Nienhaus and Mr Mark Schieritz on 12 December, and published on 14 December 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: The euro area economy, monetary policy and structural reforms
Key quote: We remain fully committed to preserving the very substantial amount of monetary accommodation which is necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation towards our inflation aim.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for continued accommodative monetary policy and acknowledges risks to growth and inflation. However, it stops short of indicating an immediate need for further easing, thus suggesting a likelihood to hold rates at the next meeting.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Observatory Group roundtable, New York City, 18 November 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Long-run saving and monetary policy
Key quote: The ECB's unconventional policy measures over recent years have been necessary to react to the severe negative shock arising from the crisis.
Rationale: The speech highlights the necessity of maintaining accommodative measures due to the low natural rate and ongoing recovery, indicating a slightly dovish stance focused on ensuring growth and inflation targets before making any changes. However, it recognizes the limits and potential long-term issues, suggesting caution in further easing.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Parliamentary evening on "Challenges for long term savings products in the context of the zero-interest rate policy", Brussels, 14 November 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Monetary policy and the euro area banking system
Key quote: Monetary policy will continue its accommodative stance until inflation returns to our aim, which will remove some of the cyclical drivers of weak profitability linked to disappointing nominal growth.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of maintaining an accommodative policy to support the economic recovery and addresses several challenges facing the banking sector. As such, it is likely that the speaker would not advocate for an immediate change in the policy rate, hence a ‘Hold’ prediction.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Capital Markets Institute (ECMI) Annual Conference  "Towards the right policy mix for a thriving European capital market", Brussels, 9 November 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: The euro area economy, monetary policy and structural reforms
Key quote: We remain committed to preserving the very substantial amount of monetary accommodation which is necessary to secure a sustained convergence of inflation towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech highlights the resilience of the euro area recovery but acknowledges downside risks and emphasizes the need for continued monetary accommodation to support growth. This indicates a preference for maintaining current policy measures, rather than tightening, to ensure inflation picks up toward target.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Treasurers Club, Brussels, 26 October 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Beyond monetary policy - on the importance of a proper alignment of economic policies in EMU
Key quote: We will preserve the very substantial amount of monetary support that is necessary to secure a return of inflation to levels below, but close to 2% over the medium term.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the ECB's commitment to preserving substantial monetary support to secure inflation targets and discusses the challenges of maintaining price stability amidst adverse shocks, suggesting a cautious approach towards policy change, hence a somewhat dovish stance with a likely decision to hold rates.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the conference "Beyond Monetary Policy", organised by the US-Korea Institute at SAIS and Reinventing Bretton Woods Committee, Contribution to the Panel on Realignment of Economic Policy: Beyond Monetary Policy, Washington DC, 7 October 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Turn cyclical recovery into a structural recovery
