Key quote: A basic challenge in the appropriate inclusion of owner-occupied housing costs in a consumer price index is that housing has a dual nature.
Rationale: The speech presents a technical discussion on statistical methodologies and the ECB's strategy review without making direct references to immediate changes in the monetary policy stance. It focuses on aligning the ECB's statistical measures with its price stability objective and other longer-term considerations such as climate change, indicating a neutral approach at the current juncture.
description: Speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Association for Official Statistics (IAOS) Conference, Kraków, 27 April 2022.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Structural change and central banking - some research priorities
Key quote: From a central banking perspective, the uncertainties associated with structural change reinforce the value of a stability-oriented approach to the conduct of monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the ECB’s commitment to its inflation target and the need to adapt to structural changes without indicating an immediate policy shift, suggesting a neutral stance towards holding rates.
description: Panel contribution by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank (ECB), to the 5th Joint Regional Financing Arrangements Research Seminar organised by the European Stability Mechanism, Frankfurt am Main, 24 September 2021.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Maximising the user value of statistics - lessons from globalisation and the pandemic
Key quote: Economic and financial statistics play a central role in guiding monetary policy decisions.
Rationale: The speech focuses on statistical challenges and improvements rather than on current or future monetary policy or economic conditions. As such, it is not directly related to monetary policy decision-making.
description: Remarks (virtual) by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Statistical Forum, 26 April 2021.

author: Philip R Lane
title: The analytical contribution of external statistics - addressing the challenges
Key quote: In this speech I have focused on the topic of measurement challenges for external statistics.
Rationale: Despite the emphasis on the importance of external statistics for policy understanding, the speech is more focused on measurement challenges and statistical data improvements rather than monetary policy, making it not directly related to monetary policy stance.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Joint European Central Bank, Irving Fisher Committee and Banco de Portugal conference on "Bridging measurement challenges and analytical needs of external statistics: evolution or revolution?", Lisbon, 17 February 2020.

author: Philip R Lane
title: Welcome address - "Challenges in the digital age"
Key quote: It is a pleasure to welcome all of you to the ECB for this conference. As a central bank, understanding the myriad implications of digitalisation for the economy is a high priority.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on digitalisation and its economic implications, without providing specific indications on current or future monetary policy actions.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Philip R Lane, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB conference on "Challenges in the digital age", Frankfurt am Main, 4 July 2019.

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: Reassessing monetary policy tools in a volatile macroeconomic environment
Key quote: The slides presented during this conference are the same as those presented on 14 November 2024 at the IMF's Jacques Polak Annual Research Conference.
Rationale: The speech does not contain specific content related to changes in monetary policy or the central bank's stance, therefore it is labeled as 'Not related'. The statement about slides does not indicate a change in rate stance, resulting in a neutral probability decision to 'Hold' rates.
description: Speech by Isabel Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the BIS Colloquium in honour of Claudio Borio, Head of the Monetary and Economic Department, in Basel, Switzerland

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: Reassessing monetary policy tools in a rapidly changing world
Key quote: The slides presented during this conference are the same as those presented on 14 November 2024 at the IMF's Jacques Polak Annual Research Conference.
Rationale: The text does not provide any specific statements on monetary policy, interest rates, or economic outlook that would indicate a stance on future monetary policy decisions. It merely notes where the slides have been presented previously.
description: Speech by Ms Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the Chicago Booth Conference on the Global Economy and Financial Stability, in London, UK

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: The ECB’s monetary policy: towards price stability
Key quote: The slides presented during this lecture are the same as those presented on 30 October 2024 at the SAFE-CEPR conference on Euro@25.
Rationale: The repetition of the slides from a previous presentation suggests there are no significant changes or new insights regarding monetary policy. The title indicates a focus on maintaining price stability, a goal typically associated with a neutral stance.
description: Lecture by Ms Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at Michael Chae Seminar on Macroeconomic Policy at Harvard University’s Department of Economics in Cambridge, MA, USA

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: From market neutrality to market efficiency
Key quote: Central banks can act as a catalyst to facilitate an orderly transition towards a greener economy.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the ECB's role in the green transition and climate change mitigation rather than directly addressing traditional monetary policy actions like interest rates. However, the indirect implication of enhancing frameworks and roles to address climate change suggests a neutral stance on immediate rate decisions, implying a hold decision, albeit with a slight inclination towards action.
description: Welcome address by Ms Isabel Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB DG-Research Symposium "Climate change, financial markets and green growth", Frankfurt am Main, 14 June 2021.

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: From green neglect to green dominance?
Key quote: Central banks are also reflecting on their role in environmental protection.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the role of the ECB in addressing climate change rather than monetary policy direction. It discusses the integration of climate considerations into policy rather than immediate adjustments to interest rates.
description: Intervention by Ms Isabel Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the "Greening Monetary Policy – Central Banking and Climate Change" online seminar, organised as part of the "Cleveland Fed Conversations on Central Banking", Frankfurt am Main, 3 March 2021.

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: Women are central, not just in central banks
Key quote: Women are central, not just in central banks
Rationale: The speech by Isabel Schnabel is focused entirely on gender imbalance and diversity within the economics profession and the ECB. There is no discussion of monetary policy, interest rates, or economic conditions to analyze the central bank's stance on monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Isabel Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Meeting 2020 of the Verein für Socialpolitik, Frankfurt am Main, 28 September 2020.

author: Isabel Schnabel
title: Never waste a crisis - COVID-19, climate change and monetary policy
Key quote: The ECB will be no bystander on this journey. As climate change poses severe risks to price stability, central banks are required, within their traditional mandates, to strengthen their efforts to support a faster transition towards a more sustainable economy.
Rationale: The speech discusses the risks climate change poses to price stability but does not directly advocate for changes to current monetary policy. It emphasizes the ECB's role in supporting a transition to a sustainable economy, suggesting a commitment to current policy without immediate changes, which aligns with a 'Hold' prediction.
description: Speech by Ms Isabel Schnabel, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a virtual roundtable on "Sustainable Crisis Responses in Europe", organised by the INSPIRE research network, Frankfurt am Main, 17 July 2020.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Financial services - the European mysterious gap
Key quote: Let me conclude by borrowing the motto of the Olympic and Paralympic Games, hosted in Paris this summer: we need to take European financial services 'faster, higher and stronger together'.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on enhancing European financial services and strategies to reduce the gap in financial integration, rather than on specific monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bruegel Annual Meetings, Brussels, 4 September 2024.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Climate economics - from the veil of uncertainty to three convictions for action
Key quote: Climate change must be the number one priority of the 'focused multilateralism' I am calling for, be it in the G20 or in the IMF and the World Bank.
Rationale: This speech is primarily focused on climate economics and not monetary policy, thus it's not directly addressing central bank interest rate decisions. However, given the context, it suggests holding the policy rate steady in the face of climate transition efforts.
description: Speech (virtual) by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Central Banks and Supervisors Network for Greening the Financial System (NGFS) Annual Plenary meeting and Plenary Workshop, London, 25 June 2024.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Ten years of Single Supervisory Mechanism (SSM) - great achievements, and new journeys to complete
Key quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the achievements and future directions of the Single Supervisory Mechanism and the Banking Union, rather than on immediate monetary policy actions. The context does not suggest a direct dovish or hawkish stance.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chair of the Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority (ACPR), at the Conference held at the ACPR, Paris, 24 June 2024.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Innovation by central banks - the sooner the better
Key quote: To conclude and to tackle today's question in an even more straightforward way: yes, central banks must rapidly start adopting new technological innovations - including AI - in a rational, clear-headed and controlled way.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on the necessity for central banks to adopt technological innovations, rather than on immediate monetary policy like the interest rate direction. However, given the current context and absence of direct references to inflationary pressure or economic conditions affecting the monetary policy, it suggests maintaining the status quo, which implies holding rates.
description: Speech (virtual) by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the BIS Innovation Summit 2024, Basel, 6 May 2024.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: International monetary spillovers - financial and intellectual linkages
Key quote: But coordination does not mean that the pace of monetary tightening must be equal across all economies, as each has its own specificities.
Rationale: The speech indicates an understanding of global interdependencies and the effects of spillovers but does not strongly commit to a specific policy direction or signal significant changes. The probability leans towards holding the rates steady given the balancing act described in the speech.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bellagio event, Paris, 11 January 2024.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Launch of the NGFS Conceptual Framework for nature-related financial risks "to guide action by Central banks and supervisors on nature-related risks"
Key quote: The new conceptual framework released today by the NGFS therefore marks an important milestone.
Rationale: The content of the speech primarily addresses environmental risks and nature-related financial risks, not monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Launch of the NGFS Conceptual Framework for nature-related financial risks"to guide action by Central banks and supervisors on nature-related risks", Paris, 7 September 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Regulation and innovation - the yin and yang of the financial sector
Key quote: The Paris financial centre is therefore a good illustration of harmonious coexistence between regulation and innovation.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the balance between regulation and innovation in the financial sector, rather than monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the 2023 Paris Finance Forum, Paris, 5 July 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Building together a future-proof banking and payment sector in Europe
Key quote: The rise in interest rates generally benefits European banks, thanks to their diversified deposit base and large loan portfolio.
Rationale: The speech discusses the benefits to European banks from rising rates and emphasizes regulatory strengths, implying a balanced view on current policy rates. The focus is on regulatory improvements and the future of digital currencies, suggesting a 'Hold' stance on rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Global Official Institutions Conference, organised by BNP Paribas, Paris, 22 June 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Governance of public expenditure and public services: is there any hope left?
Key quote: Governance of public expenditure and public services: is there any hope left?
Rationale: The speech focuses on the governance of public expenditure and public services, which is not directly related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it falls under the 'Not related' category.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Académie des sciences morales et politique conference, Paris, 19 June 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Presentation of the 2022 Annual Report of the Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority
Key quote: But it must be reiterated, the rise in interest rates generally benefits French and European banks, thanks to their diversified business model.
Rationale: The speech centers on the stability and robustness of the financial system amidst geopolitical and economic challenges, without indicating significant concerns about inflation or advocating for immediate interest rate changes, suggesting a neutral stance on monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chair of the Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority (ACPR), at the ACPR press conference, Paris, 31 May 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Parisian momentum
Key quote: The likelihood of a recession in 2023 can now be excluded, and prospects have been revised upwards.
Rationale: The speech highlights the resilience and growth prospects of the French economy and stability of the financial sector, suggesting confidence in economic stability. Despite acknowledging recent turmoil, the optimism about future growth and the strength of financial institutions leans somewhat hawkish, though without explicit calls for immediate rate hikes.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bloomberg "Future of Finance" Paris forum, Paris, 9 May 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Big techs in finance - a bildungsroman that is far from over
Key quote: All economic agents need an anchor that guarantees the trust in the value of money, and central banks are the only ones fully able to preserve it.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the role of big tech in finance and the implications for regulation, rather than monetary policy directly. Therefore, the label 'Not related' is most suitable. However, in context of central banking involvement in innovation and regulation, a 'Hold' position on the policy rate is likely.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the high-level BIS conference "Big techs in finance – implications for public policy", Basel, 9 February 2023.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Financial regulation - a French perspective
Key quote: The resurgence of inflation and the rising fears that it will become more entrenched, is motivating central banks around the world to normalise and possibly tighten monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on financial regulation and stability, rather than directly on monetary policy. However, it acknowledges the broader context of monetary normalization due to inflationary pressures.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Financial System Conference 2022, Dublin, 2 November 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Past progress induces new challenges - raising the stakes for standard disclosure, supervisory requirement and collective governance
Key quote: Central banks and supervisors are delivering what they promised: the Eurosystem is incorporating climate change into the ECB's monetary policy operations.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on climate finance and the governance of green finance, rather than on monetary policy or the central bank's interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy decisions such as rate cuts or hikes.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Climate Finance Day, Paris, 27 October 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: ACPR-AMF Forum Fintech
Key quote: Our attention is focused in particular on another aspect of the digital evolution: crypto-assets.
Rationale: The speech focuses on fintech and innovation rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the ACPR-AMF Forum Fintech, Paris, 19 October 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Biodiversity, macroeconomics and finance - what we do know, what we don't know yet, and what we have to do
Key quote: However, rest assured that we will do everything in our power and within our mandate to manage biodiversity and nature-related risks.
Rationale: The speech is focused on biodiversity and its implications for finance and macroeconomics, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions, resulting in a 'Not related' label.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the De Nederlandsche Bank/Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum conference on "Moving beyond climate: integrating biodiversity into financial markets", Amsterdam, 29 September 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Anchors and catalysts - central banks' dual role in innovation
Key quote: I hope that we central bankers will find our way to make tokenisation fit in the existing architecture, while regulating it to the extent necessary.
Rationale: The speech focuses on regulatory reform and central bank innovation related to financial tokenisation rather than direct monetary policy measures. It reflects a balanced approach to supporting innovation while ensuring stability, aligning it with a neutral stance on current interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the conference on opportunities and challenges of the tokenisation of finance, Paris, 27 September 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Armed peace and risk proportionality - how to strike the right balance
Key quote: Resolution currently stands as the only harmonised crisis management framework at EU level, and is therefore a public good to be preserved and enhanced.
Rationale: The speech focuses on resolution frameworks and not directly on monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to the specific focus on monetary policy stances.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Single Resolution Board Annual Conference, Brussels, 19 September 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Central bank digital currency (CBDC) and bank intermediation in the digital age
Key quote: The two projects of a wholesale and retail CBDC are two faces of the same 'mountain', which is the ambition to offer a digital form of central bank money to combine innovation and trust in the payment system.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the potential for a central bank digital currency (CBDC) and its implications for bank intermediation, rather than addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions directly.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the 2022 Paris Europlace International Finance Forum, Paris, 12 July 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Central banks in a distributed-ledger technologies world
Key quote: Financial stability without innovation would mean conservatism; innovation without financial stability would feed distrust, and hence be unsustainable.
Rationale: This speech is primarily focused on central banks' role in adapting to distributed-ledger technologies and crypto-assets rather than monetary policy. The key quote emphasizes the central bank's openness to innovation, not a stance on interest rates or policy actions.
description: Speech (virtual) by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bank for International Settlement's Innovation Summit, 22 March 2022.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Capital Markets Union - unleashing Europe's potential
Key quote: Our first duty is to give our fellow citizens the purpose and the meaning of the CMU project, and hence the desire for it.
Rationale: The speech by Villeroy de Galhau is focused on financial market integration and the Capital Markets Union project in Europe, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or the central bank's interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France Governor, at a conference, Paris, 30 November 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Central banks and finance in the face of a triple revolution
Key quote: We must encourage innovation and the progress it brings, while preserving stability and rules.
Rationale: The speech focuses on balancing innovation with stability and rules. While it acknowledges the challenges and changes posed by decentralized finance and digital currencies, it emphasizes maintaining trust and stability, which suggests no imminent change in monetary policy stance, aligning with a 'Hold' decision.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the Conference of ACPR, Paris, 25 November 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Digital innovation - what role can we play as central banks?
Key quote: Innovation and stability can appear as contradictory in the short run; but they are complementary through a common value; a keystone: trust.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on digital innovation, regulation, and central bank digital currencies, without discussing monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Singapore Fintech Festival, 8 November 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Central banks and climate - not the only game in town, but more committed than ever
Key quote: Finance, and still more Central banks, cannot be the only green game in town.
Rationale: The speech focuses on climate finance and environmental sustainability rather than monetary policy or interest rate changes. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy considerations.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Climate Finance Day, Paris, 26 October 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Bank of France - how the commitment to fintechs is being implemented
Key quote: Faced with the acceleration of digital technology and Bigtechs, we must develop a more 'Schumpeterian' finance capable of fostering the emergence of innovative European players.
Rationale: The speech focused on the integration, dialogue, and experimentation with fintechs rather than monetary policy or interest rate changes. Therefore, it falls under the 'Not related to monetary policy' category. The mention of fintechs contributing to the financial sector's modernisation suggests a neutral stance regarding the current policy rate.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the ACPR-AMF Forum Fintech, Paris, 11 October 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Speech -  International Conference on Statistics for Sustainable
Key quote: Accelerating the green transition requires accelerating green data.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on sustainable finance and climate-related data rather than on monetary policy, interest rates, or economic inflation, leading to a 'Not related' label. However, given a neutral stance in terms of potential impacts on monetary policy, a 'Hold' prediction is made with moderate probability.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the International Conference on Statistics for Sustainable Finance, jointly organised by the Bank of France, Deutsche Bundesbank and the Irving Fisher Committee on Central Bank Statistics, Paris, 14 September 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: New avenues for monetary policy
Key quote: It is precisely because we are not in a crisis situation that we should move forward now.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on structural reforms in the European banking sector rather than changes in monetary policy. While the discussion addresses issues that can impact financial stability, the content does not indicate a shift in policy stance or an inclination towards changing interest rates. The focus on forward momentum in banking suggests maintaining current policy settings.
description: Speech by François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Eurofi Financial Forum, Ljubljana, 10 September 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Roads for the future - central bank digital currency (CBDC) and innovative payments
Key quote: Let me start by clarifying one major point: no decision has been taken at this stage on whether or not to create a digital euro.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the exploration of CBDC and innovative payment systems without discussing immediate changes to monetary policy. The governor emphasizes preparation and analysis rather than immediate action, suggesting a neutral stance regarding policy rate changes.
description: Closing address by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, 2021 Paris Europlace - Studio Gabriel, Paris, 29 June 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Never too much and never too many - how to transform global discussion into global action against climate change
Key quote: Central banks' commitment to the climate cause may seem obvious today. But few issues have seen such a rapid and massive change.
Rationale: This speech mainly focuses on climate change and its integration into the central bank's role rather than monetary policy. However, the emphasis on climate risk within financial systems might imply no significant change in monetary policy stance, suggesting a 'Hold' on rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Green Swan 2021 Global Virtual Conference, 2 June 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: What fiscal policies beyond monetary policy support?
Key quote: As you know, the ECB silent period has already started, so I won't say a word on monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on fiscal policy and its relation to monetary policy, specifically in the context of the European Union, but does not specifically discuss changes or expectations related to the central bank's policy rate or immediate monetary policy actions.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Eurofi High Level Seminar, Lisbon, 16 April 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: The role of central banks in the greening of the economy
Key quote: The greening of the central bank's actions does not therefore require a further easing of monetary policy, but rather a recalibration of its tools.
Rationale: The speech is focused on integrating climate change considerations into central bank operations rather than addressing immediate monetary policy changes such as interest rate adjustments.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the 5th edition of the Rencontres on "Climate Change and Sustainable Finance", organised jointly with Option Finance. Paris, 11 February 2021.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: The Pig, the frog and the elephant - towards a better regulation of digital innovation
Key quote: Let me say a few words about green finance. In France and in Europe, we are aiming to put green finance at the forefront of our shared efforts.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses digital innovation, regulation, and green finance, without focus on monetary policy or immediate implications for interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Singapore Fintech Festival, Paris, 8 December 2020.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Paris 2020 Climate Finance Day
Key quote: Reconstruction is an opportunity to accelerate the transition to greener growth.
Rationale: While the speech focuses on climate finance and the role of monetary policy in combating climate change, it doesn't suggest imminent changes to the current policy rate. The emphasis is on integrating climate risks into monetary frameworks rather than signaling monetary policy changes, suggesting a neutral stance likely to hold rates steady.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Paris 2020 Climate Finance Day, Paris, 29 October 2020.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Support for Fintechs and the digital revolution in payments
Key quote: Fintechs are no longer separate from the world of finance. They are transforming the practices of financial institutions.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial innovation, fintech support, and regulatory adaptation rather than direct monetary policy. Given the emphasis on innovation and stability with the current low rate, a 'Hold' decision is most probable, but the speech does not explicitly address monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the Fintech Forum, Paris, 12 October 2020.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Brexit, digital payments, seize the day
Rationale: The speech largely focuses on Brexit, digital payments, and structural changes within the EU financial system rather than on immediate monetary policy actions or interest rate decisions.
description: Closing speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Paris Europlace International Financial Forum, Paris, 7 October 2020.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: New Year wishes to the Paris financial centre
Key quote: I won't talk about the latter today as we are in the 'quiet period' before the meeting of the Governing Council on 20 and 21 January.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of maintaining accommodative monetary policy amidst high uncertainty, indicating a dovish stance. The focus on fiscal support and no suggestion of tightening monetary policy suggests the speaker is likely to vote to hold the interest rate at the next meeting.
description: New Year wishes to the Paris financial centre by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), Paris, 19 January 2020.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Central bank digital currency and innovative payments
Key quote: We have to remain fully committed to our dual objective - safeguarding confidence/supporting innovation - which is written into the very DNA of our institution.
Rationale: The speech focuses on innovation in payment systems and the potential introduction of a central bank digital currency, maintaining a balanced view on the need for innovation while safeguarding confidence and stability. This suggests a neutral stance without direct implications for an immediate policy shift.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the ACPR, Paris, 4 December 2019.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: What economic sovereignty for Europe? Facing the threats with lucidity, and boldly seizing an opportunity
Key quote: Monetary policies do their part by keeping interest rates low in the face of the slowdown, but they cannot tackle the underlying cause.
Rationale: The speech acknowledges external economic threats and promotes maintaining low interest rates, but focuses more on the broader European economic sovereignty and structural issues without emphasizing an aggressive monetary policy stance.
description: Inaugural lesson by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Paris School of International Affairs, Sciences Po Paris, Paris, 18 September 2019.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: The role of banking in a sustainable global economy
Key quote: The current context is one of increased uncertainty, which is already weighing on growth at the international level.
Rationale: The speech focuses on non-monetary policy topics such as digital transformation, green finance, and the uncertainties surrounding Brexit. Villeroy de Galhau acknowledges risks from uncertain external factors like oil shocks but does not signal a clear need for immediate policy changes. This aligns with a 'Neutral' stance, suggesting a likely 'Hold' decision on rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the World Conference of Banking Institutes, London, 17 September 2019.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: 75 years later - thinking about the next 75
Key quote: Monetary policies cannot do everything, and cannot perform miracles.

description: Welcome address by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the G7 high-level conference, Paris, 16 July 2019.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: New frontiers in finance
Key quote: Let us break limits and invent new practices taking into account both digitalisation and climate change.
Rationale: The speech focuses on digitalisation and green finance, topics not directly related to monetary policy or immediate interest rate decisions. Therefore, it's categorized as 'Not related', but touches on systemic risks which may influence a general stance on holding rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Paris Europlace International Financial Forum, Paris, 9 July 2019.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Cybersecurity - coordinating efforts to protect the financial sector in the global economy
Key quote: There is no threat which we are surer of than cyber risks in the financial sector.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau

Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on climate finance and the role of central banks and financial institutions in addressing climate-related risks. While it touches on monetary policy in relation to climate change, it does not provide insights into the speaker's stance on interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Closing Session of the Climate Finance Day 2018, Paris, 28 November 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Pushing back the limits of insurability

title: Financial supervision and the role of national authorities in Europe

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Silos, security of systems, speed

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: The major issues at stake in the review of prudential supervision of banks
Key quote: The major issues at stake in the review of prudential supervision of banks.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on the prudential supervision of banks and the structural reforms in the Banking Union, not directly addressing monetary policy or changes in interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the Conference of the ACPR, Paris, 8 June 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Presentation of the 2017 Annual Report of the ACPR
Key quote: All in all, the French financial system is one of the soundest in Europe.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on regulatory and supervisory aspects, rather than directly discussing interest rates or monetary policy changes. The mention of financial stability and the improvement of prudential ratios suggests a stable outlook, thus indicating a neutral stance towards policy rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the press conference, Paris, 28 May 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Financial markets - what innovations for the Paris financial centre?
Key quote: Welcome to the Banque de France. Talking about innovation in the markets at the Banque de France may seem surprising given the Bank's 218 years of history.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on financial innovation and not on monetary policy, making it unrelated to rate-setting intentions. It does not provide explicit signals about monetary policy stance, interest rates, or inflation.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bank of France conference, Paris, 25 May 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: France - economic developments and reforms, where are we heading?
Key quote: We are now following our central course of gradual normalization.
Rationale: The speech suggests a gradual approach to monetary policy normalization and emphasizes the importance of remaining accommodative for an extended period. While there is noting to aggressively raise rates, the focus on gradual normalization indicates a slight hawkishness, but not enough for immediate rate hikes. Hence, a 'Hold' is the most likely forecast at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at The Economic Club of New York, New York City, 18 April 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Green Finance - a new frontier for the 21st century
Key quote: Climate stability is, in the long run, one of the determinants of financial stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on climate change and green finance, which, while relevant to financial stability, is not directly related to immediate monetary policy actions such as interest rate changes.
description: Opening keynote by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the International climate risk conference for supervisors, Amsterdam, 6 April 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: New ideas for Europe
Key quote: If we have not armed ourselves with stronger economic instruments by that time, there is a risk that monetary policy will be overburdened.
Rationale: While the speech primarily discusses European integration and economic reform, it does touch on risks associated with future economic downturns and the burden on monetary policy. The speech doesn't directly advocate for monetary policy changes, indicating a neutral stance, hence the prediction to hold rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, Munich, 15 February 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Ethics and trust in finance
Key quote: Ethics must permeate the day-to-day practices and culture of financial institutions.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on ethics in finance and does not mention monetary policy or provide information relevant to setting interest rates. Therefore, it is not related to monetary policy decisions.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the 6th "Ethics and Trust in Finance" Global Prize ceremony, Paris, 15 January 2018.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Monitoring large and complex institutions
Key quote: Interactions between policy makers, researchers and practitioners are very valuable.
Rationale: The speech predominantly focuses on the regulatory and supervisory aspects related to financial stability and complex banking institutions, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Welcome address by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the ACPR Academic Conference, Paris, 11 December 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Economic and financial regulation in the era of big data
Key quote: I would rather like to focus on the consequences of Big Data for the economy in general and for central banks in particular.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the implications of Big Data for economic and financial regulation, rather than directly discussing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Closing remarks by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Conference on "Economic and Financial Regulation in the Era of Big Data", Paris, 24 November 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Insurance and pensions - institutional innovation, economic innovation, technological innovation
Key quote: Let's have the courage to think differently.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on insurance and pension innovation, rather than monetary policy. Consequently, the content does not provide insight into the central bank's immediate interest rate policy stance. Therefore, the speech is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the7th annual EIOPA Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 22 November 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Capitalizing on the new G20 regulatory steps
Key quote: International cooperation on financial sector regulation is our common good, and, fortunately, the Hamburg G20 Summit reaffirmed it.
Rationale: The speech focuses on regulatory steps and financial stability, not directly on monetary policy. However, the emphasis on financial stability suggests a preference for maintaining current policy rates to support systemic resilience.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Paris Europlace International Financial Forum, Paris, 12 July 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Europe's future in global capital markets
Key quote: To boost European growth, financial levers are of the essence, but economic levers play a role too.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the future of Europe in global markets, Brexit implications, and economic structural reforms rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Closing remarks by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the FESE (Federation of European Securities Exchanges) Convention "Europe's future in global capital markets", Paris, 22 June 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Banking risks, regulations and supervision
Key quote: We cannot ask banks to generate a double-digit return on equity when interest rates and the risk-free rate are so low and banks are indeed more resilient than they were.
Rationale: The speech focuses on banking regulation, financial stability, and supervision rather than directly discussing monetary policy or providing information on interest rate adjustments.
description: Introductory speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the ACPR conference, Paris, Friday 16 June 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Presentation of the 2016 Annual Report of the ACPR
Key quote: Since the turning point last autumn, however, we are witnessing a very gradual rise in nominal long-term interest rates and a 'steepening' of the yield curve.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes financial stability and the soundness of French banking and insurance sectors. While it acknowledges the continued low interest rate environment, there is mention of a gradual rise in nominal long-term interest rates, suggesting an expectation for moderate future conditions without a strong indication towards immediate policy changes.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the press conference, Paris, 29 May 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Special address on the French National Strategy for Financial Education
Key quote: I am delighted to be here with you today for this symposium on financial literacy.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on financial education and literacy rather than monetary policy, interest rates, or economic outlook. Therefore, it doesn't provide information relevant to a monetary policy stance.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the 4th OECD/GFLEC global policy research symposium to advance financial literacy "Addressing the needs of youth", Paris, 24 May 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Franco-German relations - experiences and challenges in the euro era
Key quote: My responsibility, together with the other euro area governors, is to conduct a monetary policy that is in line with the mandate assigned to us, and to make proposals to render other economic policies more efficient.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on Franco-German relations and the future of the European project, rather than directly discussing monetary policy changes or economic conditions that would influence immediate interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Europadialog, organized by the Investitions- und Strukturbank Rheinland-Pfalz (ISB), Mainz, 21 March 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Productivity - a collective enigma?
Key quote: All of which brings us back, overwhelmingly, to our four key focuses for reform: Enterprise, Education, Employment and Expenditure reduction (public sector).
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on productivity and structural economic issues rather than immediate monetary policy. Although it highlights areas for reform that could impact long-term growth and productivity, it does not directly address interest rate decisions. The neutral score reflects the lack of direct monetary policy content, leading to the prediction to 'Hold' with moderate probability due to a lack of urgency signaled for immediate rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bank of France - France Stratégie Conference, Paris, 1 February 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: France - a European powerhouse for financial service innovation
Key quote: My message is clear: we, as regulators, regard innovation as key.
Rationale: The speech mainly focuses on financial service innovation, the role of fintech, and the digital transformation of the financial industry, rather than monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the FinTech Forum, Paris, 25 January 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: What responses to terms of trade shocks in poor and vulnerable countries?
Key quote: The subject is also of major importance for central banks because the challenge here is to find how to implement appropriate counter-cyclical policies in the face of large-scale shocks that monetary policy cannot deal with either on its own or in the long run.
Rationale: The speech primarily addressed terms of trade shocks and economic challenges specific to poor and vulnerable countries, particularly in sub-Saharan Africa. It did not directly discuss monetary policy or central bank interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bank of France-FERDI (Fondation pour les Etudes et Recherches sur le Développement International) conference, Paris, 24 January 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Secular stagnation and growth measurement
Key quote: Allow me to say simply that some of the more recent comments about a 'come back of inflation', which would allegedly put the Governing Council under strain, seem greatly exaggerated.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on secular stagnation, demand issues, and growth measurement rather than directly addressing monetary policy or indicating a shift in policy stance.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Secular stagnation and growth measurement conference, organized by the Bank of France, Paris, 16 January 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Technological innovations in payments and beyond
Key quote: Innovation brings new threats for the financial system that have to be carefully dealt with.
Rationale: The speech focuses on technological innovations in payments and their implications for the financial system rather than addressing monetary policy or providing insights on interest rate decisions.
description: Opening speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Bank of France and CNPS (French Payments Committee) conference "Technological innovations in payments and beyond", Paris, 6 January 2017.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Basel III - an assessment, an outlook
Key quote: The Eurosystem's accommodative monetary policy has certainly contributed to this by fostering excess liquidity for European banks.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses regulatory reforms under Basel III and does not express a clear stance on monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at AGEFI's financial regulation meetings, Paris, 6 December 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: François Villeroy  de Galhau: Towards the insurance of tomorrow
Key quote: If the ECB had not acted to lower interest rates, we would have even lower inflation today and the deadly threat of deflation - and less growth in France and Europe.
Rationale: François Villeroy de Galhau acknowledges the challenges posed by the low interest rate environment, but also highlights its benefits, indicating no immediate need for policy change. The speech reflects a balanced assessment of the situation.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the French Prudential Supervision and Resolution Authority (Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution/ACPR), at the 8th International Insurance Conference "Towards the insurance of tomorrow", Paris, 14 October 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Recovery and resolution of CCPs
Key quote: We need robust recovery and resolution arrangements for CCPs, to preserve financial stability in all circumstances.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the role and resilience of CCPs and does not directly address monetary policy or suggest changes in interest rates.
description: Opening speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Policy conference "Recovery and resolution of CCPs", Paris, 24 June 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Financial stability in the age of digital industry
Key quote: The digitalisation of financial services is clearly a fascinating subject.
Rationale: The speech mainly focuses on the impact of digitalisation on financial stability and regulation, without clear hints about monetary policy direction or interest rates.
description: Introducing speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Paris Europlace International Financial Forum, New York City, 18 April 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: The challenge of an efficient European economic governance as a contribution to a prosperous global community
Key quote: Clearly, monetary policy cannot be a substitute for economic policy coordination or the lack of reforms.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the necessity of better European economic governance rather than changes to monetary policy. It emphasizes the need for coordination and institutional reforms rather than signaling changes in central bank policy such as interest rate adjustments. As such, the sentiment is neutral, likely leading to a 'Hold' decision on monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Emerging Markets Forum, Paris, 11 April 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Europe at a crossroads - how to achieve efficient economic governance in the euro area?
Key quote: Shifting from ideas to action has become urgent if monetary policy is not to remain the only game in town.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the limits of monetary policy and urges enhanced economic governance and fiscal coordination within the euro area, suggesting a supportive stance for maintaining accommodative monetary policy rather than tightening it. However, it does not strongly advocate for immediate monetary easing, leading to a prediction of holding rates.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, recorded for the event at Bruegel, Brussels, 22 March 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Innovation and change
Key quote: This evening, I will not speak of monetary policy, since we are in the silent period before the Governing Council meeting on Thursday.
Rationale: The speech focuses on innovation, economic growth, and financial structures rather than current or future monetary policy decisions.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Annual Exchange Conference "Innovation and change", Paris, 19 January 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Financing of Very Small Enterprises (VSEs)
Key quote: Clearly, this symposium is not just a one-off event reflecting a passing interest in a subject that's currently in the spotlight.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on financing for very small enterprises and does not delve into current monetary policy or economic conditions that would imply a change in interest rates. However, the central bank's role in supporting VSEs indirectly suggests maintaining stability, thus a neutral stance such as holding rates might be inferred.
description: Introductory speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Symposium on the Financing of Very Small Enterprises (VSEs), organised by the Bank of France in conjunction with the Federation of Approved Management Centres, Paris, 15 January 2016.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Climate change - the financial sector and pathways to 2°C
Key quote: Climate change is likely to affect the price of goods and services.
Rationale: The primary focus of the speech is on climate change and its impact on the financial sector, rather than on direct monetary policy or interest rate changes. The context indicates a measured approach without specific emphasis on altering rates, thus a default 'hold' prediction is reasonable, though the topic is not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France, at the Conference COP21, Paris, 30 November 2015.

author: François Villeroy de Galhau
title: Supervision of business practices
Key quote: Our supervision of business practices is important for the current mobilisation of the nation.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the supervision of business practices and consumer protection, emphasizing the roles of the ACPR and regulations, and does not directly address monetary policy, interest rates, or central bank policy stance.
description: Opening speech by Mr François Villeroy de Galhau, Governor of the Bank of France and Chairman of the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR), at the ACPR conference "Supervision of business practices", Paris, 20 November 2015.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Why do we need Europe?
Key quote: First and foremost, I am striving to restore price stability.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on geopolitical and European integration issues rather than specific monetary policy decisions. The mention of restoring price stability indicates an awareness of its importance and suggests a neutral stance on monetary policy, with a likelihood of holding the current rate.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Annual Summit of the Stern Stewart Institute, Elmau, 19 September 2024.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The digital euro and the protection of privacy
Key quote: The digital euro is currently in the 'preparation phase', as it is called.
Rationale: The speech is centered around the topic of the digital euro and privacy, not specifically monetary policy. However, considering the broader context of establishing new systems like CBDC, which can influence economic conditions indirectly, I predict 'Hold' due to potential caution in changing rates until the digital euro's effects are more certain.
description: Opening video address by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the International Conference on Payments and Securities Settlement – Data and Information, Eltville, 5 July 2024.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The digital euro – unifying and trustworthy
Key quote: The digital euro takes their vision forward into a digitalised world.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the initiative and potential of the digital euro rather than immediate monetary policy, with no direct implications on rate changes.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Reflections on the Eurosystem's new operational framework
Key quote: An adjustment of our operational framework was necessary to reflect structural market changes.
Rationale: Dr. Nagel's speech focuses on the Eurosystem's operational changes and their impact on market activity and volatility. He outlines the ongoing adjustments needed in the framework but does not suggest an immediate shift in monetary policy stance, suggesting a 'Hold' prediction for interest rates.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the "Konstanz Seminar on Monetary Theory and Monetary Policy", Konstanz, 16 May 2024.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Digital euro - vision, advances and challenges
Key quote: Today, many people still have only a very vague understanding of the goals and framework of the digital euro project. Therefore, we have a lot of work ahead of us convincing the public and gaining its trust.
Rationale: The speech is centered on the discussion of a digital euro, which is related to financial innovation rather than immediate monetary policy decision-making such as interest rate changes. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to the traditional hawkish-dovish spectrum.
description: Introductory remarks by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the fireside chat with Massachusetts Institute of Technology students, Cambridge, Massachusetts, 16 April 2024.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Welcome address - Farewell symposium for Claudia Buch and Joachim Wuermeling
Key quote: My advice is to recognise the potential of digitalisation - as an opportunity for greater productivity and prosperity.
Rationale: The speech is a farewell address primarily focused on digitalization, contributions of Claudia Buch and Joachim Wuermeling, and does not relate to current monetary policy or interest rates directly.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: From the Reichsbank to the Bundesbank
Key quote: Never again should government bodies like the central bank be allowed to trample on democratic values.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the historical research project on the Reichsbank and its involvement in the Nazi regime, without any substantial content on current monetary policy or economic conditions.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Stability and prosperity in Europe
Key quote: Stability, by contrast, is the core competence and mandate of the Eurosystem, and thus also of the Bundesbank: stability of prices, of credit institutions, of the financial system and of payments.
Rationale: The speech focuses on long-term structural changes and economic integration in Europe, without delving into specific monetary policy stances. The emphasis on stability and prosperity through integration suggests a neutral stance not indicative of immediate changes in interest rates.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Munich European Conference: Security and Prosperity in Europe, Munich, 15 February 2024.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The digital euro - an opportunity for Europe
Key quote: I am firmly convinced that the digital euro will be a success.
Rationale: Although the speech discusses the digital euro and its potential impact on the payments landscape, it does not focus on immediate monetary policy or interest rate decisions. The subject is largely about digital currency and its implementation, which does not directly relate to the current monetary policy stance. Hence, it is categorized as 'Not related' to traditional monetary policy discussions.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the autumn meeting of the Wildbader Kreis, Darmstadt, 6 November 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Ensuring the supply of cash – including in times of crisis
Key quote: Our task at the Deutsche Bundesbank is, and will always be, to ensure that there is always a sufficient quantity of high-quality euro cash in circulation.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the role of cash and its resilience compared to digital payments. It does not discuss monetary policy or interest rates. The default prediction for unrelated speeches would be 'Hold', and the default probability for this prediction is 0.
description: Welcome message by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the 2023 symposium "Ensuring the supply of cash – including in times of crisis", Berlin, 15 June 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Making the most of Europe's opportunities - reforms for greater prosperity and stability
Key quote: As a central banker, I have a particular interest in the capital markets union and the opportunities offered by a digital euro.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the European single market and other economic reforms rather than monetary policy. However, given the policy rate and the stable economic conditions implied, a 'Hold' prediction is reasonable.
description: Text of the DIW Europe Lecture by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the German Institute for Economic Research (DIW), Berlin, 16 February 2023.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Keynote speech - 10th anniversary of European DataWarehouse
Key quote: This is why economic transparency is referred to as a key pillar of international competitiveness.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the achievements and role of European DataWarehouse in securitization and transparency rather than discussing monetary policy or hinting at changes to interest rates.
description: Keynote speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the10th anniversary of European DataWarehouse, Frankfurt am Main, 14 November 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The benefits of diversity for central banks
Key quote: I am convinced that we benefit from diverse teams, and that our work output also improves.
Rationale: The speech's focus is on diversity, inclusion, and equality within the workforce at central banks rather than discussing monetary policy or economic conditions. Therefore, it does not provide insights or implications regarding future interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the G7 CeBaDi Diversity, Equality and Inclusion Summit 2022, Frankfurt am Main, 4 November 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Digital euro - opportunities and risks
Rationale: The speech by Dr. Joachim Nagel is focused on the implications, risks, and opportunities of introducing a digital euro and does not directly address the current stance or future direction of monetary policy such as interest rates. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related'.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Center for Financial Studies (CFS) and the Institute for Monetary and Financial Stability (IMFS) Special Lecture, Goethe University, Frankfurt am Main, 22 July 2022.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The internationalisation of the renminbi - opportunities for German industry
Key quote: The internationalisation of the renminbi has come a long way over the past few years.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the internationalization of the renminbi and its implications for German industry. It does not address monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at "Bayerischer China-Tag", Ingolstadt, 19 October 2015.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: How the Banking Union has transformed banks' IT requirements
Key quote: To achieve our common goal of making financial markets more stable, the various bank governance functions - in particular, risk management, reporting and finance - need to be much better integrated than they have been up to now.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses banking IT infrastructure in the context of regulatory compliance and the Banking Union. It does not focus on monetary policy, the policy rate, or provide indications of central bank's future policy actions related to interest rates.
description: Keynote speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the 20th Handelsblatt Annual Conference on Banking Technology, Frankfurt am Main, 3 December 2014.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Internationalisation of the renminbi - challenges and opportunities
Key quote: The renminbi has succeeded in becoming a trade currency and its use has increased rapidly over the last few years.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the internationalization of the renminbi and its implications for trade and finance, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the European-Chinese Banking Day at the Euro Finance Week, Frankfurt am Main, 17 November 2014.

author: Joachim Nagel

Rationale: The speech by Joachim Nagel focuses on structural changes in financial markets and regulatory impacts without suggesting any immediate changes to monetary policy. While there are mentions of risks and regulatory adjustments, there is a balanced view of improvements and ongoing challenges, leading to a neutral outlook with a high probability of holding rates.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the ESE (the European Supervisor Education initiative) Conference 2013 "The future of European financial supervision", Frankfurt am Main, 26 September 2013.

author: Joachim Nagel

description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Chamber of Industry and Commerce (IHK) Conference on the "Internationalisation of the Renminbi - Opportunities for Frankfurt", Frankfurt am Main, 3 July 2013.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: Launching a trading desk in Tokyo
Key quote: Expanding our presence in Tokyo reflects the importance of the Japanese financial market and the growing influence of the region in the global economy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the opening of a trading desk in Tokyo and the strategic importance of this new office for the Deutsche Bundesbank's operations. It does not address central bank monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Welcoming remarks by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the opening of the enlarged office of the Deutsche Bundesbank in Tokyo, Tokyo, 6 September 2012.

author: Joachim Nagel
title: The Bundesbank perspective on the Pfandbrief market
Key quote: The Pfandbrief is undoubtedly a winner of the financial crisis.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the Pfandbrief market and its recovery post-financial crisis, with no direct comments on interest rates or monetary policy direction. The tone doesn't suggest an imminent change in policy, leading to a 'Hold' prediction by default.
description: Speech by Dr Joachim Nagel, Member of the Executive Board of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the Tokyo Pfandbrief Investor Seminar 2011, Tokyo, 26 January 2011.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The heat is on - challenges and opportunities of the energy transition
Key quote: The energy transition is inevitable and must be managed in an orderly way.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the challenges and opportunities of the energy transition and does not directly relate to monetary policy or the decision-making process on interest rates. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: If we are not after the essence, then what are we after?
Key quote: Growth remains the key target for Italy, but in order to achieve it, we need to be determined to tackle our unresolved structural problems.
Rationale: The speech by Fabio Panetta focuses heavily on European integration, economic growth, productivity, and strategic sovereignty issues rather than on immediate monetary policy changes. The emphasis on structural reforms and strategic challenges rather than an immediate call for policy rate changes suggests a neutral stance, indicating that he would likely advocate to hold the current rate of 3.75% at the next meeting.
