author: Fabio Panetta
title: The future of Europe's economy amid geopolitical risks and global fragmentation
Key quote: As Europeans, it is in our interest to defend vigorously the progress made so far in global openness and integration.
Rationale: The speech focuses heavily on economic strategy in the face of geopolitical risks and global fragmentation, primarily suggesting long-term structural solutions rather than immediate monetary action. Panetta acknowledges economic uncertainty but does not specifically advocate for changes to the policy rate, indicating a neutral stance likely to hold interest rates stable.
description: Text of the Lectio Magistralis by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, on the occasion of the conferral of an honorary degree in Juridical Sciences in Banking and Finance by the University of Roma Tre, Rome, 23 April 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Statement - meeting of the Development Committee
Key quote: The global economy has shown remarkable resilience in the face of numerous challenges.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on development issues and the World Bank's role, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or the immediate outlook for interest rates.
description: Statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy and Governor of the Constituency of Albania, Greece, Italy, Malta, Portugal, San Marino and Timor-Leste, at the 109th Meeting of the Development Committee (Joint Ministerial Committee of the Boards of Governors of the Bank and the Fund on the Transfer of Real Resources to Developing Countries), Washington DC, 19 April 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Honouring Ignazio Visco - a life in economics
Key quote: At the risk of sounding provoking, I would like to conclude by re-quoting Kierkegaard: 'Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forwards.'
Rationale: The speech is primarily a tribute to Ignazio Visco and does not discuss specific monetary policy issues or guidance. Therefore, it is not directly related to current monetary policy decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Symposium in honour of Ignazio Visco "Hard Times": Economic Shocks and Policy Responses since the Global Financial Crisis, Rome, 12 March 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Beyond money - the euro's role in Europe's strategic future
Key quote: Finance is a means to serve society, and the euro is no exception: the single currency has objectives and implications that go far beyond the monetary sphere.
Rationale: Mr. Panetta's speech focuses on the euro's geopolitical role and its strategic future rather than directly addressing current monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the conference "Ten years with the euro", Riga, 26 January 2024.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The cost of not issuing a digital euro
Key quote: The cost of not issuing a digital euro could be significant.
Rationale: This speech focuses primarily on the exploration and potential implications of a central bank digital currency, rather than immediate monetary policy decisions like setting interest rates. It does not provide a clear indication of a stance on monetary policy such as inflation, economic growth, or interest rate changes, making it 'Not related' to direct monetary policy stances.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the Centre for Economic Policy Research (CEPR) - European Central Bank (ECB) Conference "The macroeconomic implications of central bank digital currencies", Frankfurt am Main, 23 November 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Paradise lost? How crypto failed to deliver on its promises and what to do about it
Key quote: Today I will contend that due to their limitations, cryptos have not developed into a form of finance that is innovative and robust, but have instead morphed into one that is deleterious.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the state and implications of cryptocurrencies, which is more related to financial stability than direct monetary policy. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to central banking policy or interest rate setting.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a panel on the future of crypto at the 22nd BIS Annual Conference, Basel, 23 June 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Central clearing in turbulent times - frontiers in regulation and oversight
Key quote: However, in today's turbulent market environment, all stakeholders - CCPs, clearing participants and authorities alike - must adopt a more forward-looking mindset.
Rationale: The speech focuses on central clearing and its regulatory and supervisory aspects, rather than direct monetary policy implications or central bank interest rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Fifth Joint Deutsche Bundesbank, European Central Bank and Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago Conference on CCP Risk Management, Frankfurt am Main, 22 June 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: A digital euro - widely available and easy to use
Key quote: The design of the digital euro and its regulatory framework are key to ensuring that it retains its key characteristics as a public good.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the digital euro project and does not address current monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 24 April 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The quick and the dead - building up cyber resilience in the financial sector
Key quote: Cybersecurity must be the backbone of digital finance.
Rationale: The speech is focused on cyber resilience in the financial sector and does not address monetary policy directly. However, given the context and current policy rate, the speaker would likely support holding rates, as the speech does not indicate a change in economic outlook that would impact monetary policy.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the meeting of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 8 March 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The digital euro - our money wherever, whenever we need it
Key quote: The digital euro would be a public good.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the development and conceptualization of a digital euro, which does not provide direct insights into monetary policy or interest rate changes. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to traditional monetary policy decisions. Fabio Panetta's discussion is centered around innovation and governance of digital currency rather than current economic conditions or policy rate 'decisions.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 23 January 2023.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Crypto dominos - the bursting crypto bubbles and the destiny of digital finance
Key quote: Instead, they have become the bubble of a generation.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the regulation and impact of crypto-assets and digital finance, which is not directly related to monetary policy. However, given the absence of any monetary policy statements, the default prediction is to 'Hold' with a neutral stance.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Insight Summit held at the London Business School, London, 7 December 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Greener and cheaper - could the transition away from fossil fuels generate a divine coincidence?
Key quote: I would even argue that we can reach a 'divine coincidence' between price stability and decarbonisation.
Rationale: Fabio Panetta discusses the implications of the green transition on energy prices saying it will not necessarily lead to persistent inflation. He does not provide a strong leaning towards altering interest rates in response to the current situation.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Italian Banking Association, Rome, 16 November 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Investing in Europe's future - the case for a rethink
Key quote: The energy crisis and Russia's aggression against Ukraine have made it even clearer that Europe needs to reinvest in its own future if it wants to keep control of its destiny.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the need for higher public investment in Europe and its implications on fiscal policy, rather than signaling a change in monetary policy stance. There is no direct commentary on interest rates, suggesting a neutral stance with no immediate inclination to adjust rates.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Institute for International Political Studies (ISPI), Milan, 11 November 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Building on our strengths - the role of the public and private sectors in the digital euro ecosystem
Key quote: A well-designed digital euro would bring benefits for everyone.
Rationale: The speech primarily concerns the digital euro and its digital ecosystem, which is less directly related to immediate monetary policy adjustments such as interest rate changes.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 29 September 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Demystifying wholesale central bank digital currency
Key quote: Our goal will always be the same: ensuring that central bank money remains the anchor of stability of the monetary system.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the technical aspects and future planning related to the implementation of central bank digital currencies and infrastructure, without mentioning changes to monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Symposium on "Payments and securities settlement in Europe – today and tomorrow", hosted by the Deutsche Bundesbank, Frankfurt am Main, 26 September 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The digital euro and the evolution of the financial system
Key quote: I am pleased to join you here today to discuss the progress we have made in our digital euro project.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the digital euro and its implications for financial stability, rather than directly addressing current monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 15 June 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The European Central Bank's 2022 Convergence Report
Key quote: The convergence assessments by the Commission and the ECB are paving the way for another euro area enlargement.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the convergence report and euro accession, with a neutral tone on monetary policy outlook. There's no specific indication of immediate policy changes or rate adjustments.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the meeting of the Euro Accession Countries Working Group of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 1 June 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Public money for the digital era - towards a digital euro
Key quote: Today I will argue that to preserve this symbiosis, public money must keep its role as a monetary anchor in the digital era.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the concept of a digital euro and the importance of maintaining public money in the digital era. It does not address current monetary policy, inflation, or direct interest rate decisions, rendering it not directly related to monetary policy changes.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the National College of Ireland, Dublin, 16 May 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: For a few cryptos more - the wild west of crypto finance

author: Fabio Panetta
title: More than an intellectual game - exploring the monetary policy and financial stability implications of central bank digital currencies
Key quote: Issuing CBDCs is likely to become a necessity to preserve access to public money in an increasingly digital economy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on exploring the implications of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) on monetary policy and financial stability without indicating any immediate monetary policy change in response to inflation or economic activity. Fabio Panetta emphasizes careful design to manage any unintended consequences, suggesting a neutral stance toward existing monetary policy actions.
description: Opening speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the IESE Business School Banking Initiative Conference on Technology and Finance, Frankfurt am Main, 8 April 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: A digital euro that serves the needs of the public - striking the right balance
Key quote: The primary aim of a digital euro is to maintain the accessibility and usability of central bank money in an increasingly digitalised economy.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the development and considerations of a digital euro, rather than directly on monetary policy and current economic conditions that would influence immediate interest rate decisions.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Building a robust and diversified clearing ecosystem
Key quote: The global clearing ecosystem could benefit from more clearing options and alternatives to ensure banks and the real economy have continuous access to safe and efficient clearing solutions.
Rationale: The speech by Fabio Panetta primarily focuses on the resilience and evolution of the clearing ecosystem, CCP risk management, and regulatory frameworks rather than explicitly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Fourth Annual Joint Conference of the Deutsche Bundesbank, European Central Bank and Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago on CCP Risk Management, Frankfurt am Main, 22 March 2022.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Cash still king in times of Covid-19
Key quote: Cash continues to play a crucial role in the euro area, and there is still demand for it.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on the role and future of cash in the digital economy and does not address monetary policy or interest rate decisions directly.

author: Fabio Panetta

author: Fabio Panetta
title: A digital euro to meet the expectations of Europeans
Key quote: A digital euro can only be successful if it meets the needs and expectations of European citizens.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the potential introduction and features of a digital euro, focusing on privacy, security, and usability aspects rather than current monetary policy considerations.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECON Committee of the European Parliament, Frankfurt am Main, 14 April 2021.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Central clearing and the changing landscape
Key quote: Assessing potential vulnerabilities in the light of current challenges is key to making financial markets and infrastructures more resilient.
Rationale: The speech by Fabio Panetta focuses on central clearing and financial infrastructure resilience, without touching upon monetary policy or providing insight into interest rate decisions. Therefore, it does not pertain to monetary policy.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Evolution or revolution? The impact of a digital euro on the financial system
Key quote: A digital euro represents a natural evolution in response to this transformation - not only to underpin efficiency and innovation, but also to preserve the role of the central bank in offering safe means of payment.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the potential impacts and design considerations of a digital euro rather than addressing immediate monetary policy such as interest rates or inflation.
description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a Bruegel online seminar, Frankfurt am Main, 10 February 2021.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Sustainable finance- transforming finance to finance the transformation
Key quote: The ECB has started to reflect on how it can contribute to responsible development.
Rationale: The speech by Fabio Panetta focuses on sustainable finance and climate-related risks, related to long-term transformation rather than any immediate changes to monetary policy or interest rates.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Keeping cyber risk at bay - our individual and joint responsibility
Key quote: Cyber resilience is not a state, it is an ever-shifting aspiration.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: From the payments revolution to the reinvention of money
Key quote: Our policies provide a forceful policy reaction to the digital shock.

The main themes are around digital transformation and the implications for financial systems, rather than interest rate policy or inflation targeting.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The two sides of the (stable)coin
Key quote: Global stablecoins are an expression of the need for change.

description: Speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at Il Salone dei Pagamenti 2020, Frankfurt am Main, 4 November 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: On the edge of a new frontier - European payments in the digital age
Key quote: Central banks have a key stake in the digital transition of payments and are adapting their policies to ensure that payments remain resilient, efficient and inclusive.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the evolving payment landscape and strategic initiatives rather than immediate monetary policy actions, hence it doesn't fit traditional categories of hawkish or dovish. However, given the focus on structural issues rather than immediate monetary policy changes, it leans towards a prediction of 'Hold' for the next interest rate meeting.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: A digital euro for the digital era
Key quote: Issuing a digital euro would be relevant for almost everything the ECB does.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the concept of a digital euro and its implications rather than on immediate monetary policy actions or changes to interest rates.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECON Committee of the European Parliament, Frankfurt am Main, 12 October 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Pursuing a successful path towards euro area accession
Key quote: Ensuring a sustainable convergence path
Rationale: The speech focuses on the euro accession process for Bulgaria and Croatia, rather than discussing future monetary policy actions, inflation, or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a meeting of the Euro Accession Countries Working Group of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Frankfurt am Main, 13 July 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Why we all need a joint European fiscal response
Key quote: A strong, symmetric fiscal response that offsets the economic damage from the pandemic is in the economic interest of all countries in the eurozone.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for a strong fiscal response to the economic challenges posed by the coronavirus pandemic, suggesting coordinated fiscal policy rather than stressing monetary tightening. Thus, it leans towards a somewhat dovish stance, advocating holding rates to support the economy amid fiscal policy discussions.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Protecting the European financial sector - the Cyber Information and Intelligence Sharing Initiative
Key quote: Cyber risk is a danger which has the potential to trigger a systemic crisis.
Rationale: The speech focuses on cyber resilience and security for financial infrastructures and does not discuss monetary policy, interest rates, or economic conditions that would influence central bank rate decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the fourth meeting of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 27 February 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Joining forces - stepping up coordination on risks in central clearing
Key quote: Effective coordination among banks, CCPs and public authorities is necessary to manage risks in central clearing.
Rationale: The speech focuses on risk management in central clearing and does not discuss any changes to monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Second Joint Bundesbank/European Central Bank/Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago Conference on CCP Risk Management, Frankfurt am Main, 26 February 2020.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Institutional investors' asset allocation and the real economy

author: Fabio Panetta

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Fintech and banking - today and tomorrow
Key quote: Not applicable

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Harnessing big data &amp; machine learning technologies for central banks
Key quote: Central banks could, and definitely should, play an active role in exploiting digital technologies and the enormous amount of data they generate.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the role of Big Data and machine learning technologies for central banks without any discussion on current monetary policy, inflation targets, or interest rates. Therefore, the speech is not related to monetary policy.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the workshop on "Harnessing Big Data &amp; Machine Learning Technologies for Central Banks", Bank of Italy, Rome, 26 March 2018.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Cyber security - the balance between cooperation and regulation
Key quote: Digital innovation and cyber security are two faces of the same coin and so cannot be addressed separately.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on cyber security in the context of digital transformation and does not address monetary policy, interest rates, or economic conditions that typically influence rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the joint ECB and Bank of Italy conference "Digital transformation of the retail payments ecosystem", Rome, 1 December 2017.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: "Ever Closer Union" - The legacy of the Treaties of Rome for today's Europe
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on European integration, the legacy of the Treaties of Rome, and the challenges and future of the European Union, rather than specific monetary policy actions or signals regarding interest rate changes.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the travelling exhibition on the "Occasion of the 60th Anniversary of the Treaties of Rome", organized by the Historical Archives of the European Union, European University Institute, held at the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 21 March 2017.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Micro and macroprudential supervision in the euro area
Key quote: Ensuring consistency between micro- and macro-prudential policies - and, based on what I have just said, monetary policy as well - is absolutely necessary to support the economic recovery.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the integration of micro and macroprudential supervision without explicit remarks on changing the central bank's monetary policy stance, suggesting a neutral position. The emphasis on coordination in existing frameworks suggests a hold on further monetary policy actions.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at the conference "Micro and Macroprudential Supervision in the Euro Area", Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore, Milan, 24 November 2015.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: The European Banking and Capital Markets Unions - challenges and risks
Key quote: Banking Union, together with other national and European policies - in particular, the monetary policy measures recently decided by the Governing Council of the ECB - is already contributing to the normalization in credit conditions for firms and households.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses structural financial reforms rather than focused monetary policy stances. While it emphasizes the importance of measures taken, it doesn't strongly advocate for immediate policy rate changes, suggesting a balance between macroprudential and microprudential approaches, aligning with a 'Hold' stance on monetary policy.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Italy, at a conference organized by the Fondazione Italianieuropei and the Foundation for European Progressive Studies, Rome, 6 February 2015.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: On the special role of macroprudential policy in the euro
Key quote: The euro area is not in good shape: inflation is too low, growth is weak, MP is stretched and affected by financial segmentation, banks' balance sheets are still strained, credit is scarce.
Rationale: Fabio Panetta's speech focuses on the role of macroprudential policy rather than on immediate monetary policy actions. The emphasis on the euro area's economic condition suggests a balanced approach is necessary, listening to both sides, which indicates a neutral stance. The discussion about financial stability and credit conditions supports a 'Hold' prediction.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: SEPA and its repercussions for Italy's payment system
Key quote: SEPA plays a key role in the completion of the European financial system, by ensuring the provision of innovative, reliable and affordable payment services to market players and users.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the SEPA payment system and its importance for the financial system and economic integration, without directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Welcoming address by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Director General of the Bank of Italy, at the SEPA Conference, organized by the Bank of Italy, Rome, 9 December 2013.

author: Fabio Panetta
title: Macroprudential tools - where do we stand?
Key quote: The unusually expansionary stance of monetary policy in the major regions is putting pressure on asset prices and, in a context of weak economic activity and low inflation, may soon require appropriate macroprudential measures.
Rationale: The speech focuses on macroprudential policy and acknowledges the pressure from expansionary monetary policy on asset prices, but stops short of indicating any change in monetary policy. This suggests a neutral stance towards the current policy rate.
description: Remarks by Mr Fabio Panetta, Deputy Director General of the Bank of Italy, during the presentation of the 2013 Financial Stability Review, Central Bank of Luxembourg, Luxembourg, 14 May 2013.

author: Klaas Knot
title: On flood management and financial stability
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on financial stability and systemic risk management in the non-bank financial intermediation sector, with little to no direct mention of monetary policy or interest rate decisions. It emphasizes regulation and risk mitigation rather than monetary policy adjustments.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum, Budapest, 13 September 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Acta, non verba - interlinking fast payment systems to enhance cross-border payments
Key quote: The G20 Roadmap to enhance cross-border payments are not immediate and easy tasks.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the G20 roadmap for enhancing cross-border payments and does not explicitly discuss monetary policy or interest rates, thus it is categorized as 'Not related'.

author: Klaas Knot
title: A solid foundation for a resilient structure
Key quote: It is critical to finalise and implement international reforms to enhance NBFI resilience.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses macroprudential measures and financial stability within the non-bank financial intermediation (NBFI) sector, rather than directly discussing immediate monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, Chair of the Financial Stability Board and President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Central Bank of Ireland's Macroprudential Policy for Investment Funds Conference, Dublin, 20 May 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Financial stability risks and the FSB's work program
Key quote: All in all, the outlook is improving but we clearly have no space for complacency.
Rationale: While the speech addresses potential financial stability risks and vulnerabilities, it does not directly discuss or signal intentions regarding short-term monetary policy changes. The tone suggests awareness of risks but also acknowledges improvements, likely indicating a neutral stance on immediate rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, Chair of the Financial Stability Board and President of De Nederlandsche Bank, at the CFA Institute Systemic Risk Council, Washington DC, 26 April 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Public money - keeping up with the times
Key quote: Why do we need a central bank digital currency? To keep up with society. To pursue strategic autonomy. And to maintain access to public money in a digital world.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) without directly addressing current monetary policy or interest rate decisions. However, it suggests maintaining status quo to assess implications of digital currency.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, to the European House-Ambrosetti's panel on "Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs): The Future of Money", Cernobbio, 5 April 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Open finance regimes – experiences in some countries
Key quote: Open finance frameworks offer tangible opportunities for people who have difficulty in accessing financial services, but we need to calibrate them carefully to make sure that open finance will be a force for good.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses open finance and financial inclusion, which are separate from direct monetary policy issues, such as interest rates. Therefore, it does not indicate a stance that would influence a rate decision.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Bank for International Settlements High Level Roundtable on Financial Inclusion, Basel, 12 March 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The need for regulating crypto-assets - a global effort
Key quote: The crypto ecosystem is at a major cross-roads. We cannot presume that this innovation, and potentially more decentralization, will bring significant benefits to the global financial system.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the regulation of crypto-assets and their impact on the financial system, rather than monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech (virtually) by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank and Chair of the Financial Stability Board, at the Asia Securities Industry & Financial Markets Association (ASIFMA) Annual Conference, Hong Kong, 29 February 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Free trade and financial stability, containing the effects of geopolitical fragmentation
Key quote: From an economic viewpoint, an increase in geo-economic fragmentation can be seen as a negative supply shock. Such a shock has a downward effect on economic growth and an upward effect on inflation through increasing trade costs.
Rationale: The speech is focused on geopolitical fragmentation and its economic implications rather than direct monetary policy actions. By describing economic challenges like potential inflationary pressures and growth impacts, it indirectly supports a neutral stance, considering both downward and upward risks without explicit inclination towards changing rates.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Eurofi High Level Seminar, Ghent, 23 February 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Step by step towards a sustainable future
Key quote: Central banks can help you take these steps. We can help to shape the transition to sustainable economic development.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on sustainable finance and the role of central banks in fostering sustainable economic growth rather than on monetary policy or interest rate direction.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank and chair of Financial Stability Board, at a lunch of the Curaçao Business Association on the importance of sustainable green finance, Curaçao, 15 February 2024.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Introductory remarks - ECB Fifth Macroprudential Policy and Research conference
Key quote: I have little time to cover a fascinating and complex topic, so let me focus on just a few high level issues regarding the effective use and the challenges of macro-prudential policy.
Rationale: The speech focuses exclusively on macro-prudential policy, which is separate from monetary policy and interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is not related to monetary policy.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the European Central Bank fifth Macroprudential Policy and Research conference, jointly organised with the International Monetary Fund, Frankfurt am Main, 17 October 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Banks going bankrupt
Key quote: At the current juncture, with interest rates having gone up - while justified to keep inflation in check - the risk of accidents is increasing.
Rationale: Klaas Knot recognizes the necessity of high interest rates to control inflation but acknowledges the associated financial stability risks, indicating a cautious approach. This suggests a preference for keeping rates steady while assessing the impact of existing hikes.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Flairs conference, Amsterdam, 29 September 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Lessons from Mount Everest - acting now to curb nature-related financial risks
Key quote: It's an illusion to think we can preserve financial stability if this degradation continues.
Rationale: The speech focuses on nature-related financial risks and does not mention monetary policy or interest rate decisions, hence it is not directly related to the central bank policy stance.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Launch Event of the NGFS Conceptual Framework on nature-related financial risks, Paris, 7 September 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: What can central banks do to help save our planet?
Key quote: What can central banks do to help save our planet?
Rationale: The speech focuses on climate risks and sustainability, discussing the potential role of central banks in addressing these issues, rather than traditional monetary policy topics such as inflation, interest rates, or economic growth. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.
description: Opening speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Climate Risk Conference, organised by the National Bank of Slovakia, Bratislava, 7 February 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Daring to know in times of uncertainty and structural shifts
Key quote: Although this outlook is challenging, so far the global banking system has shown itself to be resilient.
Rationale: The speech discusses systemic risks and resilience in the financial system but does not provide explicit guidance on monetary policy direction. The emphasis on global financial stability over direct monetary policy suggests a neutral stance likely resulting in a 'Hold' decision at the next meeting.
description: Speech (virtually) by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank and Chair of the Financial Stability Board, at the 11th ILF Conference on the Future of the Financial Sector "The Next Systemic Financial Crisis – Where Might it Come From?": Financial Stability in a Polycrisis World, at the Goethe University's Law and Finance Institute, Frankfurt am Main, 24 January 2023.

author: Klaas Knot
title: To quagga or not to quagga? Time to restore the balance
Key quote: The financial sector has an enormous stake and therefore a crucial role to play in the prevention of biodiversity loss.
Rationale: The speech focuses on biodiversity loss and the role of the financial sector in addressing it, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it is not directly related to central bank rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Netherlands Bank/Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum conference on "Moving beyond climate: integrating biodiversity into financial markets", Amsterdam, 29 September 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Working on progress. On public and private risk sharing in the EMU
Key quote: So for me, as an economist, too long a standstill is not an option. We must go forward. And, whatever way you look at it, going forward means, at least partly, increasing risk sharing.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the structural and political evolution of the Economic and Monetary Union and does not directly address immediate monetary policy actions. Therefore, it is categorized as Neutral with a prediction to hold rates, reflecting stability rather than immediate economic action.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, on the thirtieth birthday of the Maastricht Treaty, at the conference "Euro at 20: shifting paradigms?", Maastricht, 27 September 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Keti Koti 2022 marks turning point for the Netherlands Bank
Key quote: Today, on behalf of De Nederlandsche Bank, I apologise.
Rationale: The speech is focused on a historical apology related to the past actions of De Nederlandsche Bank and does not address monetary policy or contain any implications for future interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Keti Koti - the annual celebration and commemoration of the abolition of slavery, Amsterdam, 1 July 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Macroprudential supervision - what's in a name?
Key quote: The current macroprudential framework is not yet complete and effective to address all the different systemic risks within the financial system.
Rationale: The speech by Klaas Knot primarily focuses on macroprudential supervision and does not deal directly with monetary policy or interest rates, which is why it is categorized as 'Not related'.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the DNB-Riksbank-Bundesbank Macroprudential Conference, Santpoort, 20 June 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Propelling a graceful transition - the role of the financial system
Key quote: The financial sector must play its part, both to help meet net zero targets and to manage the financial risks from climate change.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the role of the financial sector in achieving net-zero targets and addressing climate-related financial risks, without direct reference to the central bank's monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech (virtual) by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank and Chair of the Financial Stability Board, at the Green Swan Conference, 1 June 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: A global Europe to meet global financial stability challenges
Key quote: The job of the FSB here is to monitor and analyze developments closely and facilitate global coordination of policies, where necessary, to minimize the risk of a disorderly exit.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial stability and the coordination of international policies, with some caution regarding financial vulnerabilities and inflation but no direct emphasis on changing interest rates. The balanced discussion on unwinding pandemic support suggests a neutral stance, leading to a prediction of holding rates at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President to the Netherlands Bank and Chair of the Financial Stability Board, at the EUROFI High Level Seminar 2022, Paris, 25 February 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The road ahead - lifting barriers for cross-border payments
Key quote: Enhancing cross-border payments is a shared global goal.
Rationale: The speech by Klaas Knot focuses on the enhancements needed for cross-border payments, without discussing central bank monetary policy or interest rate changes. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy. However, given the policy rate and general context, a 'Hold' prediction at the interest rate meeting is considered slightly more probable.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Navigating change in the global financial system - the role of the Financial Stability Board
Key quote: A big challenge for policy makers worldwide at this moment is navigating their economies out of the Covid pandemic.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial stability, digital innovation, and climate risks rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the G20 meeting of Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors, Jakarta, 17 February 2022.

author: Klaas Knot
title: On payment trends - opportunities and risks
Key quote: But - there is a big sine qua non. For us, as supervisors and central bankers, trust goes hand in hand with rules, regulation and supervision.
Rationale: The speech focuses on payment trends, regulation, and technological innovation in the financial sector rather than discussing traditional monetary policy, inflation, or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 13th Conference on Payments and Market Infrastructure, jointly organised by the National Bank of North Macedonia and the Netherlands Bank, Ohrid (digitally), 9 December 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Rebuilding resilience - the financial system after the Covid crisis
Key quote: First and foremost, the bold policy response by governments, central banks and supervisors, helped maintain global financial stability and sustain the supply of credit to the economy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on systemic risk and financial resilience, highlighting the successes of past reforms and the need for continued vigilance. There are no specific comments suggesting a shift in monetary policy stance (either easing or tightening), so a 'Neutral' label, holding the current policy rate, is most appropriate.
description: Keynote address by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, before the International Symposium of the National Association for Business Economics, 11 May 2021.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Getting the Green Deal done – how to mobilize sustainable finance
Key quote: And that is exactly why the best economic response to the COVID crisis is to start implementing the Green Deal as soon as possible.
Rationale: The speech predominantly focuses on mobilizing sustainable finance for the Green Deal, addressing climate change, and the role of finance in the transition to a carbon-neutral economy. It is not directly related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions.

author: Klaas Knot
title: On the right track - why is the Capital Markets Union important and how do we get there
Key quote: The Capital Markets Union is key to a more resilient European economy.

description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank (DNB), at the OMFIF-DNB Conference "Developing European Capital Markets", online, 3 November 2020.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The value of the LEI for Identification in digital processes

Rationale: The speech by Klaas Knot focuses on the value of Legal Entity Identifiers (LEIs) in financial systems and their impact on financial risk management, without any direct reference to current monetary policy or interest rates. As such, it is classified as 'Not related' to monetary policy.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Interests and alliances
Rationale: The speech focuses on the EU-UK relationship post-Brexit rather than specific monetary policy actions or central bank interest rate changes.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Risks and benefits of modern financial technology; Lessons from a 17th century stablecoin
Key quote: Whether we are dealing with deposits of bullion in the seventeenth century, or the rise of stablecoins in the twenty-first century, all forms of financial innovation pose risks and benefits.
Rationale: The speech by Klaas Knot primarily discusses financial technology and historical innovations in finance, rather than focusing on current monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy direction or interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the RiskMinds International seminar - day I: The Risk Regulation Summit, Amsterdam, 2 December 2019.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Progress on the resolvability of GSIBs - the FSB perspective
Key quote: When looking at the progress made on bank resolvability, I can say that from an FSB perspective the glass is half full and that I remain optimistic.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Mortgage interest tax deduction in the Netherlands - a welcome relief
Key quote: As president of the Dutch Central Bank I will therefore keep stressing that additional reforms are needed.
Rationale: The speech by Klaas Knot focuses on real estate taxation and macroprudential policy, not monetary policy directly, thus it's categorized as 'Not related'. However, it suggests a balanced view on policy tools that could imply a 'Hold' stance if monetary policy were considered.

author: Klaas Knot

author: Klaas Knot
title: Rethinking financial stability; evaluating regulatory prime concerns a decade on from the financial crisis

author: Klaas Knot
title: The evolution of power of blockchain - a central banker's balancing act
Key quote: Central banks and regulators need to find the right balance between seizing the benefits of technological innovation on one hand, and coping with possible new risks on the other.
Rationale: Although the speech mentions financial stability and systemic risks, it focuses on blockchain and cryptos rather than on specific monetary policy decisions or perspectives. Hence, it is categorized as 'Not related'.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the EBF Conference "The Evolution of Power", Groningen, 5 October 2018.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Hot property - the housing market in major cities
Key quote: As a central banker with a financial stability mandate, these housing market developments pose new challenges for risk analysis and possible policy responses.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on the housing market and its effects on economic wellbeing, but it does not explicitly discuss monetary policy or provide any indication on interest rate decisions.
description: Introduction speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the DNB High-Level Seminar, Amsterdam, 24 May 2018.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Supervision and green finance?
Key quote: Financial stability is a necessary precondition which allows the societies we serve to increase its living standards and prosperity.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the topic of climate-related risks and sustainability within the financial system, not directly commenting on monetary policy stances or interest rate adjustments.
description: Opening speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the first International Climate Risk Conference for Supervisors, Amsterdam, 6 April 2018.

author: Klaas Knot
title: From mission to supervision
Key quote: One thing should be clear though: sustainability factors, and climate issues in particular, can affect the solidity of financial institutions, and therefore warrant the consideration of banks and supervisors alike.
Rationale: The speech focuses on sustainability and its integration within banking supervision, without directly discussing monetary policy or implications for interest rates.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the Bundesbank Symposium "Banking Supervision in dialogue", Frankfurt am Main, 7 March 2018.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Investment and investment finance in Europe
Key quote: Investment is a key driver of future economic growth, and is therefore vital to the continuing recovery of the European economy.
Rationale: The speech addresses investment issues without indicating any change in monetary policy stance. It discusses why investment growth is subdued and suggests high public debt calls for caution, aligning with a neutral policy stance rather than a direct call for monetary easing or tightening.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the European Investment Bank's Annual Economics Conference "Investment and Investment Finance", Luxembourg, 23 November 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Drivers of European payments integration - innovation and cooperation
Key quote: Payment integration clearly contributes to greater efficiency and economic growth.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on the topics of European payments integration, innovation, and cooperation, without directly addressing monetary policy or indicating a stance on interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at the 10th jubilee edition of the National Bank of the Republic of Macedonia's Conference on Payments and Market Infrastructures "Drivers of European Payment Integration - Innovations and Cooperation", Ohrid, Macedonia, 7 July 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: The need for high quality data in banking supervision and regulation

author: Klaas Knot

description: Keynote speech by Mr Klaas Knot, President of the Netherlands Bank, at a seminar entitled "Tomorrow's banking and how central banks have developed in last 15 Years", organized by the Bank of Finland, Helsinki, 16 January 2017.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Innovation in finance makes Africa work!

author: Klaas Knot

Key quote: De Nederlandse Bank is eager to play a catalysing role and use its instruments to promote sustainability.

author: Klaas Knot
title: How Capital Markets Union can bolster Monetary Union
Key quote: Capital Markets Union can also greatly increase the efficacy of monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the structural benefits of the Capital Markets Union for monetary policy rather than indicating any immediate action on rates. The tone suggests a balanced view on long-term benefits rather than changes in current monetary policy, suggesting a hold stance at the next meeting.

author: Klaas Knot

Given the emphasis on lessons from the crisis and financial stability, it suggests a balanced approach without clear dovish or hawkish leanings, leading to a hold stance.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Financial stability through transparent reporting
Key quote: Transparent reporting of expected and unexpected losses contributes to financial stability.
Rationale: The speech by Mr. Klaas Knot at an accounting standards conference focuses on financial stability through transparent reporting and accounting practices. It does not address monetary policy, interest rates, or the economic outlook directly and thus is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.

author: Klaas Knot
title: Can intensive regulation and MSME financing coincide?

Without clear indications of needing looser or tighter monetary policy, a neutral stance with a prediction to hold rates is warranted.

Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on international policy coordination and global economic issues, rather than addressing specific monetary policy or central bank interest rate decisions. However, given the general tone of concern over public finance stress and financial stability, a neutral impact on rate decisions is hypothesized, albeit with a low likelihood of directly influencing rates.

Key quote: The success and impact of the Bretton Woods Institutions cannot be overestimated, and their role is becoming more important than ever in a world facing global power shifts, wars, geopolitical threats and profound challenges such as climate change and digital transformation.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the history and significance of the Bretton Woods Institutions and Austria's long-standing relationship with them. It does not directly address current monetary policy, interest rates, or economic conditions in Austria. Therefore, the speech is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.
description: Dinner speech by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Oesterreichische Nationalbank, the Austrian central bank, at the Oesterreichische Nationalbank Conference "Bretton Woods @80 and Austria's IMF Membership @75", Vienna, 4 March 2024.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: Economic and monetary policy under wartime conditions - implications for CESEE
Key quote: Central banks in advanced economies are faced with an unpleasant trade-off between high inflation and low growth.
Rationale: The speech discusses ongoing high inflation and economic growth challenges without advocating for a change in policy direction. It suggests a balance between addressing inflation and supporting economic growth amidst geopolitical tensions.
description: Welcome remarks by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Oesterreichische Nationalbank, the Austrian central bank, at the Conference on European Economic Integration (CEEI) 2022, Vienna, 21 November 2022.

author: Robert Holzmann

Key quote: Why is climate change relevant for central banks? The simple answer is, because climate change affects our targets - foremost price stability, but also financial stability and other economic objectives.

Rationale: The speech is an introduction to a lecture on globalization and the impact of pandemics, focusing on trade and supply chains. It does not directly address monetary policy or provide insights into the speaker's views on interest rates, which makes the topic unrelated to immediate monetary policy decisions.
description: Introduction by Dr Robert Holzmann, Governor of the Central Bank of the Republic of Austria, of Professor Pol Antràs, Global Economy Lecture 2020, Vienna, 26 November 2020.

author: Robert Holzmann
title: CESEE in the COVID-19 crisis – the role of the EU and global spillovers
Key quote: The ECB's monetary policy has been hugely supportive, and its effects extend beyond the euro area.

author: Claudia Buch
title: Digital finance - does it change the trade-off between risk and resilience?

Key quote: The European banking sector has coped well with the shocks of the recent past, but faces new risks in a changing external environment.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on ECB Banking Supervision priorities, banking sector resilience, and the completion of the banking union rather than on monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory statement by Prof Claudia Buch, Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Parliament's Economic and Monetary Affairs Committee, Brussels, 21 March 2024.

author: Claudia Buch
title: European banking supervision a decade on - safeguarding banks' resilience amid global challenges
Key quote: Ensuring that the banks remain resilient is thus the central objective of European banking supervision.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on supervisory aspects rather than specific monetary policy direction. It mentions the resilience of banks and adaptation to new risks, without indicating a change in monetary policy stance, which suggests a neutral position likely supporting a 'Hold' on interest rates.
description: Speech by Prof Claudia Buch, Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the House of the Euro, Brussels, 12 February 2024.

author: Claudia Buch
title: Introductory statement - public hearing at the European Parliament concerning the position of Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank
Key quote: My first priority as Chair would be to adapt the SSM to the changing environment.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on Claudia Buch's qualifications and vision for her role as Chair of the Supervisory Board of the ECB, with an emphasis on banking supervision rather than monetary policy. Therefore, it is not directly relevant to central bank interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory statement by Prof Claudia Buch, Deputy President of the Deutsche Bundesbank, at the public hearing at the European Parliament concerning the position of Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, Brussels, 20 September 2023.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Financial stability in the world of geopolitical fragmentation and rapid technological change
Key quote: Meanwhile, I will not even touch upon monetary policy, as we have just started the ECB's silent period a few hours ago.
Rationale: The speech explicitly states that monetary policy will not be addressed, focusing instead on financial stability, geopolitical issues, and systemic risks.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the 2023 RiskLab-BoF-ESRB Conference on Systemic Risk Analytics, organised by the RiskLab (at Arcada), the Bank of Finland and the European Systemic Risk Board, Helsinki, 8 June 2023.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Preparing the economy and financial system for hybrid war - Finland's experience
Key quote: It is imperative that we heed the lessons of Russia's aggression and its war in Ukraine, especially in the energy and financial sectors.
Rationale: The speech discusses Finland's preparedness and resilience in the context of hybrid warfare and geopolitical tensions, without specifically addressing monetary policy or central bank rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Peterson Institute for International Economics (PIIE) Financial Statements web event series, 11 January 2023.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Globalization has not been cancelled – and its analysis is essential
Key quote: Our analysis clearly shows that globalization has not been cancelled.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on globalization, international cooperation, and the history and role of BOFIT, without specific references to current monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at Bank of Finland Institute for Emerging Economies' (BOFIT) 30th Anniversary Conference, Helsinki, 9 November 2021.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Going digital – trends in payments during and after the pandemic
Key quote: We concluded that under these circumstances it is essential to build a sufficient inflation buffer.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses trends in digital payments, infrastructure, and related technological advancements rather than direct commentary on monetary policy stances. Although there is a mention of the revised monetary policy framework, the focus does not center around a policy decision or indication towards interest rates adjustment.
description: Opening by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, of the 10th Economics of Payments conference "Going digital – trends in payments during and after the pandemic", 20 October 2021.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Fiscal statistics and fiscal rules - some lessons from recent years
Key quote: The monetary union needs fiscal rules. It needs rules that reinforce countercyclical policy and fiscal sustainability.
Rationale: The speech is not focused on monetary policy but rather on fiscal rules and their implications for economic stability. Given the content, it's not directly related to central bank policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the high-level seminar "Building Trust - the Role of Supreme Audit Institutions in Ensuring the Reliability of Fiscal Data", organised by the National Audit Office of Finland Helsinki, 28 November 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Making the best out of second-best climate policies
Key quote: While the responsibility for climate policy lies with governments, central banks and financial supervisors are working actively to support progress.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses climate policy, sustainable finance, and the role of the European Union in achieving climate goals. It does not focus on or provide insight into monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland and the Finnish Ministry of Finance conference "Greener Finance for Sustainable Future", Helsinki, 30 October 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Which economic and financial priorities for fostering growth and innovation in the EU?
Key quote: As we are on the ECB's silent period, I will not comment on - or even touch - monetary policy.
Rationale: Despite mentioning economic conditions and uncertainties, Olli Rehn explicitly refrains from commenting on monetary policy. The speech focuses on broader economic issues and structural reforms, not providing direct guidance on interest rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Eurofi Financial Forum 2019, Helsinki, 11 September 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Technological upheaval and labour markets
Key quote: Policy choices do matter, and in order to make right choices from the public policy standpoint - I am thinking of high level of employment and sustained, inclusive growth of real incomes - we need solid evidence-based analysis.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the impact of technological changes on labor markets rather than monetary policy, interest rates, or central banking.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the Bank of Finland Seminar on "Technological Upheaval and Labour Markets", Helsinki, 2 September 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Building an enabling environment for circular businesses
Key quote: I want to encourage us all to recognize the urgency of concrete climate action, and build a timely and consistent transition path to the sustainable circular economy.
Rationale: The speech by Olli Rehn focuses on the circular economy and climate action, rather than monetary policy or central bank interest rates, so it's not directly related to monetary policy discussions.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the World Circular Economy Forum, Helsinki, 3 June 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Living with populism - reflections on the economy and democracy in Europe
Key quote: In economic policy, it needs to be asked whether a more even balance between monetary and fiscal policy stances would be desirable in order to sustain the growth momentum.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the rise of populism and its societal impacts, with limited direct reference to monetary policy. However, given the brief mention of fiscal and monetary policy balance, the speaker might support holding the interest rate given the current context.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at "Waiting for Populism? Problems of Interpretation and Policy Issues: Four Lectures and a Conversation", Central Bank of Malta, Valletta, 9 May 2019.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Don't delay Eurozone reform due to political uncertainties
Key quote: Political fortunes in the member states of the European Union have been quite cyclical recently. This should not delay the euro area reform that is necessary to reinforce the institutional foundations of the single currency.
Rationale: The speech by Olli Rehn is focused on the necessity for Eurozone reform and addresses political and economic stability without indicating an immediate need for monetary policy change. The importance placed on systemic weaknesses suggests a cautious approach, likely leading to holding the current policy rates.
description: Remarks by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, distributed in writing (as he was unable to attend the event) for the visit of the EU Heads of Mission to the Bank of Finland, Helsinki, 27 November 2018.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Future proofing your bank? Digital transformation and regulatory reform in the financial sector
Key quote: As we look at the next ten-year time horizon, there are three major forces challenging banks: digital technology, bank resilience, and climate change.
Rationale: The speech focuses on digital transformation, regulatory reform, and the impact of climate change on banking, without explicit focus on immediate monetary policy actions. However, it acknowledges the balancing act needed for inflation stability, suggesting a moderate, holding stance.
description: Closing keynote address by Mr Olli Rehn, Governor of the Bank of Finland, at The Financial Times Middle East Banking Forum, Dubai, UAE, 11 November 2018.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Climate change and green finance
Key quote: Today, it is widely recognized that climate change is a significant risk to economic growth and financial stability - and to the future of our planet.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses climate change and green finance, with minimal direct reference to monetary policy or immediate interest rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Olli Rehn Governor of the Bank of Finland (at time of speaking Deputy Governor of the Bank of Finland), at the Finnish Climate Summit, Helsinki, 13 June 2018.

author: Olli Rehn
title: Empowering women in business leadership
Key quote: Ensuring equal rights and unleashing the potential of women at workplace in the business life is an essential building block of a more creative productive Europe, France and Finland.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on empowering women in business leadership and does not address monetary policy directly, making it 'Not related'. There is a mention of Eurozone reform, suggesting ongoing recovery and growth, steering towards a neutral prediction of holding rates.
description: Speech by Mr Olli Rehn, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Finland, at the International Women's Day, Helsinki, 8 March 2018.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Building a solid cyber defence for the new geopolitical season
Key quote: Unfortunately, in today’s geopolitical and technological environment the overall cyber threat level is steadily increasing.
Rationale: The speech is focused on cyber resilience and not on monetary policy, so it does not provide any signals about future interest rate decisions.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Towards a digital capital markets union
Key quote: In embracing this technological shift, we are not merely reacting to change, but actively participating in shaping a more efficient, innovative and resilient financial future for Europe.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on digital capital markets and technology, such as DLT and tokenization, and does not discuss monetary policy, inflation, or the economy directly, which makes it unrelated to traditional hawkish or dovish central bank stances.
description: Keynote speech by Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB, at the Bundesbank Symposium on the Future of Payments

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Monetary sovereignty in the digital age: the case for a digital euro
Key quote: Bringing central bank money into a digitalised world through the digital euro would safeguard our monetary sovereignty in the digital age.
Rationale: The speech focuses on digital payments and the introduction of a digital euro to strengthen monetary sovereignty, without indicating any immediate changes to interest rates or traditional monetary policy. The central bank's intention is to maintain monetary stability while integrating digital advancements, suggesting a 'Hold' stance on interest rates.

author: Piero Cipollone

Key quote: We need our own strong digital payments system.

author: Piero Cipollone

Key quote: Today I will take stock of what we know about the impact of Al on the economy and discuss its possible implications for our monetary policy.
Rationale: While the speech touches on potential implications of AI for productivity, inflation, and financial stability, it largely focuses on AI and its broad implications rather than specific monetary policy recommendations. Thus, it's classified as 'Not related' to immediate monetary policy.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the National Conference of Statistics on official statistics at the time of artificial intelligence, Rome, 4 July 2024.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Europe's tragedy of the horizon - the green transition and the role of the European Central Bank
Key quote: Recent data go in that direction and increase our confidence that we will be able to dial back our restrictive monetary policy stance.
Rationale: The speech touches on both the potential future easing of monetary policy and the importance of maintaining price stability, suggesting a balanced approach to current economic conditions.
description: Speech by Mr Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Festival dell' Economia di Trento, Trento, 26 May 2024.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Innovation, integration and independence - taking the Single Euro Payments area to the next level
Key quote: The ECB is today calling on the payments industry to redouble its efforts.

description: Speech by Mr Piero Cipollone, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Central Bank conference on "An innovative and integrated European retail payments market", Frankfurt am Main, 24 April 2024.

author: Piero Cipollone
title: Modernising finance - the role of central bank money
Key quote: But we must be cautious that such innovations do not undermine the stabilising role of central bank money in settling transactions among financial institutions.
Rationale: While the speech focuses on the modernization of finance and discusses new technologies like DLT, it maintains a balanced approach without indicating a shift in monetary policy direction, suggesting a likely 'Hold' on rates.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Taking account of nature, naturally
Key quote: Our ongoing work confirms the profound impact of nature degradation on the economy, including the financial system and price stability, which mirrors that of climate change.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the integration of environmental factors into financial risk assessments rather than setting monetary policy directly. It highlights risks to economic stability due to environmental outcomes, but does not suggest any changes to the policy rate.

title: The first decade of European supervision: taking stock and looking ahead

Rationale: The speech focuses on the resilience and supervision of banks in Europe, emphasizing the importance of maintaining current standards in the face of changing risks without indicating a particular need for tight monetary policy or additional easing. This suggests a neutral stance conducive to holding interest rates.

author: Frank Elderson

Key quote: My message on this Finance and Biodiversity Day is clear: if you destroy nature, you destroy the economy.

description: Contribution by Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank (ECB), 16th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity – Finance and Biodiversity Day

author: Frank Elderson
title: Sustainable finance: from “eureka!” to action
Key quote: To sum up, there is no doubt that the ongoing climate and nature crises go to the heart of central banking and banking supervision.
Rationale: The speech predominantly focuses on environmental and sustainability issues rather than traditional monetary policy concerns, hence it's not directly relevant to assessing the central bank's policy stance.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Nature-related risk - legal implications for central banks, supervisors and financial institutions
Key quote: Today, I want to focus on the legal implications of nature-related risk for our central banking and supervisory work.

description: Keynote speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the ESCB (Central banks of the European System) Legal Conference 2024, Frankfurt am Main, 6 September 2024.

author: Frank Elderson
title: The art of bending without breaking - banking on operational resilience

author: Frank Elderson
title: Embedding a strong data culture in supervision - another stepping stone towards effective supervision
Key quote: Embedding a strong data culture in supervision will be key if we are to continue delivering high-quality, efficient and effective supervision in the years to come.
Rationale: The speech by Mr. Frank Elderson focuses on embedding a strong data culture in supervision and technological advancements in supervisory tools, rather than addressing monetary policy or interest rates.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Preparing for the next decade of European banking supervision - risk-focused, impactful and legally sound
Key quote: Together, we can ensure that banks remain safe and sound in the decades to come.

description: Speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the "10 years Single Supervisory Mechanism (SSM) and beyond" event, organised by Allen & Overy, Frankfurt am Main, 27 June 2024.

author: Frank Elderson
title: "Know thyself" – avoiding policy mistakes in light of the prevailing climate science
Key quote: Know what you know and know what you don't know - this is what I have sought to convey to you today.

It emphasizes the importance of awareness and caution in policy-making in light of uncertain climate science impacts. This suggests a neutral stance in monetary policy decision-making, advocating preparedness rather than an immediate change in policy rates.

author: Frank Elderson

Key quote: Central banks and supervisors have no option but to take the ongoing climate and nature crises into account to deliver on their monetary policy and banking supervision mandates.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Making banks resilient to climate and environmental risks – good practices to overcome the remaining stumbling blocks

title: Powers, ability and willingness to act – the mainstay of effective banking supervision

There is no discussion related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions, which would categorize it as unrelated to monetary policy.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Making finance fit for Paris - achieving "negative splits"

Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on sustainable finance and climate goals rather than monetary policy, with no clear implications for interest rates. Hence, it's not directly related to monetary policy. Given this context, and with no new information on economic or inflationary conditions, a 'Hold' is most likely.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Closing gaps to bend the trend - embedding the flow of finance in the transition
Key quote: The ECB takes the consequences of the ongoing climate and environmental crises into account in the pursuit of its mandate.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Policymakers as policy takers – accounting for climate-related and environmental factors in banking supervision and monetary policy
Key quote: We are not climate and environmental policymakers. We are climate and environmental policy takers.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on the integration of climate-related and environmental considerations into banking supervision and monetary policy. It does not explicitly address changes to the interest rate policy itself.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Urgent and vitally important - 2023 as a key milestone in stepping up the management of climate and environmental risks
Key quote: 2023 is a crucial year for translating ambitions into sound internal practices, for which substantial progress is needed.

The focus is not on macroeconomic indicators that typically influence rate decisions, therefore 'Not related' is the assigned category. However, considering the ECB's stance on C&E risks, it's likely the next vote on interest rates would be to 'Hold', with a moderate degree of uncertainty reflected by the probability.

author: Frank Elderson
title: The European Climate Law and the European Central Bank
Key quote: The ECB is not an environmental activist, but rather a prudent realist.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Delivering on the Glasgow Declaration - actions by the European Central Bank on the road through Sharm El-Sheikh to a Paris-compatible path

author: Frank Elderson

author: Frank Elderson

author: Frank Elderson
title: The embrace of the horizon - forcefully moving with the changing tide for climate action in financial sector policies
Key quote: Governments clearly bear primary responsibility for addressing the climate and environmental crises we are facing.
Rationale: The speech is focused on climate action and sustainability within the financial sector, with no direct implications for immediate changes in monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it does not relate to a typical central banking hawkish/dovish stance.
description: Speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Chair of the Central Banks and Supervisors Network for Greening the Financial System, Member of the Executive Board and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Green Swan 2021 Global Virtual Conference, 3 June 2021.

author: Frank Elderson
title: All the way to zero - guiding banks towards a carbon-neutral Europe
Key quote: Climate-related risks show up in the already existing risk categories - as such, we will treat them with the same rigour, toughness and importance as we treat other material risks.
