Rationale: The speech focuses predominantly on climate change and the role of the ECB in ensuring banks manage climate-related risks effectively. It does not address monetary policy or provide insights into interest rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board and Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the conference on "The Role of Banks in Greening our Economies" organized by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and Hrvatska narodna banka, Frankfurt am Main, 29 April 2021.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Patchy data is a good start - from Kuznets and Clark to supervisors and climate
Key quote: There are risks to acting on the basis of partial data, but in the case of climate change, the risks of inaction are far greater.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on climate-related risk supervision within banks rather than traditional monetary policy. Frank Elderson discusses banks’ self-assessments on climate risks and does not provide guidance on interest rates or monetary policy changes.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB-EBRD joint conference on "Emerging climate-related risk supervision and implications for financial institutions", 16 June 2020.

author: Frank Elderson
title: Introductory Statement
Key quote: N/A
Rationale: The speech focuses on supervisory responsibilities and challenges facing the banking sector, and doesn't address monetary policy or interest rate decisions directly.
description: Introductory Statement by Mr Frank Elderson, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, Hearing at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, 25 January 2020.

author: Mário Centeno
title: The importance of financial education in the current economic context
Key quote: In these unprecedented times, financial literacy has a vital role.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on financial education and its importance rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate changes. However, given the emphasis on financial literacy in the context of rising interest rates and inflation, a neutral stance is implied.
description: Keynote intervention (virtual) by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the conference "The new era of financial education", organised by Magyar Nemzeti Bank (the central bank of Hungary), Budapest, 3 October 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Sustainability 20|30 – the future is being decided now
Key quote: In sum, we can no longer leave environmental considerations out of our policies and decision-making frameworks in the fulfilment of our mandates.
Rationale: The speech focuses on sustainability and environmental concerns, rather than directly discussing monetary policy or economic indicators that would affect interest rate decisions.
description: Opening address by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, on the 2nd day of the conference organised by the newspaper Jornal de Negócios, 8 April 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: 175th anniversary of the Banco de Portugal
Key quote: The short-term effects are clear. The Russian invasion of Ukraine, in itself a demonstration of the lack of social capital, is slowing down the recovery. Also it is causing an inflationary environment, adding to the ones already in place, and temporary, due to the fast recovery from the COVID crisis.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the role of central banks in rebuilding social capital and the importance of trust and education, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or providing insight into future interest rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the conference on the 175th anniversary of the Banco de Portugal "Rebuilding Social Capital - the role of central banks", Lisbon, 1 April 2022.

author: Mário Centeno
title: 175th anniversary of the Banco de Portugal
Key quote: In front of this audience, which goes far beyond Rua do Comércio to the entire country, I can assure you that you can count on us to build a strategy for development and prosperity for Portugal and Europe, renewing the commitment made 175 years ago each year.
Rationale: The speech is primarily a commemorative address celebrating the 175th anniversary of the Banco de Portugal. It highlights historical achievements and the central bank's role in the European financial system but does not provide information or insights into current or future monetary policy decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the session to commemorate the 175th anniversary of the Banco de Portugal, Lisbon, 3 November 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Opening remarks - Banco de Portugal Online Conference on Financial Stability 2021
Key quote: A positive outlook does not mean that we are out of the woods, not yet. Several risks still loom.
Rationale: The speech is focused on financial stability, economic recovery, and future challenges without suggesting immediate changes to monetary policy. It reflects a cautious tone amid improving economic conditions, signaling a likely hold on rates while emphasizing risk management.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the Banco de Portugal Online Conference on Financial Stability 2021, virtual, 11 October 2021.

author: Mário Centeno
title: Investment, digitalization and green financing - the Portuguese case
Key quote: The projected recovery benefits from the impact of monetary policy decisions and budgetary response to the crisis.
Rationale: The speech focuses on investment, digitalization, and green financing, and does not directly discuss monetary policy actions or considerations related to interest rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Mário Centeno, Governor of the Banco de Portugal, at the joint Banco de Portugal and European Investment Bank Webinar "Investment, digitalization and green financing - the Portuguese case", 15 March 2021.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: Resilience, adaptability, and cooperation
Key quote: And while the main objective of the conference has not changed much - that is to discuss policies needed to enable sustainable growth and prosperity in Central Eastern and Southeastern Europe - the underlying circumstances at that time were so much different than today.
Rationale: The speech focuses on broad themes of resilience, adaptability, and cooperation without explicit direction on monetary policy. It acknowledges the need for massive policy actions but does not clearly indicate a stance towards tightening or loosening rates.
description: Speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the conference "Policymaking in Choppy Waters: Fostering Resilience in Central, Eastern and Southeastern Europe (CESEE)", Dubrovnik, 3 June 2023.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: Croatia's joining the euro area makes it an active participant in defining a common monetary policy
Key quote: On 1 January 2023, the Croatian National Bank became part of the Eurosystem and thus an active participant in defining a common monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses Croatia's accession to the euro area and its implications, reflecting a celebratory tone about joining the Eurosystem. There's an acknowledgment of the inflationary dynamics but no specific indication towards advocating for any immediate change in monetary policy, suggesting a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the conference "Croatia, the 20th Member of the Euro Area", Zagreb, 24 January 2023.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: Macroeconomic developments and structural issues in CEE countries
Key quote: Economic expansion in the CEE region can be expected to continue in the near term supported by still favourable cyclical conditions.
Rationale: The speech discusses the continuation of economic growth in the CEE region with moderate risks but does not directly address monetary policy or indicate a change in stance. The focus is on structural issues, so a neutral stance with a likely decision to hold rates is appropriate.
description: Speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the Roundtable on Macroeconomic Developments of the 16+1 Economies, Magyar Nemzeti Bank (the central bank of Hungary), Budapest, 9 November 2018.

author: Boris Vujčić
title: Convergence - is it here to stay?
Key quote: The question is, did we take convergence for granted?
Rationale: The speech largely focuses on economic convergence and structural reforms rather than immediate monetary policy. It does not provide strong signals toward changing interest rates but discusses long-term economic issues, suggesting a neutral stance towards immediate policy actions.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Boris Vujčić, Governor of the Croatian National Bank, at the 7th Annual National Bank of Poland Conference on the Future of the European Economy, Warsaw 20 October 2017.

author: Boštjan Vasle
title: How can green finance and insurance secure a greener future?
Key quote: Climate change and related events affect the fulfillment of our key mandates of price and financial stability.
Rationale: The speech by Mr. Boštjan Vasle is primarily focused on the role of green finance and the impact of climate change on central banks' mandates. It does not directly discuss monetary policy actions such as changing interest rates, making it not directly related to a standard monetary policy stance like 'hawkish' or 'dovish.'
description: Speech by Mr Boštjan Vasle, Governor of Bank of Slovenia, at the conference "How Can Green Finance and Insurance Secure a Greener Future?", organised by the British-Slovenian Chamber of Commerce, Ljubljana, 22 March 2024.

author: Boštjan Vasle
title: Digital euro - cash meets technology
Key quote: Providing central bank money to everyone also in the digital form, alongside cash, could help us to ensure that our common currency - the euro - is fit for digital age.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the digital euro and its implications for monetary sovereignty and the digital payments landscape, rather than specifically addressing current monetary policy or the policy rate decision. Therefore, it's not directly related to the central bank's stance on interest rate adjustments.
description: Opening speech by Mr Boštjan Vasle, Governor of Bank of Slovenia, at the event "Digital euro: cash meets technology, Ljubljana, 15 December 2023.

author: Boštjan Vasle
title: Controlling inflationary pressures in a demanding geopolitical and financial environment
Key quote: The confluence of different factors complicates the assessment of the impacts of euro adoption.
Rationale: The speech is discussing the introduction of the euro in Croatia and Slovenia and its implications, not directly about monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Boštjan Vasle, Governor of Bank of Slovenia, at the Banking Conference "Slovenia one year after the outbreak of global energy crisis and development priorities", organised by the Bank Association of Slovenia, Ljubljana, 2 June 2023.

author: Boštjan Vasle
title: Introducing the euro in times of high inflation - case of Croatia
Key quote: The euro is mainly an asset for small countries, but its introduction also entails some risks, for example in the banking system.
Rationale: The speech is analytical about the introduction of the euro and its effects, balancing the asset view with potential risks. It does not indicate a preference towards tightening or easing monetary policy.
description: Opening speech by Mr Boštjan Vasle, Governor of Bank of Slovenia, at the lecture "Introducing the euro in times of high inflation - case of Croatia", Ljubljana, 20 April 2023.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: United fighting the darkness of growing threats
Key quote: AML risk management does not mean de-risking. Quite the opposite, the focus on the consumer - in terms of the accessibility, quality and safety of financial services - has to remain at the heart of business for each and every financial institution.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on anti-money laundering (AML) efforts and not on monetary policy or interest rate decisions, thus it falls under 'Not related'. However, given the context of a 4% policy rate, if asked to predict an unrelated central bank meeting decision, a 'Hold' prediction would be balanced given no monetary policy insights are provided.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the Annual AML Center Conference 2024 "Beyond the Surface of Illicit Finance: Allied Reponse", Vilnius, 16 May 2024.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: Central Europe's convergence
Key quote: We are now witnessing growing risks of monetary, fiscal, and financial policy miscalibration, and it looks like these disturbances are here to stay.
Rationale: The speech focuses on economic convergence, regional variability in productivity and GDP growth, and the role of institutions, without specific policy recommendations relevant to immediate central bank interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the10th National Bank of Poland Annual Flagship Conference on the Future of the European Economy (CoFEE), Session II "Drivers of growth and convergence of Central European economies", Warsaw, 21 October 2022.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: The future of central banking
Key quote: Will this technology replace us - central bankers - in making policy decisions? My answer is: certainly not!
Rationale: The speech is a welcome address at a conference about the future of central banking, focusing on long-term themes and technological evolution, rather than immediate monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Welcome speech by Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the international conference "Future of Central Banking" organised by the Bank of Lithuania and the Bank for International Settlements (BIS) on the occasion of the centenary of the Bank of Lithuania, Vilnius, 29 September 2022.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: Gediminas Šimkus: Investment in the Baltics - from pandemic to war
Key quote: Planning and investing today in preparation for those good times to come is more important than ever.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on investment in the Baltics, the impacts of the pandemic and the war in Ukraine, and the need for sustainable investments, without significant emphasis on monetary policy.
description: Welcome and opening remarks (virtual) by Mr Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the joint webinar of Bank of Lithuania, Bank of Estonia, Bank of Latvia, and European Investment Bank, 20 May 2022.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: Speech at Baltic AML Forum 2021
Key quote: Let me be clear - we make no compromises on anti-money laundering and counter terrorist financing.
Rationale: The speech is focused on anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing rather than monetary policy, so it does not give direct insight into the central bank's stance on interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the Baltic Anti Money Laundering (AML) Forum 2021, Vilnius, 12 October 2021.

author: Gediminas Šimkus
title: Speech at Macroprudential Policy Conference 2021
Key quote: We need to look further into what changes could be made to the macroprudential framework and its application to make it more effective, fair, and fit for the world of tomorrow.
Rationale: The speech focuses on macroprudential policy rather than direct monetary policy changes. There is a strong emphasis on monitoring and adjusting borrower-based measures to ensure stability, suggesting a cautious and balanced approach without immediate changes to interest rates.
description: Opening remarks by Gediminas Šimkus, Chairman of the Board of the Bank of Lithuania, at the Macroprudential Policy Conference "Borrower-based measures in times of global pandemic and beyond", Vilnius, 4 October 2021.

author: Jan Smets
title: New data needs for monetary policy
Key quote: Reflections on the future of monetary policy may require new data needs
Rationale: The speech suggests careful consideration of monetary policy changes due to structural shifts, but it doesn't advocate immediate action. The focus on data and analysis implies a neutral stance, suggesting holding rates until more information is gathered.
description: Speech by Mr Jan Smets, Governor of the National Bank of Belgium, at the ninth European Central Bank Conference on Statistics, Session 1: New data needs for monetary policy, Frankfurt am Main, 11 July 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Farewell remarks
Key quote: Today, we are in a situation where low interest rates are not delivering the same degree of stimulus as in the past, because the rate of return on investment in the economy has fallen.
Rationale: The speech is reflective and transitional, acknowledging past achievements and outlining future challenges without aligning strongly towards tightening or loosening policy direction. Given the context and balanced tone, Draghi would likely have voted to hold rates in his last meeting.
description: Remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the farewell event in his honour, Frankfurt am Main, 28 October 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Policymaking, responsibility and uncertainty
Key quote: It was with this in mind that the ECB recently made adjustments to negative rates, introducing tiering for excess reserves.
Rationale: The speech reflects on past monetary policy measures and emphasizes a balanced and evidence-based approach to decision-making. It provides a neutral stance with a focus on knowledge, courage, and humility, without signaling an immediate policy shift.
description: Acceptance speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, for the Laurea Honoris Causa from the Università Cattolica, Milan, 11 October 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Macroprudential policy in Europe
Key quote: Europe is now better placed to prevent or mitigate risks to financial stability than it was in the run-up to the global financial crisis.
Rationale: The speech focuses on macroprudential policy rather than monetary policy, so it does not provide direct clues to Draghi's monetary policy stance. The context around financial stability suggests a 'Hold' stance at best, as it doesn't imply immediate economic instability or change in inflation expectations.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank and Chair of the European Systemic Risk Board, at the fourth annual conference of the ESRB, Frankfurt am Main, 26 September 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Welcome remarks - 8th ECB conference on central, eastern and south-eastern European countries
Key quote: The Single Market created prosperity in CEE countries, especially for those in the euro area, by generating convergence in per capita income.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on the economic development and convergence in central, eastern, and south-eastern European countries, rather than monetary policy decisions or future rate moves.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the 8th ECB conference on central, eastern and south-eastern European countries, Frankfurt am Main, 12 June 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Sovereignty in a globalised world
Key quote: The European Union is the institutional framework that has allowed the Member States to be sovereign in many areas.
Rationale: The speech predominantly addresses the topic of sovereignty within the European Union rather than monetary policy. It does not provide direct insights into Draghi's stance on immediate monetary policy changes.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, on the award of Laurea honoris causa in law from Università degli Studi di Bologna, Bologna, 22 February 2019.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The benefits of European supervision
Key quote: The benefits of European supervision
Rationale: The speech mainly focuses on the benefits of European supervision and financial integration rather than directly on monetary policy or interest rates. It discusses structural changes and regulatory challenges rather than providing an outlook on economic conditions or policy rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Autorité de contrôle prudentiel et de resolution (ACPR) Conference on Financial Supervision, Paris, 18 September 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: ECB press conference - introductory statement
Key quote: We decided to keep the key ECB interest rates unchanged. We continue to expect them to remain at their present levels at least through the summer of 2019.
Rationale: The speech indicates no change in interest rates and signals the continuation of the current monetary policy, suggesting a neutral stance. The ECB is maintaining its course with its asset purchase program, reflecting a steady approach without any new aggressive measures towards tightening or easing.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, and Mr Luis de Guindos, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 13 September 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Risk-reducing and risk-sharing in our Monetary Union
Key quote: A decade after the great financial crisis, the euro area looks set to exit more resilient than it entered it.
Rationale: The speech outlines the importance of addressing the structural issues in the euro area but does not indicate any imminent changes to monetary policy or interest rates. The focus is on institutional reforms rather than immediate policy action, suggesting a neutral stance in terms of monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the European University Institute, Florence, 11 May 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Generation €uro Students' Award 2018 event
Key quote: You will have an important role to play in tomorrow's Europe, but that role, that responsibility, starts today.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the Generation €uro Students' Award event and the importance of engaging with young people, not on monetary policy or economic outlook. Therefore, it’s unrelated to monetary policy decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 11 April 2018.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Structural reforms in the euro area
Key quote: With monetary policy being accommodative, we now have a window of opportunity to take these measures.
Rationale: The speech focuses on structural reforms rather than directly discussing monetary policy, interest rates, or inflation. However, it acknowledges the current accommodative monetary policy context, which implies a neutral stance rather than a push for immediate monetary tightening or loosening.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB conference "Structural reforms in the euro area", Frankfurt am Main, 18 October 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Youth unemployment in the euro area
Key quote: Our monetary policy measures, aimed at maintaining price stability, are supporting domestic demand and thus the recovery in employment.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the issue of youth unemployment and its structural causes rather than focusing directly on monetary policy. While it briefly mentions monetary policy as supportive, it does not strongly signal any immediate change in policy rates.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, for the Henry Grattan Lecture Series, Trinity College, Dublin, 22 September 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Building on the achievements of post-crisis reforms
Key quote: At the same time, work remains to be done. Authorities need to watch out for blind spots, where risks can build up unnoticed, and use the tools at their disposal.
Rationale: The speech discusses the resilience of the banking sector and the use of macroprudential tools, without suggesting changes to monetary policy. It indicates being vigilant with financial stability but does not signal a distinct policy direction for interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank and Chair of the European Systemic Risk Board, at the second annual conference of the ESRB, Frankfurt am Main, 21 September 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The interdependence of research and policymaking
Key quote: Provided they are willing to explore non-standard policy avenues, they can continue pursuing their price stability mandates even in the most adverse circumstances.
Rationale: Draghi highlights the importance of unconventional monetary policies like QE, which is typically associated with dovish stances, but he is not explicitly advocating for further easing, hence the 'somewhat dovish' categorization.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Lindau Nobel Laureate Meeting, Lindau, 23 August 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Response on receipt of an Honorary Doctorate from Tel Aviv University
Key quote: The crisis is now behind us. The recovery in the euro area is resilient and is increasingly broadbased across countries and sectors.
Rationale: The speech is a reflection on collective progress and integration in Europe rather than monetary policy. While it mentions economic recovery and the ECB's role, it's not specific enough to categorize as a commentary on policy direction.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, on the receipt of an Honorary Doctorate from Tel Aviv University, Tel Aviv, 18 May 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: The Monnet method - its relevance for Europe then and now
Key quote: What is on trial today is not - and should not be - the method of integration pioneered by Jean Monnet.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the importance of European integration and the relevance of the Monnet method, with limited mention or implication of immediate monetary policy actions or the ECB's interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, for the Award of the Gold Medal of the Fondation Jean Monnet pour l'Europe, Lausanne, 4 May 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Moving to the frontier - promoting the diffusion of innovation
Key quote: This might at first glance seem an unusual topic for a central bank conference, since monetary policy principally operates through the demand side of the economy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on innovation and productivity in the euro area rather than directly discussing monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Welcome address by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the joint conference by the ECB and the MIT Lab for Innovation Science and Policy "Fostering Innovation and Entrepreneurship in the Euro area", Frankfurt am Main, 13 March 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Security through unity - making integration work for Europe
Key quote: Unity is the key to security for our continent - today as it always has been.
Rationale: The speech focuses more on European integration and its historical context, rather than monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Monetary policy is only tangentially mentioned, not allowing for a clear hawkish or dovish classification.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the joint ECB and Bank of Slovenia conference on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the adoption of the euro, Ljubljana, 2 February 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Welcome address "Into the future: Europe's digital integrated market"
Key quote: It is a pleasure to welcome you here today to this joint ECB and European Commission conference on Europe's digital integrated market of tomorrow.
Rationale: The speech focuses mainly on financial integration and digitalization, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Joint ECB and European Commission Conference "Into the future: Europe's digital integrated market", Frankfurt am Main, 31 January 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Cavour Prize 2016 - commemoration
Rationale: The speech is focused on historical reflections about Cavour and European integration, without any direct mention or implications for current monetary policy or central bank decision-making.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, on the occasion of the awarding of the Premio Camillo Cavour 2016, Santena, 23 January 2017.

author: Mario Draghi
title: European Systemic Risk Board (welcome address)
Key quote: The need for vigilance is why the ESRB has always warned against policy inaction bias.
Rationale: The speech focuses on systemic risks and macroprudential policy rather than immediate monetary policy actions. It reflects a balanced view between acknowledging challenges and the need for vigilance without suggesting immediate changes to interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank and Chair of the European Systemic Risk Board, at the first annual conference of the ESRB, Frankfurt am Main, 22 September 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Reviving the spirit of De Gasperi - working together for an effective and inclusive Union
Key quote: Economic cooperation is, of course, a matter of compromise between the natural desire for independence of each participant and overriding political aspirations.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses European integration, political cooperation, and historical reflections, without direct focus on monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the presentation ceremony of the De Gasperi award, Trento, 13 September 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Eighth ECB Statistics Conference
Key quote: Looking at the details beyond the aggregates enriches our understanding of economic phenomena and at the same time increases our flexibility to respond to unexpected policy needs.
Rationale: The speech focuses on central bank statistics and data collection rather than monetary policy. It does not provide insights into interest rate decisions or monetary policy stance.
description: Welcome address by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, at the Eighth ECB Statistics Conference "Central bank statistics: moving beyond the aggregates", Frankfurt am Main, 6 July 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Laudatio for Theo Waigel
Key quote: Not applicable
Rationale: The speech is primarily a tribute to Theo Waigel and his contributions, focusing on historical context and broader European integration themes rather than current monetary policy. It does not provide specific guidance on interest rates or central bank policy actions, hence it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy decision-making.
description: Speech by Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, in honour of Dr Theodor Waigel, at SignsAwards, Munich, 17 June 2016.

author: Mario Draghi
title: Interview in The Guardian
Key quote: The ECB's role in that is to maintain price stability, which prevents unfair redistribution.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on social issues like youth unemployment and inequality, while emphasizing the importance of price stability. It does not indicate any immediate monetary policy changes, suggesting a neutral stance.
description: Interview with Mr Mario Draghi, President of the European Central Bank, in The Guardian, conducted by Mr Shiv Malik on 18 February 2016 and published on 11 March 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: Keynote speech - "Future Europe" conference
Key quote: The long run solution most likely involves deeper fiscal integration, and it is important that the debate is moving forward in this area.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the future of Europe, fiscal integration, and governance of the monetary union, rather than directly addressing current monetary policy or rate changes.
description: Video address by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the conference "Future Europe", Frankfurt am Main, 10 May 2019.

author: Peter Praet
title: Market power - a complex reality
Key quote: For a central banker, it is thus of crucial importance to understand whether and how the prevailing level of firms' market power is evolving.
Rationale: The speech focuses on market power and its macroeconomic implications rather than directly on monetary policy. There is no indication of a particular stance towards interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the EIB/Compnet conference, Luxembourg, 18 March 2019.

author: Peter Praet
title: On the importance of real estate statistics
Key quote: It is essential for us to be able to distinguish clearly between country-specific developments in real estate markets that warrant responses from macroprudential authorities, and area-wide developments that might, in some circumstances, warrant a monetary policy response.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the importance of real estate statistics and their implications for both macroprudential and monetary policy without indicating a clear stance towards tightening or easing monetary policy. Therefore, it suggests a neutral position with a focus on information gathering rather than immediate policy change.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Conference on Real Estate Statistics, Luxembourg, 21 February 2019.

author: Peter Praet
title: Interview in BdP Revista, staff magazine of Bank of Portugal
Key quote: The role of lender of last resort is a traditional role for central banks and we fulfil it. This contributes to financial stability.
Rationale: Peter Praet's interview largely discusses the structural frameworks and institutional achievements at the ECB over 20 years, without specific emphasis on imminent rate adjustments or economic overheating. His emphasis on the stability and effectiveness of existing structures implies contentment with current policy settings, suggesting a neutral stance.
description: Interview with Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in BdP Revista, staff magazine of Bank of Portugal, conducted by Ms Isabel Arriaga e Cunha on 18 June 2018 and published on 2 November 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: The interaction between monetary policy and macroprudential policy
Key quote: The interactions between monetary and macroprudential policies are significant.
Rationale: The speech by Peter Praet is mainly analytical and discusses the interplay between monetary and macroprudential policies without advocating for immediate changes to monetary policy. It highlights the complexity and need for more in-depth analysis, suggesting a neutral stance at this point.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Money, Macro and Finance Research Group Conference on the Resilience of the Global Financial Architecture, London, 27 September 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: Creating an enabling environment for pan-European banks in the Banking Union
Key quote: The Banking Union contributes to providing effective mechanisms for cross-border risk-sharing and broadening the sources of funding within a country, thereby promoting macroeconomic stability and growth.
Rationale: The speech by Peter Praet focuses on the integration and regulation of banking within the European Union rather than directly discussing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum 2018, Vienna, 5 September 2018.

author: Peter Praet
title: The outlook for reform - cementing growth and delivering sustainable employment
Key quote: While monetary policy still plays an important role in sustaining the recovery, it is not 'the only game in town'.
Rationale: Peter Praet acknowledges the solid economic recovery and the favorable impact of monetary policy measures, but also emphasizes the need for structural reforms, implying a balanced approach and a likely decision to hold rates at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Ludwig Erhard Lecture, organised by the Lisbon Council, Brussels, 30 November 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: EMU - how much federalism?
Key quote: The answer to the question of today's conference - 'How much federalism?' - is not easy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on federalism in the EU and its implications for governance, with only marginal reference to macroeconomic stabilization. It does not directly address immediate monetary policy or give clear signals about rate changes.
description: Keynote address by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 5th Frankfurt Conference on Financial Market Policy, organised by the SAFE Policy Center of Goethe University, Frankfurt am Main, 27 October 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: We need to complete the Banking Union
Key quote: It is now urgent to agree on an ambitious timetable for its implementation.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the structural and institutional aspects of the Banking Union, detailing the necessary steps for its completion, and does not directly address monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the EUROFI Conference, Malta, 6 April 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: It is urgent to agree on an ambitious timetable for completing the Banking Union
Key quote: It is now urgent to agree on an ambitious timetable for its implementation.
Rationale: Peter Praet's speech is primarily focused on the Banking Union and financial integration in the EU, rather than directly discussing monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.
description: Contribution of Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, for the magazine of the Eurofi conference in Malta (5-7 April 2017), 4 April 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: Towards Banking Union
Key quote: Overall, the banking landscape still resembles too much a collection of banking systems highly exposed to their domestic economies, with limited cross-border private risksharing.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses structural changes and integration in the European banking system, particularly the Banking Union. It does not directly address monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in the session "(Do Not) Break It: Today's Europe at Full Speed" of the LUISS International Conference on "Europe 2017: Make it or Break it", Rome, 24 January 2017.

author: Peter Praet
title: The importance of a genuine banking union for monetary policy
Key quote: The main point I would like to make is that we need a more integrated banking sector in the euro area to achieve greater macroeconomic stability.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of financial integration and banking union for effective monetary policy transmission, but does not indicate any immediate change in monetary policy stance. This suggests a neutral position with a likelihood of holding interest rates steady.
description: Speech by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the EMU Forum 2016, Oesterreichische Nationalbank, Vienna, 24 November 2016.

author: Peter Praet
title: The future of global financial integration
Key quote: Euro area leaders have since launched the Banking Union, to be complemented over time with the Capital Markets Union, to deepen financial integration within the euro area.
Rationale: The speech discusses financial integration and institutional reforms without explicitly addressing current monetary policy or giving indications of a rate change, suggesting a neutral stance in monetary policy context.
description: Remarks by Mr Peter Praet, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Global Research Forum on International Macroeconomics and Finance, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, New York City, 17 November 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Supervisory action in times of crisis and the limits of the ECB's prudential mandate
Key quote: Extraordinary supervisory action is warranted in times of crisis. But the ECB cannot take on tasks that go beyond its prudential supervision mandate.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses supervisory actions and the ECB's prudential mandate rather than monetary policy. However, given the context of the financial crisis and economic uncertainty, if monetary policy were discussed, holding rates would be probable.
description: Introductory statement by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum, Berlin, 11 September 2020.

author: Yves Mersch
title: An ECB digital currency - a flight of fancy?
Key quote: We will only introduce a digital currency if we become firmly convinced that it is both necessary and proportionate to fulfil our tasks in ensuring the stability of our currency.
Rationale: The speech is focused on discussing the potential introduction of a CBDC and highlights the importance of being prepared, but does not indicate any immediate monetary policy action. It stresses readiness and analysis without advocating change, suggesting a 'Hold' stance in the interest rate meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Consensus 2020 virtual conference, 11 May 2020.

author: Yves Mersch
title: From Basel III to European banking regulation
Key quote: Fully implementing Basel III will have a positive effect on the economy in the long run.
Rationale: The speech focuses on regulatory frameworks and Basel III implications, suggesting no immediate shift in monetary policy stance. The emphasis on regulatory implementation points to a continued commitment to stability, supporting a 'Hold' prediction on rates.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the IIF 6th Annual European Banking Union Colloquium, Frankfurt am Main, 25 November 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Future-proofing the European banking market - removing the obstacles to exit
Key quote: By reaping synergies, consolidation may help banks to address one of their most pressing challenges: how to reduce costs.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking consolidation, market functioning, and regulatory frameworks, rather than on direct monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the S&amp;P Global's European Financial Institutions Conference, Paris, 21 November 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Anti-money laundering and combating the financing of terrorism - recent initiatives and the role of the European Central Bank
Key quote: Anti-money laundering and combating the financing of terrorism are challenging endeavours.
Rationale: The speech by Yves Mersch primarily covers anti-money laundering (AML) and combating the financing of terrorism (CFT) rather than monetary policy. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Colloque de l'AEDBF-Europe, Paris, 15 November 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: International trends in central bank independence - the European Central Bank's perspective
Key quote: Independent monetary policy has brought important benefits to our economies and people and remains essential for us to continue fulfilling our mandate of price stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses central bank independence, accountability, and transparency without directly addressing monetary policy stance or future rate decisions.
description: Remarks by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Roundtable Discussion on Central Bank Independence, Frankfurt am Main, 12 November 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Appointment hearing as Vice-Chair of the ECB Supervisory Board
Key quote: I am grateful for this opportunity to outline the key principles that I intend to bring to the role.
Rationale: The speech is focused on banking supervision and regulatory principles rather than monetary policy or interest rate guidance.
description: Appointment hearing of Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of the European Parliament, Brussels, 4 September 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Money and private currencies - reflections on Libra
Key quote: I sincerely hope that the people of Europe will not be tempted to leave behind the safety and soundness of established payment solutions and channels in favour of the beguiling but treacherous promises of Facebook's siren call.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the nature and implications of private currencies like Libra rather than providing a direct commentary on monetary policy or the direction of interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the the ESCB Legal Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 2 September 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Back to stable
Key quote: Ultimately, we will be judged on how we deliver price stability. Trust is the central bank's most valuable asset.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the commitment to price stability and the independence of the central bank, reflecting a balanced stance without indicating a change in monetary policy direction.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Zahlungsverkehrssymposium, Deutsche Bundesbank, Frankfurt am Main, 29 May 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Competitiveness of Europe and European financial markets
Key quote: To increase competitiveness is the main driver for higher potential growth.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the structural reforms needed for enhancing competitiveness in Europe and discusses European financial markets, with no specific mention of monetary policy direction or interest rate changes.
description: Panel contribution by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 30th edition of the workshop "The Outlook for the Economy and Finance", Villa d'Este, Cernobbio, 6 April 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Yves Mersch: Lending and payment systems in upheaval - the fintech challenge
Key quote: Fintech could also lead to the emergence of new risks and greater concentration.
Rationale: The speech focuses on fintech challenges, the evolving landscape of digital finance, the impact on banks and payment systems, and regulatory perspectives, rather than monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 3rd annual Conference on Fintech and Digital Innovation, Brussels, 26 February 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Promoting innovation and integration in retail payments to achieve tangible benefits for people and businesses
Key quote: Digitalisation has brought a great deal of change to the payments market, and there is more on its way.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the innovation, integration, and regulatory aspects related to retail payments and data protection, without addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions directly.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the American European Community Association, Brussels, 7 February 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The changing role of central banking
Key quote: Fast-moving times sometimes require adjustments. Central banks are not excluded from this.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the need for integrating financial stability concerns into monetary policy at the European level, acknowledging current limitations in macroprudential policy. Without overt hawkish or dovish signals, it suggests a balanced approach to current policy.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Lamfalussy Lectures Conference of the Lamfalussy Award at Magyar Nemzeti Bank (The Central Bank of Hungary), Budapest, 4 February 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The possible triangle - frictionless movement of payments, securities and collateral across Europe
Key quote: Our current activities - the consolidation of TARGET2 and T2S and the mobilisation and management of collateral through the development of the ECMS - are the cornerstones of the Eurosystem's ambitious agenda up to 2022.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the infrastructure and systemic aspects of payments and collateral management rather than on direct monetary policy signals such as interest rate changes or inflation outlooks.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 2019 Annual General Meeting of the International Capital Markets Association's European Repo and Collateral Council, Luxembourg, 31 January 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Tenth anniversary of the euro in Slovakia
Key quote: Slovakia's success shows that EU accession and the adoption of the euro can create considerable opportunities - opportunities that can be seized, or wasted.
Rationale: The speech by Yves Mersch primarily focuses on the economic and institutional convergence of Slovakia and its success story within the EU, without directly addressing monetary policy or providing guidance on the ECB's future interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Conference to mark the tenth anniversary of the introduction of the euro in Slovakia, Bratislava, 11 January 2019.

author: Yves Mersch
title: TIPS and the future of innovative retail payment solutions in Europe
Key quote: With the launch of TIPS, the Eurosystem has laid the groundwork for innovative, customer-friendly retail payment solutions for the benefit of European citizens.
Rationale: The speech focuses on innovations in payment systems and retail payments in Europe, specifically the launch of TIPS, rather than discussing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the TIPS launch event, Frascati (Rome), 30 November 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Climate change and central banking
Key quote: Finding - or financing - the solution to the problems of climate change appears, at first glance, somewhat remote from the primary mandate of a central bank.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes that climate change, while significant, is largely outside the ECB's current monetary policy mandate. Mersch argues against altering monetary policy to address climate change, focusing instead on the ECB's primary mandate of price stability. This suggests a neutral stance towards monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Workshop discussion "Sustainability is becoming mainstream", Frankfurt am Main, 27 November 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Europe: a work in progress - political integration and economic convergence in Monetary Union
Key quote: The resilience of the euro hinges on the implementation of the necessary economic and fiscal reforms.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the broader structural and fiscal reforms needed to enhance the economic and political convergence within the Eurozone. There is no direct indication of changing monetary policy, making his stance neutral.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Banking and Corporate evening, organised by the Hauptverwaltung in Bayern der Deutschen Bundesbank, Munich, 22 November 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The future started yesterday
Key quote: Predicting what payments will look like in the 22nd century is perhaps better left to science fiction writers than to central bankers.
Rationale: The speech mainly focuses on the future of payment systems and related innovations, which are not directly related to current monetary policy or interest rate changes. As such, it does not fall into the dovish/hawkish spectrum.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Bank of Latvia conference "Payments in the 22nd century: future starts today?", Riga, 3 October 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Financial stability and the European Central Bank
Key quote: The ECB's only primary responsibility is price stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the legal and institutional role of the ECB regarding financial stability, rather than monetary policy or interest rate changes. It discusses the limited role of the ECB in financial stability within the confines of EU law, making it not directly related to current monetary policy shifts.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ESCB Legal Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 6 September 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Strengthening the European financial industry amid disruptive global challenges
Key quote: Building on local or national solutions is anachronistic and will not meet the needs of the market.
Rationale: The speech mainly addresses the challenges and opportunities in the European financial industry's adaptation to digital payment systems and does not explicitly discuss monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy, although the central bank's role in providing infrastructure is mentioned.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Institute of Financial Regulation (EIFR), Paris, 3 September 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Deepening EMU - political integration and economic convergence
Key quote: The only viable option is to continue the deepening of our Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) through political and economic convergence.
Rationale: The speech focuses on deepening the EU's Economic and Monetary Union through reforms and reducing financial fragmentation, suggesting a balanced approach without a strong indication toward immediate monetary policy action like increasing or decreasing rates.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the conference on "Economic and Monetary Union - Deepening and Convergence", Linz, 5 July 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Euro clearing - the open race
Key quote: It has become evident that disturbances affecting CCPs can have an impact on monetary policy, on payment systems and, ultimately, on price stability.
Rationale: The speech focuses on regulatory reforms and the role of central counterparties in ensuring financial stability, without directly addressing current monetary policy or indicating any changes in interest rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Frankfurt Finance Summit, Frankfurt am Main, 29 May 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Virtual currencies ante portas
Key quote: Virtual currencies are a misnomer in the first place. They are not money, nor will they become money in the foreseeable future.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses virtual currencies and their potential risks and implications, rather than central bank monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 39th meeting of the Governor's Club of The Central Asia, Black Sea Region and Balkan Countries, Bodrum, Turkey, 14 May 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Innovation and digitalisation in payment services
Key quote: Innovation and digitalisation in payment services will significantly change the payments market.
Rationale: The speech by Yves Mersch primarily focuses on innovation and digitalisation in payment services rather than on monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it is best classified as 'Not related'. The prediction for the next rate meeting is a 'Hold' because there are no clear hawkish or dovish signals.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Second Annual Conference on "Fintech and Digital Innovation: Regulation at the European level and beyond", Brussels, 27 February 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Reaping the benefits of payment services in a new regulatory environment
Key quote: I would strongly encourage European payment service providers to embrace the opportunities the PSD2 provides for competition and innovation.
Rationale: This speech by Yves Mersch focuses on developments and implications of the PSD2 in the payment services landscape, rather than on core monetary policy issues like interest rates or inflation. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Banking Federation's Executive Committee, Frankfurt am Main, 22 February 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: "Rencontres du Club SEPA"
Key quote: The future of payments is instant and most countries in the euro area are moving with the times.
Rationale: The speech focuses extensively on the development and promotion of instant payments and their infrastructure, rather than discussing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the at the "Rencontres du Club SEPA", Paris, 15 February 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The role of euro banknotes as legal tender
Key quote: I will conclude by saying that printed euro banknotes will retain their place and their role in society as legal tender for a very long time to come.
Rationale: This speech focuses on the legal status of euro banknotes and their role as legal tender rather than discussing current or future monetary policy. Hence, it falls under 'Not related' to monetary policy, yet it displays a neutral stance towards cash importance, suggesting a likelihood to 'Hold'.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 4th Bargeldsymposium of the Deutsche Bundesbank, Frankfurt am Main, 14 February 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Virtual or virtueless? The evolution of money in the digital age
Key quote: Virtual currencies are not money, nor will they be for the foreseeable future.
Rationale: The speech is mainly about the nature and implications of virtual currencies, rather than traditional monetary policy considerations or outlooks, hence it is categorized as not related to monetary policy.
description: Lecture by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Official Monetary and Financial Institutions Forum, London, 8 February 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Interview with Bloomberg
Key quote: The valuations are not at a level where you would now jump from your chair and say 'you need to forbid this thing'. We are not there.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the risks and regulatory considerations of digital currencies rather than focusing directly on monetary policy. However, the cautious attention given to digital currencies suggests a neutral stance towards immediate changes in interest rates to address any risks posed by these currencies.
description: Interview with Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, and Bloomberg, conducted by Mr Piotr Skolimowski and Ms Carolynn Look on 6 February 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The limits of central bank financing in resolution
Key quote: Resolution financing is a government task, now complemented by the rules and procedures applied by the Single Resolution Board and the national resolution authorities within the framework of the SRM. Central banks provide liquidity, not solvency support.
Rationale: Yves Mersch emphasizes the independence of the central bank in providing liquidity and underscores the importance of adhering to existing frameworks and rules, which suggests a neutral stance without indication of immediate policy changes.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Institute for Monetary and Financial Stability (IMFS) Distinguished Lecture Series, Goethe University, Frankfurt am Main, 30 January 2018.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Digital transformation of the retail payments ecosystem
Key quote: Banks need to implement instant payments as soon as possible and provide an alternate narrative to the ongoing public debate on the alleged innovation brought by virtual currency schemes.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the digital transformation of the retail payments ecosystem and does not directly address current monetary policy or the policy rate, making it not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Introductory speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Joint ECB and Bank of Italy conference, Rome, 30 November 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Securitisation revisited
Key quote: The ECB places great importance on the health of the European securitisation market.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the securitisation market's importance, regulatory challenges, and potential support for monetary policy transmission, without providing clear signals for any imminent policy change, suggesting a neutral stance.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Euro Finance Week, Frankfurt am Main, 16 November 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Evolving regulatory environment for CCPs - the perspective of a central bank
Key quote: We strongly welcome the proposals to strengthen the role played by the central banks of issue of the EU in the regulatory framework, as the authorities responsible for the implementation of monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on regulatory frameworks for central counterparties (CCPs) and their impact on monetary policy, rather than explicit signals related to changes in interest rates.
description: Speaking points by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Cumberland Lodge Financial Services Summit, Cumberland Lodge, Windsor, Great Park, 10 November 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Europe in transformation - structural, regulatory and technological challenges for the markets of tomorrow
Key quote: A well-functioning financial system is of vital importance for long-term, sustainable economic growth.
Rationale: The speech addresses structural, regulatory, and technological challenges facing the banking sector, largely focusing on improving banking practices and addressing non-performing loans. It does not directly suggest any imminent changes to monetary policy, but hints at the continuation of unconventional measures, indicating a neutral stance.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Slovenian Banking Days conference, Brdo pri Kranju, Slovenia, 6 November 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Risk management in times of non-conventional monetary policy
Key quote: It is clear that, once we have seen a sufficiently sustained adjustment in the path of inflation, we will continue to prudently adjust our tool-box of monetary policy instruments.
Rationale: The speech outlines the cautious and prudent approach of maintaining non-conventional measures until inflation adjusts sufficiently, emphasizing risk management and a gradual return to conventional policies, suggesting a somewhat dovish stance focused on maintaining stability.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Joint Bank of Portugal and European Central Bank Conference on "Risk Management for Central Banks", Lisbon, 25 September 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Economic and financial priorities for relaunching the Eurozone and the EU
Key quote: The favourable economic as well as political environment present a unique window of opportunity to fix the shortcomings of our economic and monetary union and relaunch the Eurozone.
Rationale: The speech is focused on economic and financial priorities for the Eurozone rather than discussing specific monetary policy measures. This points to a neutral stance with an emphasis on structural reforms, suggesting a 'Hold' position at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum, Tallinn, 14 September 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Aligning accountability with sovereignty in the European Union - the ECB's experience
Key quote: The ECB's monetary policy provides an example of how sovereignty and accountability can - and, ideally, should - be aligned when transferring a competence to European level.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the legal and accountability frameworks of the ECB and their relationship with sovereignty in the EU, rather than discussing specific monetary policy stances or decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Legal Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 4 September 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The role of cash - customer retention and tie to the citizen
Key quote: There are valid reasons for maintaining cash, from the perspective of commercial banks and central banks alike.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the role of cash in the banking sector and the implications of digital currency, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Contribution by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, to The Banker, 1 September 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Loan-level data transparency - achievements and future prospects
Key quote: The Eurosystem ABS loan-level Initiative has made an important contribution in ensuring a high degree of transparency to enable investors to assess the embedded risks of securitisations.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the transparency and regulatory frameworks of ABS and NPLs, rather than providing insights or guidance on current or future monetary policy actions.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 5th Anniversary European Data Warehouse, Frankfurt, 4 July 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Advancing financial market integration
Key quote: To deepen integration and complete the Single Market, ambitious goals need to be supported by specific proposals.
Rationale: The speech by Yves Mersch does not discuss monetary policy decisions or implications. Instead, it focuses on financial market integration, TARGET2-Securities, and infrastructure.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Government Borrowers Forum, organised by the World Bank, Luxembourg, 18 May 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Why Europe still needs cash
Key quote: These findings confirm the appropriateness of the ECB's neutral stance on payments, which allows for both cash and cashless payments.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the importance of preserving cash in the economy and maintaining payment neutrality, rather than discussing specific monetary policy actions such as interest rate adjustments.
description: Contribution by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, for Project Syndicate, 28 April 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Central bank independence revisited
Key quote: The main point I will make is that, notwithstanding the changes in the ECB's role in the aftermath of the financial crisis, its independence remains unchanged and continues to protect its core monetary policy function.
Rationale: Yves Mersch discusses the robust nature of central bank independence despite expanded roles, indicating a conservative stance towards maintaining current monetary policy frameworks, suggesting a likelihood to hold rates rather than adjust them. The emphasis on independence suggests vigilance against inflationary pressures, which leans slightly hawkish but not aggressively so.
description: Keynote address by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the "Symposium on Building the Financial System of the 21st Century: An Agenda for Europe and the United States", Frankfurt am Main, 30 March 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Digital transformation - Europe's integrated market of tomorrow
Key quote: There is still a need for further and coordinated action in the harmonisation of post-trade processes.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial market infrastructure and digital transformation rather than directly addressing monetary policy or the policy rate, making it unrelated to immediate monetary policy decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Joint ECB and European Commission Conference "Into the future: Europe's digital integrated market", Frankfurt am Main, 31 January 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Digital Base Money - an assessment from the European Central Bank's perspective
Key quote: The most important question for the ECB is whether introducing a DBM would affect our ability to honour our mandate.
Rationale: The speech is largely focused on the potential impacts and considerations of Digital Base Money (DBM) rather than providing direct guidance on current monetary policy. It emphasizes analysis and safety principles over immediate policy changes, suggesting a neutral stance without indicating any urgency to change interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Farewell ceremony for Mr Pentti Hakkarainen, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Finland (Suomen Pankki), Helsinki, 16 January 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: 2017 - a decisive year for innovative retail payment services
Key quote: In particular, I will discuss why 2017 is going to be a decisive year for the success of innovative retail payments services in Europe.
Rationale: This speech is focused on innovations in retail payments services and does not discuss broader monetary policy or provide guidance on interest rates.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the French Payments Committee conference on "Technological innovations in payments and beyond", Bank of France, Paris, 6 January 2017.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Distributed ledger technology - role and relevance of the European Central Bank
Key quote: Exploring the potential of new technologies such as DLT is high on the ECB's strategic agenda.
Rationale: The speech focuses on digital ledger technology and does not directly discuss monetary policy or provide insights on interest rate decisions. The central bank's exploration of technology does not imply a stance on monetary policy, so it is categorized as not directly related.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 22nd Handelsblatt Annual Conference "Banken-Technologie", Frankfurt am Main, 6 December 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Comments at Financial Services summit
Key quote: We cannot be complacent with regard to the regulatory, supervisory and oversight framework for financial market infrastructures.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the stability and development of financial infrastructure with no direct references to changes in monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Comments by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at Cumberland Lodge Financial Services Summit, Windsor, 10 November 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: The next steps in the evolution of the Eurosystem's market infrastructure
Key quote: The Eurosystem's strategic reflections on the future development of its market infrastructure centre around three components: the consolidation of TARGET2 and TARGET2-Securities (T2S); settlement services to support instant payments; a Eurosystem collateral management system.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on technological and infrastructural developments within Eurosystem's market infrastructure rather than on direct monetary policy, interest rates, or inflation, which suggests no direct influence on upcoming rate decisions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Eurosystem community session at Sibos, Geneva, 26 September 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Reaching for perfection - building the market infrastructure of tomorrow
Key quote: Innovation is not a threat to the existing infrastructure, but an opportunity to make it even better.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial market infrastructure and innovations, such as distributed ledger technology, rather than on monetary policy or interest rate decisions, making it not directly related to central bank rate-setting actions.
description: Opinion piece by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, published in Eurofi Magazine, 7 September 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Introductory remarks for the discussion panel "The Future of the Euro"
Key quote: An independent central bank must be able to explain its actions and take account of political economy considerations.
Rationale: The speech does not directly address future monetary policy changes and is largely focused on the structure and future of the European Union rather than immediate economic conditions. The mention of maintaining trust in the currency and the role of the central bank suggests a balanced view that does not lean heavily towards any imminent policy action.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Ambrosetti Forum "Intelligence on the World, Europe, and Italy", Villa d'Este, Cernobbio, 3 September 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Opening remarks at the Academy of European Law
Key quote: 'The solutions to these issues are not simple, and reasonable people may well disagree on their form.'
Rationale: The speech by Yves Mersch primarily focuses on the legal, social, and political aspects tied to the European Union and not on monetary policy or central bank actions.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Academy of European Law, Luxembourg, 29 June 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Grasping the new normal of the banking industry - a view from a European central banker
Key quote: The central message of my remarks today is that we need both change and stability to secure the future of Europe's banking sector.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the need for both change and stability in Europe's banking sector, with a balanced view on competition, technological advances, and regulatory reforms. There is no strong indication of a shift towards a hawkish or dovish stance, suggesting a neutral approach.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Financial Congress, Sopot, Poland, 14 June 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Making Europe's financial market infrastructure a bulwark of financial stability
Key quote: The Eurosystem is not only helping to create a more integrated financial market but is also contributing to greater financial stability by ensuring a strong and efficient European market infrastructure.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial market infrastructure and technological changes rather than direct monetary policy decisions or interest rate changes.
description: Speaking points by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, for the Bank of France/Sciences Po research seminar "Financial stability in a digital world", Paris, 7 June 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Distributed ledger technology - panacea or flash in the pan?
Key quote: DLT has a disruptive potential in the financial market. Like the hammer that shatters glass yet can forge steel, it may bring advantages to some actors and disintermediate others.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the implications and potential of distributed ledger technology (DLT) in financial markets and central banking, rather than discussing specific monetary policy actions or economic conditions. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Deutsche Bank Transaction Bankers' Forum 2016, Frankfurt am Main, 25 April 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Shaping the future of Europe's financial market infrastructure
Key quote: In my opening remarks I want to address three issues. First, I will set out the main drivers of change that have been shaping Europe's financial market infrastructure in general and the RTGS system in particular.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the future of financial market infrastructure, technology innovation, and the Eurosystem's role as an operator, overseer, and catalyst. It does not address changes in monetary policy or interest rates.
