description: Opening remarks by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Information session on the consultative report on RTGS services, Frankfurt am Main, 22 March 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Oral hearing of the Federal Constitutional Court 16 February 2016 in the OMT proceedings
Key quote: In conclusion, I can state that OMTs are in principle available as monetary policy instruments. The conditions for their crisis and location-related activation are, however, not currently met.
Rationale: The speech focuses on explaining the legal and technical aspects of Outright Monetary Transactions (OMTs), suggesting no immediate need or plan to change current monetary policy. There is no clear indication of a shift towards either tightening or easing, thus a 'Neutral' stance is appropriate, with an inclination to hold rates at the next meeting.
description: Introductory statement of the European Central Bank by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Oral hearing of the Federal Constitutional Court in the OMT proceedings, Karlsruhe, 16 February 2016.

author: Yves Mersch
title: Growth potential and competition - what lies ahead for card payments?
Key quote: I am convinced that cards are here to stay. Moreover, there is still a huge growth potential for card transactions in the EU.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the evolution and regulation of card payments in Europe, including the role of innovation and security, without addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Yves Mersch, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Bank of France Conference on "Card payments in Europe - latest trends and challenges", Paris, 18 January 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Economics as a profession - from science to practice
Key quote: Economics involves much trial and error - you have to take decisions in the fog when you can barely see your hand in front of your face.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the economics profession, the importance of education, and the role of economists in public policy, without focusing on current monetary policy or immediate economic conditions.
description: Remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the PSE job forum, Paris School of Economics, Paris, 28 November 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Towards the retail payments of tomorrow - a European strategy
Key quote: The vision of an industry-led, pan-European retail payment solution is therefore at the heart of the Eurosystem's retail payment strategy that I have outlined this morning.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the European retail payments market and does not discuss monetary policy or interest rates, making it unrelated to central bank rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Joint Conference of the European Central Bank and the National Bank of Belgium on "Crossing the chasm to the retail payments of tomorrow", Brussels, 26 November 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview with Bloomberg
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the implications of stablecoins and digital currencies rather than directly addressing monetary policy or the central bank's view on interest rates. Therefore, it falls under the 'Not related' category. However, given the context of the time with a policy rate at -0.5%, and no immediate monetary policy indications from the speech, a 'Hold' prediction with moderate probability is a reasonable assumption.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, and Bloomberg, conducted by Ms Jana Randow and Mr Piotr Skolimowski on 10 October 2019 and published on 17 October 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Digital challenges to the international monetary and financial system
Key quote: Global 'stablecoin' initiatives, such as Libra, will prove disruptive in one way or another.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the digital challenges to the international monetary system and the potential impact of digital currencies like Stablecoins, particularly Libra. It does not address current monetary policy direction or interest rate decisions directly, making it not related to immediate central bank interest rate decisions.
description: Panel remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Central Bank of Luxembourg-Toulouse School of Economics conference on "The Future of the International Monetary System", Luxembourg, 17 September 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: European capital markets - priorities and challenges
Key quote: Advancing CMU should therefore be a top priority for the new European Commission and Parliament.
Rationale: While the speech by Mr. Cœuré touches on issues related to financial markets and interest rate benchmarks, it primarily addresses regulatory challenges and the integration of European capital markets, rather than directly signaling any changes in monetary policy stance. Therefore, it's categorized as 'Not related' to direct monetary policy decisions.
description: Dinner remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Swaps and Derivatives Association, Frankfurt am Main, 25 June 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview with the Association of German Pfandbrief Banks
Key quote: Covered bonds play an important role in the monetary policy transmission process.
Rationale: The interview primarily discusses the role of covered bonds in monetary policy transmission and harmonization efforts, rather than providing an outlook on interest rates or monetary policy stance.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, and the Association of German Pfandbrief Banks, published on 8 May 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The case for cooperation - cross-border CCP supervision and the role of central banks
Key quote: For CCPs to perform this role as adequately as possible, all relevant authorities, including central banks, need to pull on the same rope.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on cross-border CCP supervision and risk management, not monetary policy or actions relating to interest rates.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a conference on CCP risk management, organised by the Deutsche Bundesbank, the European Central Bank and the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago, Frankfurt am Main, 27 February 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Euro interest rate benchmark reform: achievements and remaining challenges
Key quote: Let me conclude by saying that, in only one year of existence, the working group on euro risk-free rates has established itself as the forum for benchmark reforms in the euro area.
Rationale: The speech focuses on euro risk-free rate benchmark reforms and does not mention monetary policy or interest rate decisions, thus it is not related to monetary policy stance.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the annual dinner of the working group on euro risk-free rates, Frankfurt am Main, 26 February 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The euro's global role in a changing world - a monetary policy perspective
Key quote: A stronger global role for the euro may have tangible consequences for the conduct of monetary policy, all of which we would need to understand and take into account when designing the common monetary policy for the euro area.
Rationale: The speech mainly discusses the international role of the euro and its implications for monetary policy, rather than advocating for immediate policy changes. The emphasis is on structural and strategic measures, contributing to a neutral stance with a likely 'hold' prediction at the next meeting.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Council on Foreign Relations, New York City, 15 February 2019.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures
Key quote: Enhancing cyber resilience is of crucial importance.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses issues related to cybersecurity and resilience within financial infrastructures, not monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the second meeting of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 7 December 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Welcome remarks
Key quote: I would like to address the importance of strengthening the foundations of the foreign exchange (FX) market.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the structure and functioning of the foreign exchange market rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Foreign Exchange Contact Group meeting, Frankfurt am Main, 28 November 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The role of the European Union in fostering convergence
Key quote: Achieving similar standards of living across our continent should speak to our highest aspirations.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the European Union's role in fostering economic convergence and does not directly address monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Conference on European Economic Integration (CEEI), Vienna, 26 November 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The new frontier of payments and market infrastructure: on cryptos, cyber and CCPs
Key quote: And the next financial crisis may well start as a cyber-incident.
Rationale: The speech primarily focused on the future of payments, clearing systems, cybersecurity, and the potential of cryptocurrencies, rather than direct monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Chair of the Committee on Payments and Market Infrastructures (CPMI) and Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Economics of Payments IX conference, Basel, 15 November 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Monetary policy and climate change
Key quote: Climate change is likely to affect monetary policy one way or the other - whether it is left unchecked or humankind rises to the climate change challenge.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the impact of climate change on monetary policy, emphasizing potential future challenges but does not indicate an immediate shift towards tightening or easing monetary policy.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a conference on "Scaling up Green Finance: The Role of Central Banks", organised by the Network for Greening the Financial System, the Deutsche Bundesbank and the Council on Economic Policies, Berlin, 8 November 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Waiting for ESTER - the road ahead for interest rate benchmark reform
Key quote: Financial market participants, on their part, should redouble their efforts to ensure a smooth transition.
Rationale: This speech focuses on interest rate benchmark reform, specifically ESTER, and not on immediate monetary policy actions like interest rate changes. Thus, it doesn't provide a clear stance on monetary policy direction.
description: Speech Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB's Money Market Contact Group meeting, Frankfurt am Main, 25 September 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview in Kathimerini
Key quote: What is essential for us is that fiscal targets for 2019 are met and that the budget composition is growth-friendly.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the progress and challenges of Greece's financial sector without indicating the need for immediate policy adjustments or changes in the ECB's approach. While recognizing issues and achievements, it does not suggest urgency for changing the current policy rate.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Kathimerini, conducted by Ms Eirini Chrysolora and published on 5 September 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Asserting Europe's leadership
Key quote: Our response to 'America first' can therefore only be 'Europe united'.
Rationale: The speech focuses on geopolitical leadership and international relations, particularly the role of Europe in global governance, rather than specific monetary policy issues.
description: Panel remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at Rencontres Économiques d'Aix-en-Provence, Aix-en-Provence, 8 July 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The future of financial market infrastructures - spearheading progress without renouncing safety
Key quote: The message I would like to convey in my remarks this morning is simple: while I share the excitement around distributed ledgers, blockchain and digitalisation more broadly, and while I believe that, like in the past, central banks should not shy away from potentially disruptive technological innovations, we should be mindful of the potential financial stability consequences and we should start by first picking the low hanging fruit and upgrading our current payment systems.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the future of financial market infrastructures and their technological advancements. While it touches on the potential impacts on monetary policy, it doesn't directly address current monetary policy stances or decisions related to interest rates. Therefore, it is best categorized as not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Central Bank Payments Conference, Singapore, 26 June 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The future of central bank money
Key quote: From today's perspective, there are no clear benefits from allowing the general public to hold digital central bank reserves, in particular in economies where demand for cash remains robust, such as in the euro area.
Rationale: The speech discusses potential future implications of digital currencies and access to central bank liabilities, but it does not suggest any immediate changes to monetary policy. Cœuré takes a balanced view, weighing potential benefits against risks, and emphasizes maintaining current monetary policy rates for now.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Center for Monetary and Banking Studies, Geneva, 14 May 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: A cooperative approach to CCP recovery and resolution
Key quote: CCPs are systemically important across border and across the EU. Any recovery and resolution planning for individual CCPs therefore requires an EU wide systemic risk assessment and a strong co-ordination at global level.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the recovery and resolution of Central Counterparties (CCPs) which is not directly related to monetary policy or the policy rate decisions of the European Central Bank at the time.
description: Panel intervention by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ILF Conference on "Resolution in Europe: the unresolved questions", Frankfurt am Main, 23 April 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Taking back control of globalisation - sovereignty through European integration
Key quote: The EU's challenge is to preserve social contracts within countries in the face of globalisation.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses themes around globalisation, sovereignty, and European integration, with little focus on immediate monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Contribution by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, to the 2018 Schuman Report on Europe, 28 March 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: A Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures
Key quote: I therefore invite you today to become part of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board (ECRB) for pan-European Financial Infrastructures - a regular forum where we can work together in a trusted environment.
Rationale: The speech focuses on cybersecurity and resilience of financial infrastructures rather than monetary policy. Thus, it is not related to central bank policy rates or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the first meeting of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 9 March 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The importance of euro interest rate benchmark reforms
Key quote: A more reliable and robust reference interest rate may also enhance financial stability.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the reforms of euro interest rate benchmarks, discussing the transition to alternative reference rates, which relates to financial stability and policy transmission rather than immediate monetary policy decisions.
description: Welcome address by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the first meeting of the Working Group on Euro Risk-Free Rates, at the ECB, Frankfurt am Main, 26 February 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Trade as an engine of growth - prospects and lessons for Europe
Key quote: Accommodative monetary policies worldwide have succeeded in boosting growth and investment and, with them, global imports.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on trade dynamics, structural and cyclical factors affecting trade growth, and the impact of automation, rather than on immediate monetary policy considerations.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the NBRM High Level International Conference on Monetary Policy and Asset Management, Skopje, 16 February 2018.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Policy analysis with big data
Key quote: Central banks have made considerable progress in recent years in integrating big new datasets into their policy analysis and decision-making.
Rationale: The speech by Benoît Cœuré focuses on the role of big data in policy analysis and the benefits and challenges it brings to central banking. It does not discuss current or future monetary policy stances, interest rate expectations, or economic conditions directly related to interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the conference on "Economic and Financial Regulation in the Era of Big Data", organised by the Bank of France, Paris, 24 November 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The known unknowns of financial regulation
Key quote: These circumstances naturally also create challenges for regulators, central banks and other policymakers.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the challenges and implications of financial regulation rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Panel contribution by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the "Rethinking Macroeconomic Policy IV" Conference, Peterson Institute for International Economics, Washington DC, 12 October 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: European CCPs after Brexit
Key quote: Our challenge today is to ensure that CCPs do not themselves become a risk to financial stability and, hence, generate potential impediments to the transmission of monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech is primarily concerned with issues related to central clearing and Brexit's impact on CCP supervision, rather than addressing monetary policy directly. Consequently, no clear stance on monetary policy is discernible, warranting a label of 'Not related.'
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Global Financial Markets Association, Frankfurt am Main, 20 June 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Cyber resilience for pan-European financial market infrastructures
Key quote: I invite you to seriously consider the creation of a high-level cyber resilience forum for pan-European financial market infrastructures.
Rationale: This speech focuses on cybersecurity and cyber resilience in the context of financial market infrastructures rather than monetary policy or interest rates, making it not directly related to any monetary stance.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the High-Level Meeting on Cyber Resilience, Frankfurt am Main, 19 June 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview in L'Obs
Key quote: The ECB's monetary policy is supporting the economic recovery.
Rationale: The interview focuses largely on financial regulation and broader economic issues rather than direct monetary policy. However, it mentions the ECB's supportive role in the economic recovery, indicating a neutral stance on monetary policy.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in L'Obs, conducted by Ms Sophie Fay and Mr Pascal Riché on 15 May, and published on 23 May 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview with Reuters
Key quote: It's clear that the deflation risk is now off the table and that is also being acknowledged by financial markets.
Rationale: The speech outlines a positive economic recovery and reduced risks of deflation, signaling a cautious optimism about economic conditions but a hesitance to adjust monetary policy prematurely. The emphasis on sustainable inflation pressures suggests a cautious approach to maintaining current rates.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, and Reuters, conducted by Mr Balasz Koranyi and Mr Francesco Canepa on 17 May 2017 and published on 18 May 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Central clearing - reaping the benefits, controlling the risks
Rationale: This speech primarily focuses on the frameworks and progress related to central clearing and its systemic implications, rather than on monetary policy or interest rate decisions of the ECB.
description: Article by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, and Chairman of the Committee on Payments and Market Infrastructures (Bank for International Settlements), published in the Bank of France Financial Stability Review, 20 April 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The perils of isolation
Key quote: Turning back the clock on international financial regulation would revive distrust, create financial fragmentation, and risk regulatory arbitrage and a race to the bottom.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the importance of international financial regulation and cooperation rather than monetary policy and interest rates. Thus, the speech is not directly related to monetary policy decision-making.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Council on Foreign Relations, New York City, 19 April 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Independence and accountability in a changing world
Key quote: As guardians of price stability in the euro area, the ECB creates the foundation for a healthy and stable European economy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the ECB's independence and accountability, rather than discussing current monetary policy or interest rates explicitly.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Transparency International EU Event "Two sides of the same coin? Independence and accountability of the European Central Bank", Brussels, 28 March 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Sustainable globalisation - lessons from Europe
Key quote: The economic case for free trade thus remains strong on efficiency grounds, like the case for using more productive technologies.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the broader themes of globalisation and European integration, suggesting adjustments without a clear bias towards tightening or loosening monetary policy. Thus, it indicates a neutral stance with a likely decision to hold rates.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the Workshop "Financial globalization and its spillovers - monetary and exchange rate policy in times of crises", special public event "25 Years after Maastricht: The Future of Money and Finance in Europe", Maastricht, 16 February 2017.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Sovereign debt in the euro area - too safe or too risky?
Key quote: Reconciling these different expectations may require a degree of fiscal risk-sharing at euro area level.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the importance of safe assets and suggests that central banks, like the ECB, could play a more structural role in providing these, which indicates a more dovish stance. The call to action for more fiscal risk-sharing and the emphasis on stabilizing monetary policy suggests an inclination to hold rates while addressing systemic issues.
description: Keynote address by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at Harvard University's Minda de Gunzburg Center for European Studies, Cambridge, Massachusetts, 3 November 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Strengthening the Greek financial system
Key quote: The ECB is committed to playing its role as the central bank for the euro area, and thus for Greece.
Rationale: While there are challenges ahead and progress has been made, the tone focuses on stabilizing and addressing existing issues rather than indicating a need for immediate policy changes. The emphasis is on continued collective commitment and implementation of agreed policies, suggesting a balanced approach without a strong lean towards tightening or easing monetary policy.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a public hearing at the European Parliament, Brussels, 12 October 2016..

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Reforming financial sector benchmarks
Key quote: And I also hope that banks will continue to participate in the panel - or decide to join or rejoin it - so as to ensure that EURIBOR as well as the other reference rates continue to play their critical role in the European economy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focused on reforming financial sector benchmarks and did not discuss monetary policy directly. The presented information emphasizes financial stability and infrastructure development rather than interest rate decisions.
description: Welcome remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the annual meeting of the Money Market Contact Group, Frankfurt am Main, 27 September 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The case for rethinking international capital flows
Key quote: The time has come to make the case that financial globalisation can be made more efficient, enduring and equitable so that it can deliver openness without compromising safety.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses capital flows and financial globalisation, with no specific references to monetary policy or interest rates. As such, it’s categorized as not directly related to monetary policy. Nevertheless, without explicit focus on policy rate changes, the neutral stance suggests holding rates.
description: Dinner speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the SUERF/PSE/CEPII Conference on "Rethinking Capital Controls and Capital Flows", Paris, 15 September 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Structural reforms on the way to a complete Economic and Monetary Union
Key quote: "It is sometimes argued that the current expansionary monetary policy discourages governments from undertaking the necessary structural reforms in the euro area. But that begs the question: why weren't these reforms carried out when interest rates were higher?"
Rationale: The speech focuses heavily on the need for structural reforms in the EU to boost potential growth and does not directly address immediate monetary policy actions or changes in the policy rate. This suggests a neutral stance towards changes in interest rates.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the International Conference on Structural Reforms in Advanced Economies, Hertie School of Governance, Berlin, 17 June 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Towards a macroprudential framework for central counterparties
Key quote: Pooling risk in CCPs brings benefits for market participants and generates positive externalities for the broader economy - provided that the propagation of risk is well understood and well regulated.
Rationale: The speech is focused on macroprudential frameworks and central counterparties rather than direct monetary policy. However, the emphasis on safety and regulation suggests a neutral stance without implications for a policy rate change.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at a policy panel discussion on the progress with new macroprudential instruments at the ESRB Conference on Macroprudential Margins and Haircuts, Frankfurt am Main, 6 June 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview in Risk Magazine
Key quote: It's about starting to develop an instrument that, in my view, will become a normal supervisory instrument, as is already the case in banking supervision.
Rationale: The speech by Benoît Cœuré in Risk Magazine primarily addresses regulatory and infrastructure concerns related to central counterparties, rather than setting interest rate policy or giving indications about the ECB's monetary policy stance.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Chairman of the Committee on Payments and Market Infrastructures (CPMI), in Risk Magazine, conducted by Ms Cécile Sourbes on 10 May and published on 19 May 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Interview in Le Parisien
Key quote: No, this discussion has nothing to do with monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the use and future of the €500 note, which is not directly related to monetary policy decisions such as interest rates.
description: Interview with Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, in Le Parisien, conducted by Mr Matthieu Pelloli and published on 11 February 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: The importance of independent fiscal councils
Key quote: At this juncture using fiscal space would speed up the euro area's return to growth and support the ECB's objective of medium-term price stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily focused on fiscal policy and the role of independent fiscal councils, rather than on monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the workshop on "Fiscal councils, central banks and sound public finances", Frankfurt am Main, 27 January 2016.

author: Benoît Cœuré
title: Cyber resilience for financial market infrastructures
Key quote: Cyber defence as a result has become not a matter of designing a hard perimeter that can repel attacks but detecting where networks have been penetrated and responding effectively where this occurs.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses cyber resilience for financial market infrastructures, which is not directly related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Mr Benoît Cœuré, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the workshop on the CPMI-IOSCO Guidance on Cyber Resilience for Financial Market Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 13 January 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: A call for Europe
Key quote: Europe's achievements are significant. Never before in the history of our continent have we lived together in such peace for so long, and never before have we enjoyed such freedom.
Rationale: Sabine Lautenschläger's speech primarily focuses on the importance of Europe's unity, its benefits, and challenges, rather than monetary policy or interest rates. References to climate change and other areas indicate more general policy concerns.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at lecture series "Mein Europa", Heinrich-Heine University, Düsseldorf, 30 October 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures
Key quote: I recently became responsible for market infrastructures and payments at the ECB.
Rationale: The speech focuses on cyber resilience and security of financial infrastructures, which is not directly related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory remarks by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the third meeting of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 28 June 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Transformation of the retail and wholesale payments landscape in Europe
Key quote: Instant payments are the new challenge currently facing payment stakeholders in Europe.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the transformation of the payments landscape and does not directly address monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the European Association of Co-operative Banks, Berlin, 14 June 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Towards a more cyber secure financial system - the role of central banks
Key quote: As we all know, cyber threats to the financial sector are continuously evolving and becoming ever more sophisticated.
Rationale: The speech focuses on cybersecurity and the role of central banks in addressing cyber threats. It is not directly related to monetary policy, hence the 'Not related' label. However, given the policy rate context, if monetary decisions were to be assumed, a 'Hold' prediction would be appropriate given the neutral nature of the speech.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the G7 2019 conference on "Cybersecurity: Coordinating efforts to protect the financial sector in the global economy", Paris, 10 May 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: A future-oriented approach to pan-European innovative retail payment solutions
Key quote: The Eurosystem wholeheartedly supports the creation of an innovative single payments market for the euro through its market infrastructure projects and policy work.
Rationale: The speech by Sabine Lautenschläger is focused on innovative retail payment solutions and the development of a single market for the euro, rather than on monetary policy or interest rates. While it discusses the role of the central bank in facilitating payments innovation, it does not provide insights or recommendations relevant to interest rate policy.
description: Welcome address by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB conference "An innovative single market for the euro", Frankfurt am Main, 6 May 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Central bankers, supervisors and climate-related risks
Key quote: Directly linked to this topic is the question of how climate change-related risk will affect the underlying factors that guide our monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on climate-related risks and their impact on the financial system, rather than on monetary policy actions or interest rate changes.
description: Panel remarks by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the NGFS (Network for Greening the Financial System) conference, Paris, 17 April 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Cross-border banking since the crisis - lessons for supervisors
Key quote: The crisis clearly showed that supervision should not stop at national borders.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses supervisory and regulatory cooperation in the context of cross-border banking, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is not directly relevant to the central banking policy rate decision.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank, at the 10 Years Vienna Initiative - Anniversary Conference 2019, Vienna, 27 March 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: The evolution of banking regulation
Key quote: My impression is that we are now between these two phases of the cycle. Between a phase where strong regulation and supervision are encouraged, and one where there are strong calls for fewer restrictions.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking regulation, the implementation of Basel III, and not directly related to monetary policy, hence the label 'Not related' is appropriate. The content suggests no immediate changes in monetary policy signaling, thus a neutral numeric score and prediction of 'Hold' in line with the policy environment.
description: Panel remarks by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Financial Stability Institute 20th anniversary conference, Basel, 12 March 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Risks to banks - from inside and out
Key quote: Interest rates are low and liquidity is still abundant and cheap, but these conditions will not last forever; there is the risk of a snapback in markets.
Rationale: The speech focused on multiple risks facing banks but did not convey a sense of urgency about monetary policy changes. Instead, it emphasized ongoing supervision and governance, indicating a balanced view on potential policy adjustments.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the 14th Asia-Pacific High-level meeting on Banking Supervision, Sydney, 13 February 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Interview with hr-iNFO
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on Brexit, the European Union, and bank supervision rather than monetary policy, providing limited insight for rate decision prediction.
description: Interview by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, with hr-iNFO, conducted by by Ms Mariela Milkowa on 29 January 2019 and broadcast on 1 February 2019.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: The banking sector - where did we end up after all the reforms?
Key quote: The overarching question is: have the reforms so far helped to make the banking sector a safer place? My answer is: yes they have, but they still need to be finalised.
Rationale: The speech is focused on banking reforms and regulation rather than monetary policy, providing no direct guidance on interest rate decisions.
description: Opening statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, to panel 1 "After all the reforms: Where did we end up?" at the 6th Frankfurt Conference on Financial Market Policy: "European Financial Markets - Too Much Variety?", Frankfurt am Main, 14 December 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Four years of Banking Union - where do we stand?
Key quote: Supervisors must continue to be tough on banks. And legislators should support them.
Rationale: The speech is primarily about banking supervision and the banking union, rather than monetary policy. Therefore, it does not provide strong signals towards altering interest rate policy.
description: Opening statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Banking Supervision, Resolution and Risk Management conference during the 21st Euro Finance Week, Frankfurt am Main, 13 November 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Good governance and the role of supervisory boards
Key quote: The supervisory board is a core element of good governance and risk-oriented management.
Rationale: The speech centers around governance and the role of supervisory boards, with no direct reference to monetary policy or interest rates. As a result, it is categorized as 'Not related'. However, the default context implies a neutral stance on interest rates.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Luncheon of Chairs of Supervisory Boards of banks in Germany, Frankfurt am Main, 6 November 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Ten years after the crisis - risks, rules and supervision
Key quote: For quite some time now, banks have operated in an environment that is kind of special. There has been a long period of loose monetary policy, low interest rates, abundant liquidity and solid economic growth.
Rationale: The speech focuses on supervision, risks, and international cooperation rather than monetary policy actions. However, the context of a long period of low interest rates and loose monetary policy suggests a neutral stance, indicating no immediate pressure to change rates.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the 13th ASBA-BCBS-FSI High-Level Meeting on Global and Regional Supervisory Priorities in Nassau, Bahamas, 30 October 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: European banking supervision - towards a common culture
Key quote: To sum up: a common supervisory culture is emerging, but it still needs to be nurtured and nudged.
Rationale: The speech focuses on European banking supervision and the development of a common supervisory culture, rather than discussing monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Eurofi Financial Forum 2018, Vienna, 6 September 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: 20 years of ESCB statistics - past achievements and future challenges
Key quote: What matters most is not the next big project or the latest database. What matters most are the high professional standards which you have all maintained in your work.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the importance of data and statistics rather than discussing current economic conditions or central bank policy actions. It does not provide insights into the speaker's monetary policy stance.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Ninth ECB Statistics Conference "20 years of ESCB statistics: What's next", Frankfurt am Main, 10 July 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Europe - past, present and future
Key quote: It's always nice to visit universities. They are special places, meant for the free exchange of ideas - places where bold thinking is encouraged and the orthodoxy challenged.
Rationale: The speech is largely a reflection on the broader historical and political context of the EU, its achievements, and future prospects, rather than its monetary policy. It doesn't contain any specific information about interest rates or monetary policy direction.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at a meeting with students at Copenhagen University, Copenhagen, 14 May 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Risk reduction in the euro area - how low can you go?
Key quote: The financial crisis demonstrated that risks need to be kept in check, both at bank level and at systemic level.
Rationale: The speech largely focuses on financial stability and systemic risk reduction in the euro area, as well as the development of the European banking union, rather than on monetary policy or interest rates directly.
description: Contribution by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, Eurofi Newsletter, 26 April 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Banking regulation and supervision - you can't have one without the other
Key quote: The financial crisis showed what can happen when banks are not safe and sound.
Rationale: The speech is focused on banking regulation and supervision, and does not discuss monetary policy or provide insights into decisions regarding interest rates.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the 9th Annual EFR Stakeholder Round Table on "Financial Fragmentation or Integration", Brussels, 22 March 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: The banks and the market
Key quote: Failure is the least desirable outcome, of course. We need banks which are profitable and resilient in the first place.
Rationale: The speech by Ms. Lautenschläger focused primarily on banking regulation, bank failures, and systemic risks, with no direct discussion on interest rates or monetary policy. Therefore, it's not related to immediate monetary policy decisions.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at a Lecture at the Florence School of Banking and Finance, Florence, 15 March 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Cyber resilience - objectives and tools
Key quote: Cyber resilience is a goal we all share.
Rationale: The speech primarily focused on cyber resilience and IT risks in the financial system, with no direct comments on monetary policy or interest rates, making it not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the first meeting of the Euro Cyber Resilience Board for pan-European Financial Infrastructures, Frankfurt am Main, 9 March 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: A stable financial system - more than the sum of its parts
Key quote: Against this backdrop, there might be a need for more active macroprudential policy.
Rationale: The speech addresses macroprudential policy and discusses risks in the financial system but does not directly advocate for changes in monetary policy, suggesting a neutral stance towards interest rate adjustments.
description: Keynote speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Dutch Banking Day 2018, 15 February 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Basel III - sense and sensitivity
Key quote: Basel III preserves risk sensitivity in a sensible way.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the implementation and impact of Basel III, which is more about banking regulation and stability rather than immediate monetary policy actions. Nonetheless, the stability of the banking system is often indirectly related to monetary policy considerations, hence a neutral stance and prediction.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Institute for Law and Finance Conference on Basel III, Frankfurt am Main, 29 January 2018.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: The European banking sector - the big challenges
Key quote: Banks must monitor and manage all these risks.
Rationale: While the speech was mostly focused on the banking sector challenges and regulatory aspects, there were mentions of potential risks in the financial system, including concerns about interest rates being too low for too long. This suggests caution with low rates thereby slightly hawkish but not indicative of a strong push towards immediate tightening, hence 'somewhat hawkish'.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the IIF European Chief Risk Officer Forum, Frankfurt am Main, 20 November 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Banking supervision - what next?
Key quote: NPLs are a joint problem, and we need to make a joint effort to resolve it.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking supervision, non-performing loans, and the responsibilities of banks and supervisors rather than on monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the Banking Supervision, Resolution and Risk Management Conference during the 20th Euro Finance Week, Frankfurt am Main, 14 November 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: European banks - the quest for the best business model
Key quote: Profitability is low for many banks.
Rationale: The speech mainly discusses the business models and challenges facing European banks, rather than commenting on monetary policy or providing insights into interest rate decisions. Hence, it is not directly related to central bank monetary policy stance.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the ECB Forum on Banking Supervision, Frankfurt am Main, 7 November 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Dealing with a globalised banking sector
Key quote: So, instead of building walls, we should come together to discuss how we can deal with a global banking sector, how we can reap the benefits and keep the risks in check.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses regulatory and supervisory reforms in the global banking sector post-financial crisis and emphasizes cooperation in implementing Basel III, rather than discussing current monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at George Washington University Law School, Washington DC, 16 October 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Is small beautiful? Supervision, regulation and the size of banks
Key quote: A proportionate approach to regulating and supervising small banks is indeed appropriate.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on banking supervision and regulation, specifically concerning the proportionality in regulations for small versus large banks. It does not directly address or infer monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at an IMF seminar, Washington DC, 14 October 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: State of play in the European banking sector
Key quote: Interest rates are still low, weighing on the profits of many banks.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the banking sector's adaptation to challenges and does not directly address monetary policy or hint at changes in interest rates.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the IIF Annual Meeting, Washington DC, 13 October 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: European banking supervision - achievements, challenges and the way forward
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking supervision, regulatory frameworks, and harmonization of rules across the European banking sector. It does not directly address monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at the ESE Conference 2017, Vienna, 28 September 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Regulation, supervision and market discipline - striking a balance
Key quote: A stable banking sector is supported by three pillars: regulation, supervision and market discipline.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking regulation, supervision, and market discipline rather than direct monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at a conference hosted by the Financial Stability Institute, Basel, 18 September 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: 100 years of women's suffrage - gender equality, freedom and democracy
Rationale: The speech is focused on gender equality, democracy, and societal issues rather than any issues related to monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it is not relevant to evaluate it on the basis of monetary policy stances.
description: Speech by Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the ECB and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, at an event marking the run-up to the centenary of women's suffrage, Berlin, 26 July 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Interview with the Financial Times
Key quote: Brexit is a challenge, but I would not overdo it either.
Rationale: The interview mainly focuses on banking supervision, Brexit impacts, and supervisory mechanisms. There is no direct discussion or indication of monetary policy measures like interest rate changes, making it not directly related to monetary policy.
description: Interview by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the European Central Bank, with the Financial Times, conducted by Ms Claire Jones and Ms Caroline Binham and published on 4 July 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Harmonisation paves the way for a European banking market
Key quote: Ultimately, harmonised rules pave the way for a stable banking market.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses regulatory harmonization and the impact of such policies on a unified European banking market, rather than focusing on monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Federal Financial Supervisory Authority 15th anniversary event, Bonn, 28 June 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Cyber resilience - a banking supervisor's view
Key quote: To sum up, we take cyber risk very seriously, and we approach it from various angles.
Rationale: The speech is focused on cyber resilience and does not touch upon monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy discussions.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the High-Level Meeting on Cyber Resilience, Frankfurt am Main, 19 June 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Supervising banks - four priorities
Key quote: But it is not only about the rules themselves; it is also about their application.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking supervision, regulation, and risk management rather than on monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the International Monetary Conference, London, 13 June 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Banks business models - keeping pace?
Key quote: Thus, we need performing and stable banks in Europe to provide loans and other services.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the challenges European banks face and the necessity for strong supervision, without hinting at any immediate changes to monetary policy. The emphasis on stability and supervisory roles suggests a neutral stance towards immediate interest rate adjustments.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Seventeenth Annual Conference on Policy Challenges for the Financial Sector, Washington DC, 1 June 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Digital na(t)ive? Fintechs and the future of banking
Key quote: There is a chance that fintechs will deeply transform the banking business. It is up to regulators and supervisors to ensure that this does not come at the cost of stability.
Rationale: The speech focuses on fintech and its implications for the financial industry and regulation, not directly addressing monetary policy or immediate changes to interest rates.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at an ECB Fintech Workshop, Frankfurt am Main, 27 March 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Taming the fire
Key quote: At the end of the day, it is only well-managed and well-capitalised banks that are able to finance the economy - even when the going gets tough.
Rationale: The speech focuses on banking regulation and risk management, not on monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Credit Risk 2017 forum, Vienna, 23 March 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Caution should be the life of banking
Key quote: Caution should be the life of banking.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses banking supervision, risk management, and Brexit implications rather than direct monetary policy or interest rate decisions.
description: Introductory statement by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Association for Financial Markets in Europe (AFME) Board Meeting, Frankfurt am Main, 22 March 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Walled off? Banking regulation after the crisis
Key quote: I am very much in favour of a strong regulatory wall, and I am convinced that it has to be global.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses banking regulation rather than immediate monetary policy or interest rates. While regulatory environment impacts economic activity, the speech does not directly address monetary policy stances like dovish or hawkish. Therefore, a neutral prediction of holding policy rates fits the broader implications of financial stability that the speech implies.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Institute of International and European Affairs, Dublin, 13 March 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: The European banking sector - growing together and growing apart
Key quote: European banking supervision stands ready to contribute to a safe and sound banking sector.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the implications of European banking supervision and regulatory responses to Brexit, without directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate adjustments.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism,at the LSE German Symposium, London, 2 March 2017.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: The European banking sector - a quick pulse check
Key quote: Attempts to explain this lack of profitability have focused on low interest rates. It is true, of course, that low interest rates are a challenge for banks.
Rationale: The speech addresses challenges faced by banks, especially around profitability in a low interest rate environment, but does not make a clear case for changing rates. Hence, it suggests stability and preparedness without leaning toward a change, implying a likely 'Hold' position.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Euro Finance Week Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 15 November 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Interview in Expansión
Key quote: Low profitability is not only due to the low interest rates.
Rationale: The speech focuses more on the supervision and structural issues in the banking sector rather than immediate monetary policy changes. While acknowledging risks, it emphasizes structural reforms and adjustments rather than advocating for monetary policy shifts.
description: Interview with Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, in Expansión, conducted by Ms Alicia Crespo on 7 July 2016, and published on 18 July 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Central bank statistics - moving beyond the aggregates
Key quote: Ladies and gentlemen, we are currently in the middle of a paradigm shift in which granular data is rapidly gaining relevance.
Rationale: While the speech delves into the importance of granular data for central bank operations and better decision-making, it does not touch on monetary policy stances or guidance related to interest rates specifically. The emphasis is on data quality and processing improvements, which are not directly indicative of a policy stance.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Eighth ECB Statistics Conference "Central bank statistics: moving beyond the aggregates", Frankfurt am Main, 5 July 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: European banking supervision - much achieved, but still much to do
Key quote: European banking supervision - much achieved, but still much to do.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on European banking supervision and regulation, without direct reference to monetary policy or interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Bundesbanksymposium "Dialogue on banking supervision", Frankfurt am Main, 1 June 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Navigating uncertainty - governance, risk management and leveraged finance
Key quote: Having said that, do I see leveraged finance as the major risk for the European banking system? I do not see it as the biggest risk, but I see a certain danger that market players see things a tad brighter than they are.
Rationale: The speech mainly focuses on risk management and supervision in the banking sector, rather than discussing central bank monetary policy or interest rates. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy decisions.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the 17th Annual Risk Management Convention by the Global Association of Risk Professionals, New York City, 1 March 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Caught in the middle? Small and medium-sized banks and European banking supervision
Key quote: The small and medium-sized institutions will not be able to avoid assessing (in detail) the efficiency of their business model - and better sooner than later.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on banking supervision and regulation, specifically related to small and medium-sized banks, rather than central bank monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Banking Evening of the Deutsche Bundesbank Regional Office in Baden-Württemberg, Stuttgart, 22 February 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: Single Supervisory Mechanism - Single Supervisory Law?
Key quote: Ladies and gentlemen, I have made the point that the regulatory playing field in Europe is not as level as it should be.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the regulatory and supervisory inconsistencies in European banking supervision. It does not address monetary policy directly, nor does it provide guidance on interest rate decisions.
description: Keynote speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the workshop of the European Banking Institute (EBI), hosted by the European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 27 January 2016.

author: Sabine Lautenschläger
title: After one year of European banking supervision, have expectations been met?
Key quote: At the heart of our work lies the question of the consequences that the sustained period of low interest rates will have for the various institutions and their business models.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on banking supervision and not directly related to monetary policy. It discusses supervisory priorities and challenges, which implies a neutral stance on monetary policy. Hence, the central bank is likely to hold rates, given the focus on risk management in a low-rate environment.
description: Speech by Ms Sabine Lautenschläger, Member of the Executive Board of the European Central Bank and Vice-Chair of the Supervisory Board of the Single Supervisory Mechanism, at the Austrian Bankers' Business Lunch, Frankfurt am Main, 13 January 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Interview with Bloomberg TV
Key quote: Just a slight slowdown so far - which, by the way, was expected.
Rationale: Vítor Constâncio expresses satisfaction with the market's understanding of the ECB's reaction function and describes the current economic slowdown as expected and within projections. His comments on QE and rate hikes are non-committal, suggesting that a hold on rates is most likely at the next meeting.
description: Interview with Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, and Bloomberg TV, conducted by Mr Paul Gordon on 17 May 2018.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Why EMU requires more financial integration
Key quote: A financial system which allocates resources efficiently and is resilient to shocks ultimately supports the transmission of monetary policy and its effect on price stability.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial integration, institutional reforms, and the Capital Markets Union rather than direct monetary policy. However, it does highlight the importance of financial integration for economic growth, implying stability in current monetary policy.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the joint conference of the European Commission and European Central Bank, Frankfurt am Main, 3 May 2018.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Ricardo Reis' contribution to macroeconomics
Key quote: Ricardo's work is macroeconomics at its best: in contact with data, innovative and with lessons for policymakers.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the macroeconomic research contributions of Ricardo Reis, rather than on specific current monetary policy issues or recommendations. Therefore, it doesn't directly indicate a stance toward interest rate actions.
description: Speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the ceremony marking the award of the 2016 Germán Bernácer Prize for Promoting Economic Research in Europe to Ricardo Reis, Madrid, 24 November 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: The future of finance and the outlook for regulation
Key quote: All the developments I mentioned would not materially change the nature of our financial system, the concept of money or the effectiveness of central banks' monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses financial regulation and the future of finance, with little direct reference to monetary policy or interest rate decisions. As such, the content does not indicate a clear stance on monetary policy, neither hawkish nor dovish, hence it's categorized as 'Not related'. The neutral numeric score and hold prediction reflect the lack of direct monetary policy content.
description: Remarks by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the Financial Regulatory Outlook Conference, organised by the Centre for International Governance Innovation and Oliver Wyman, Rome, 9 November 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Macroprudential stress-tests and tools for the non-bank sector
Key quote: I would therefore encourage authorities, including the European Commission, the ESRB but also ESMA to continue to contribute towards this goal.
Rationale: This speech primarily focuses on macroprudential stress tests and tools for the non-bank sector, making it not directly related to immediate monetary policy decisions such as changes in interest rates.
description: Remarks by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the European Systemic Risk Board (ESRB) Annual Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 22 September 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Interview with Euronews
Key quote: Growth has returned to all countries. And so, the degree of divergence has stopped, which has been ongoing since the crisis.
Rationale: Constâncio discusses the economic recovery in the Eurozone and recognizes remaining challenges without indicating a clear directive for monetary policy change. Hence, the speech is neutral, leaning towards holding interest rates.
description: Interview with Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, and Euronews, conducted by Ms Efthymia Koutsokosta on 15 September and published on 20 September.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Investment and growth in advanced economies - selected takeaways from the ECB's Sintra Forum
Key quote: This year's ECB Sintra Forum on Central Banking focused on the major real economy developments that surround and interact with monetary policy.
Rationale: The speech predominantly discusses structural and long-term economic issues, such as productivity slowdown and innovation without directly indicating a preference for immediate monetary policy changes. This suggests a neutral stance regarding policy actions.
description: Contribution of Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, Mr Philipp Hartmann (ECB) and Mr Peter McAdam (ECB) for VoxEU, 5 July 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Challenges faced by the European banking sector
Key quote: The continued weakness in bank profitability reflects a number of cyclical and structural factors.
Rationale: The speech highlights significant concerns regarding the profitability of European banks, focusing on structural and cyclical challenges without suggesting immediate changes in monetary policy. The emphasis on sustained low interest rates and economic recovery indicates a somewhat dovish stance with a likely prediction to hold rates.
description: Speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the Risk &amp; Supervision 2017 Conference, organised by the Italian Banking Association (Associazione Bancaria Italiana), Rome, 14 June 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Synergies between banking union and capital markets union
Key quote: Banking union and capital markets union are undoubtedly the two central policy initiatives to catalyse financial integration in the EU.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the synergies between banking union and capital markets union in the European Union, with emphasis on structural and regulatory aspects. It does not directly address monetary policy or interest rates.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the joint conference of the European Commission and European Central Bank on European Financial Integration, Brussels, 19 May 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Macroprudential policy in a changing financial system
Key quote: Macroprudential policy is indeed essential to complement monetary policy as the business and financial cycles are not always synchronised.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses macroprudential policy and its relationship with financial stability rather than focusing specifically on monetary policy or interest rates. Given the context, it maintains a neutral outlook on monetary policy, suggesting a prediction to hold rates.
description: Remarks by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the second ECB Macroprudential Policy and Research Conference, Frankfurt am Main, 11 May 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Resolving Europe's NPL burden - challenges and benefits
Key quote: While NPLs are rightly seen as a problem, their resolution could unlock significant benefits to the European banking system and the European economy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the impact of non-performing loans on bank profitability and potential solutions, but it doesn't suggest immediate actions affecting monetary policy, such as altering interest rates.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at an event entitled "Tackling Europe's non-performing loans crisis: restructuring debt, reviving growth", organised by Bruegel, Brussels, 3 February 2017.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Stijn van Nieuwerburgh's contribution to macroeconomics and finance
Key quote: Stijn's research stresses the importance of borrower-based macroprudential measures and the role of capital inflows.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the macroeconomic contributions of Stijn van Nieuwerburgh and macroprudential policy, rather than directly discussing monetary policy stances.
description: Speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the ceremony marking the award of the Germán Bernácer Prize for Promoting Economic Research in Europe to Stijn van Nieuwerburgh, Madrid, 16 December 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Challenges for the European banking industry
Key quote: Our monetary policy has been the only expansionary policy in the euro area.
Rationale: The speech emphasizes the limits of monetary policy and the need for regulatory adjustments, suggesting caution with further rate cuts. The somewhat optimistic outlook for normalization of inflation supports a 'Hold' decision on rates.
description: Lecture (full text, delivered in abridged form) by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the Conference on "European Banking Industry: what's next?", organised by the University of Navarra, Madrid, 7 July 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Introductory remarks at the fifth ECB conference on accounting, financial reporting and corporate governance for central banks
Key quote: I therefore wish you a productive and inspiring conference.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on accounting, financial reporting, and governance issues at central banks, which are not directly related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it is classified as 'Not related' to monetary policy.
description: Introductory remarks by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the fifth ECB conference on accounting, financial reporting and corporate governance for central banks, Frankfurt am Main, 21 June 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Margins and haircuts as a macroprudential tool
Key quote: Margins and haircuts are a determinant of the build-up of leverage via derivatives and SFTs, and are strongly interlinked with the procyclicality of that leverage.
Rationale: The speech focuses on macroprudential regulation, specifically margin and haircut requirements as tools for leverage control. It does not directly address interest rate policy or provide a stance on monetary policy.
description: Remarks by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the ESRB Conference on Macroprudential Margins and Haircuts, Frankfurt am Main, 6 June 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Principles of macroprudential policy
Key quote: The ultimate objective of macroprudential policy is to prevent and mitigate systemic risk.
Rationale: The speech focuses on macroprudential policy, which deals with the stability of the financial system as a whole, rather than monetary policy concerning interest rates directly. Therefore, it is classified as 'Not related'.
description: Speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the ECB-IMF Conference on Macroprudential Policy, Frankfurt am Main, 26 April 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Risk sharing and macroprudential policy in an ambitious capital markets union
Key quote: Europe needs to further integrate and develop its capital markets, and substantially so.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial integration, capital markets, and macroprudential policy rather than immediate monetary policy actions. Therefore, it is not directly related to central bank interest rate changes.
description: Speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at the Joint conference of the European Commission and European Central Bank on European Financial Integration and Stability, Frankfurt am Main, 25 April 2016.

author: Vítor Constâncio
title: Capital Markets Union and the European monetary and financial framework
Key quote: A well-functioning, diversified and deeply integrated capital market is of key relevance for the European Central Bank.
Rationale: The speech primarily focused on the Capital Markets Union and its implications for financial stability and integration, rather than directly commenting on immediate monetary policy actions or interest rate changes.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Vítor Constâncio, Vice-President of the European Central Bank, at Chatham House, London, 21 March 2016.
